basic_info.official_name: THE GOVERNMENT OF BRUNEI DARUSSALAM SCHOLARSHIP FOR FOREIGN STUDENTS TENABLE IN BRUNEI DARUSSALAM (BDGS)
basic_info.provider: Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Brunei Darussalam

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded. Provides full academic support.
covered_expenses: economy class air-ticket to Brunei Darussalam from the scholarship recipient’s country of origin/country of domicile prior to the commencement of the course
economy class air-ticket from Brunei Darussalam to the scholarship recipient’s country of origin/country of domicile upon completion of the course

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to International Students / Foreign Students. Specifically for international students who are studying for the first time in Brunei Darussalam.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Various disciplines / different fields of study

academic_requirements.required_degree: Diploma, Undergraduate Degree, Postgraduate Master’s Degree

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Upon completion of the program, the scholarship recipient will be required to leave Brunei Darussalam with immediate effect. A scholarship recipient is not permitted to undertake any paid employment or to serve on the staff of any country's representative mission in Brunei Darussalam during the duration of the scholarship. Applicants applying to Universiti Brunei Darussalam (UBD) must also complete an online application through UBD's admission portal.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed Application Forms (specific list not provided)
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: This prestigious scholarship offers a unique opportunity for international students to pursue Diploma, Undergraduate, and Postgraduate Master’s Degree programs at leading institutions in Brunei. Eligible institutions include: Universiti Brunei Darussalam (UBD), Universiti Islam Sultan Sharif Ali (UNISSA), Universiti Teknologi Brunei (UTB), and Politeknik Brunei (PB).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Academic Session 2025/2026

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded Scholarship. Covers all expenses for the duration of the study.
covered_expenses: Airfare: Round-trip (up to 30,000 Baht, depending on region)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International Students from all countries (excluding Thai nationals), including ASEAN and Non-ASEAN countries. Not eligible if studying in any program at Chulalongkorn University for more than one semester.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All Subjects / wide range of disciplines

academic_requirements.min_gpa: typically around 3.25
academic_requirements.required_degree: For Master's: must hold a Bachelor's degree. For PhD: must hold both Bachelor's and Master's degrees.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Strong command of English must be demonstrated, either by a certificate of English proficiency from the applicant’s prior university or by results on standardised tests like the TOEFL or IELTS.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants have to meet the given criteria to be eligible. Visit the Chulalongkorn University website to select your preferred graduate program and check its specific requirements and application date.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Certificate of graduation, Academic Transcript, English Proficiency Score
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Chulalongkorn is Thailand’s oldest and most prestigious University.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarships 2026-2027

funding_info.funding_details: Full and partial scholarship. Specific funding levels depend on prize type (first or second prize). Provides up to CNY 2000/month or CNY 10,000 for Master's and Doctoral degrees.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Varies by university. Examples: June 30, 2025 (Tianjin Normal University); June 20, 2025 (general); May 31, 2025 (Tianjin University); May 2025 (closed for 2025 intake).
timeline_info.opening_date: Varies by university. Examples: October 15, 2024 (Tianjin University for 2025 intake).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students (both prospective and current students at the university). Applicants for Master's degree must hold a Bachelor diploma and be under the age of 35. Applicants for PhD degree must hold a Master's diploma and be under the age of 40. Must be applying for or enrolled in Master's or PhD programs at Chinese Universities within Tianjin. Must meet language requirements of the higher education institutions (English proficiency certificate for English-taught programs, HSK-5 with minimum score of 180 for Chinese-instructed programs). English native speakers are exempted from English proficiency certificate.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.0 or above (for College/University applicants).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor diploma for Master's applicants.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English Proficiency Certificate for English-taught programs (native speakers exempted). HSK-5 certificate with minimum score of 180 for Chinese-instructed programs.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two letters of recommendation from professors or associate professors for Master's degree applicants.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Personal Statement including study or research plan (no less than 800 words for Master and Doctor Degree).
additional_requirements.age_limits: Under the age of 35 for Master's degree applicants.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Photocopy of ordinary passport with valid period. Study Experience Resume (uninterrupted, starting from senior middle school).

background_and_logistics.official_website: Varies by university. Examples: sie.tju.edu.cn/en/jxj/tjszfjxj/ (Tianjin University); gjjl.tjnu.edu.cn (Tianjin Normal University); studyintianjin.com (general information).
background_and_logistics.application_documents: Tianjin Government Scholarship Application Form, Personal Statement (including study/research plan, personal background, financial situation, strengths, 800+ words for Master/Doctor), Photocopy of ordinary passport with valid period, Chinese or English Proficiency Certificate, Study Experience Resume (uninterrupted, starting from senior middle school), Bachelor diploma, Two Recommendation Letters from professors or associate professors.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Assessment results publicized for one week, then submitted to Tianjin Municipal Education Commission. Scholarship list determined by experts organized by Tianjin Municipal Education Commission. Admission results announced on university websites, with Admission Notice and Visa Application Form (JW202) sent to winners from July 1 to August 31.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: One-year duration scholarship, renewable year by year. Open to both prospective and current international students.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship, government-funded, competitive scholarship program. Merit scholarship offers 2 times higher monthly stipend for those who carry out scientific projects, publish academic articles or secure 3.5+ GPA out of 4.
covered_expenses: monthly stipend up to 9000 TL per month

timeline_info.number_of_awards: over 5,000 scholarships this year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: For international students from all nationalities. Available to citizens from all countries. Different and specific scholarship programs for each level of education. Short-term scholarship programs may have additional application requirements. Individuals who are currently enrolled in programs in Turkish universities at the level of education will apply. Pay attention to academic achievements, language proficiency, and any specific conditions set by the scholarship provider.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Long-term bachelor's, master's, PhD, short-term research, merit-based scholarships, art scholarships, joint scholarship programs. Undergraduate, master's, and Ph.D. programs in a wide range of disciplines and fields, especially competitive majors like medicine and engineering. Not limited to academic fields; also includes programs in arts, culture, and sports. All fields of studies.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Undergraduate applicants typically need a minimum GPA of 70%. Postgraduate and doctoral candidates may require 75% or higher. 3.5+ GPA out of 4 for merit scholarship.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's, master's, PhD, undergraduate, doctoral, and research levels.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: TOEFL or GRE are generally NOT required, but may be under some conditions. TOEFL or IELTS may be required if the language of instruction for the selected course is English. Turkey does not accept Duolingo English Test (DET).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: A recommendation letter is required; securing strong letters of recommendation is emphasized.
additional_requirements.age_limits: For master’s programs: being under the age of 30. For PhD programs: being under the age of 35. For Research Scholarship: being under the age of 50.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Merit scholarship for those who carry out scientific projects, publish academic articles or secure 3.5+ GPA out of 4.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: All Türkiye Scholarship recipients take a one-year Turkish language course before starting their academic program—even if their degree is in English. Candidates should exhibit leadership skills and a commitment to extracurricular activities, and demonstrate cultural sensitivity.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Compelling personal statement, strong resume. For PhD applicants, a research proposal is a critical document. Specific documents are required for bachelor’s and master’s degree applications.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: A 30-question quantitative test (mathematics, geometry, logic) is held for undergraduate candidates prior to face-to-face interviews conducted by Presidential Delegations. Tests are held for candidates applying to health sciences, science, engineering, and social sciences. Candidates selected from more than 100 countries in the final list are evaluated by interview committees consisting of academics and experts. Interviews are usually held at Turkish embassies or consulates in each applicant’s home country.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Awarded to outstanding students to pursue full-time or short-term programs at top universities in Turkey. Offered in 207 Turkish universities. Aims to strengthen educational and cultural ties between Turkey and other countries by welcoming talented students from around the world. Highly competitive, with over 250,000 applications submitted last year for the 2024/2025 cycle.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Türkiye Scholarships receives applications between 10 January – 20 February annually. For Research Scholarship, applications are received 4 times a year.

basic_info.official_name: Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES)
basic_info.provider: Government of Ireland, managed by the Higher Education Authority (HEA) in collaboration with Irish higher education institutions

funding_info.funding_details: A stipend of €10,000 for one year of full-time study at the master's or PhD level, and a full tuition fee waiver from the host higher education institution.

timeline_info.opening_date: Open for 2025/26 and 2026 intakes; specific opening date not provided.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 60 annually

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Outstanding/exceptional/high-calibre international students from non-EU/EEA/Switzerland/United Kingdom countries (domiciliary of origin outside these regions).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All disciplines across eligible Irish higher education institutions.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum of a 2.1 honors undergraduate degree (or equivalent).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's, Postgraduate Diploma, or PhD (NFQ levels 9 or 10).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English proficiency test (specific tests/scores not detailed).

additional_requirements.age_limits: No age limit prescribed.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must have a conditional or final offer of admission to an eligible Irish higher education institution for a full-time postgraduate programme (Master's, Postgraduate Diploma, or PhD) at NFQ levels 9 or 10 at the time of applying for the scholarship. Applicants for a research master’s scholarship must not currently hold, or have previously held, a Council Postgraduate Scholarship. Applicants for a PhD degree scholarship must not currently hold or have previously held, any Council Postgraduate Scholarship other than those which would enable them to obtain a research master’s degree. Must be an international, fee-paying student.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Conditional or final offer of admission, Statement of Purpose/Essay (implied from application guides/videos).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Managed by the Higher Education Authority (HEA). Further details available in the 'Selection Process Infographic' on the official website.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A prestigious scholarship program funded by the Government of Ireland, in collaboration with Irish higher education institutions, and managed by the Higher Education Authority (HEA). It aims to support high-calibre international students pursuing master's, postgraduate diploma, or PhD studies in Ireland.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarships are awarded for one year of full-time study. Applications are open for the 2025/26 and 2026 academic years.

basic_info.provider: Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship. Offers a €1000 monthly allowance, totaling 9000 euros. The ITALYOU program (a.y. 2025–2026), a special project under MAECI, awards 70 new annual scholarships of €6,250 each, disbursed over 12 monthly.
covered_expenses: Exemption from Payment of enrollment and tuition fees (except regional tax and tax stamp)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students and Italian students living abroad (IRE) not residing in Italy. Applicants must hold an appropriate academic qualification required to enroll in the Italian University/Institute. Selection is based on academic merit, motivation, and language knowledge. The grant is incompatible with any other grant from the Italian Government or public institution.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Undergraduate/Bachelor’s Degree, Master’s Degree, PhD, Higher Education in Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) Programs, Italian Language and Culture Courses (advanced/short-term), Research/Training programs.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Tuition and enrollment fees are required for advanced Italian language and culture courses. Incompatible with any other Italian government scholarship. Prior admission to an Italian PhD program is required for PhD applicants.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Relevant bachelor’s degree for Master’s programs. Master’s degree for Doctoral programs. Appropriate academic qualification required for enrollment in the Italian University/Institute.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Italian A2 (CEFR) for Italian Language and Culture courses. Italian B2 (CEFR) for Italian-taught programs. English proficiency certificate for English-taught programs. A language certification issued by a language teacher of the University department may be submitted for Italian language courses at the University.

additional_requirements.age_limits: Applicants for Master’s Degree, Higher Education in Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) Programs, or Italian Language and Culture advanced courses must be at least 18 years old and not exceed 28 years by the application deadline (born after May 16, 1996), with the sole exception of renewals. Age requirements for PhD programs are not explicitly stated but implied by 'meet the age requirement for doctoral programs'.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must be admitted to a PhD program and provide a letter of acceptance from the Italian University. Applicants awarded a grant must confirm one of their listed course options.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Language proficiency certificate (Italian or English, depending on program language). Letter of acceptance from the Italian University (for PhD applicants).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Selection is based on academic merit, motivation, and knowledge of the Italian or English language, depending on the program requirements.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Prestigious scholarship offered by the Italian government to foster international talent, strengthen cultural, scientific, and technological cooperation, promote the Italian language and culture, and support Italy’s global role. Offered for the 2025-2026 academic year. Covers 143 countries and territories.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Academic year 2025-2026. Applications open April 25, 2025, and close May 16, 2025, at 2:00 PM CET (Italian time).

basic_info.provider: Hungarian Government, managed by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade, co-ordinated by Tempus Public Foundation

funding_info.funding_details: Full and partial study opportunities at all three academic levels (Bachelor’s, Master’s, and Doctorate). For programs taught in Hungarian, language proficiency is not mandatory as the scholarship includes a preparatory Hungarian language year.
covered_expenses: Monthly stipend (Doctoral level: HUF 140,000 (cca EUR 390/365) for first 4 semesters, HUF 180,000 (cca EUR 500/470) for second 4 semesters)
Accommodation (free dormitory place or a contribution of HUF 40,000/ month to the accommodation costs)

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Thousands of scholarships are awarded each year; over 12,000 Stipendium Hungaricum students currently studying in Hungary.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: For foreign students/international students from all around the world. Applicants must be high-achieving with an excellent academic track record. Applicants are eligible to apply only for scholarship types and study fields determined in educational cooperation programmes between Hungary and their specific Sending Partner. Hungarian citizens, including persons with dual citizenship, cannot apply. Current Stipendium Hungaricum scholarship holders can apply for a study programme for the next academic year.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Wide range of degree programmes. For Full degree master studies (SEGIB eligible member states): Agricultural Sciences, Arts and Humanities, Social Science, Computer Science and Information Technology, Legal Science, Economic Science, Engineering Science, Medical and Health Science, Sport Science, Natural Science, Arts, Art Education, Political Science and Public Governance. For Partial studies – master level (SEGIB eligible member states): Agricultural Science, Arts and Humanities, Social Science, Computer Science and Information Technology, Legal Science, Economic Science, Engineering Science, Medical and Health Science, Political Science and Public Governance, Sport Science, Natural Science, Arts and Art Education. Specific programs mentioned include Communication and Media Studies, English and American Studies, Applied Economics, Computer Science, Computer Science Engineering, International Public Service Studies, Dissertation Scholarship.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Scientific fields, level of education, and number of applicants vary in each country. Applicants are eligible to apply only for scholarship types and study fields that are determined in the educational cooperation programmes in effect between Hungary and the specific Sending Partner.

academic_requirements.required_degree: High school diploma for undergraduate degrees; Bachelor/Master degree certificate for graduate degrees. A detailed official transcript of the completed degree is required.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English Proficiency Certificate is required. Applicants must check the language requirements for their desired study program at the desired institution. Proof can be uploaded if previous level of studies was in the language of the selected study programme. For programs taught in Hungarian, language proficiency is not mandatory as the scholarship includes a preparatory Hungarian language year.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants are required to submit a motivation letter that is at least 1-page.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Passport (a declaration and national ID can be uploaded if passport is not yet available), Motivation Letter (at least 1-page), English Proficiency Certificate (a declaration can be uploaded if not yet available), School certificates and their translations (if not in English or Hungarian or the language of the selected study programme), Detailed official transcript of the completed degree. Specific certificates required: secondary school graduation certificate (for Bachelor/One-tier Master/Hungarian language preparatory), Bachelor degree certificate (for Master), degree certificate required by Host Institution (for non-degree specialisation), certificate about student status (for partial/exchange studies).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Online application is mandatory, typically through the Tempus Public Foundation portal (DreamApply system). Applicants may need to apply online at both the Hungarian and their national partner (e.g., HEC for Pakistan) websites. Applicants are informed about their results by the ministry of education of their country or by the national scholarship office/agency. Some universities may require further documents directly if the applicant is nominated by their country.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Launched by the Hungarian Government in 2013. Aims to promote the internationalisation of Hungarian higher education, attract top international students, strengthen international relations, and promote the reputation and competitiveness of Hungarian higher education. The program is based on bilateral educational agreements. Currently, 30 Hungarian higher education institutions are engaged.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Online application system opens around mid-November 2025. Application deadline is 15 January 2026, 2 p.m. (Central European Time). Online application and required documents submission through Tempus Public Foundation portal is expected in January – February 2026.

basic_info.provider: Flemish Ministry of Education and Training, Flemish government

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded. Includes a grant of €10,000 or €10,020 and a tuition fee waiver per academic year.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Varies by host institution. Student application deadlines for the scholarship or program leading to nomination range from January 15, 2025 (for KU Leuven program application for 2025-2026 academic year) to March 31, 2025 (for Erasmus Brussels University of Applied Sciences and Arts for 2025-2026 academic year). For the 2026-2027 academic year, the KU Leuven program application deadline is January 15, 2026. A general Master Mind application form deadline is March 15, 2025.
timeline_info.opening_date: Applications are open for 2025/26 (from April 16, 2025) and 2026/27 academic years.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 30 Master Mind Scholarships awarded by the Flemish government.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Candidates must be outstanding students worldwide. The applicant must apply to take up a Master’s degree program at a Flemish higher education institution and be accepted by the host institution to receive the scholarship. The previous degree (used to enroll for the master program) cannot have been obtained at a Flemish higher education institution. International students who have previously been enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution on credit mobility (e.g., Erasmus+) are still eligible. Students already enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution cannot apply. A minimum GPA of 3.5 is required.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master's programmes in Flanders and Brussels. Examples for KU Leuven include Master of Philosophy, Master of Economics, Master of Business Engineering, Master of Information Management, Master of Biomedical Engineering, Master of Civil Engineering, Master of Chemical Engineering, Master of Engineering (Computer Science, Electrical, Energy, Materials, Mechanical, Mathematical, Nuclear, Safety).
field_restrictions.restrictions: Preparatory programmes and distance learning are not eligible. Specific programs at the University of Antwerp for the 2025-2026 academic year are also not eligible, though not listed in the provided content.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.5 minimum
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s degree program (implying a prior Bachelor's degree or equivalent)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: An overall minimum band score of 7.0 on the IELTS test (including IELTS Indicator) or a minimum total score of 94 on a TOEFL test (including TOEFL iBT Special Home Edition). A C1 level of the Common European Framework or a C1 level on the Certificate in Advanced English (CAE) is also accepted.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must be outstanding international students. A mandatory Master Mind Scholarship Application Form and, for KU Leuven, a KU Leuven Scholarships & Master Mind Candidacy Form as an annexe are required.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Master Mind application form, required documents (specifics not fully detailed), KU Leuven Scholarships & Master Mind Candidacy Form (for KU Leuven applicants), and an official letter of acceptance from the host institution (e.g., VUB) is needed before applying for the scholarship.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Candidates must first apply for admission to an eligible Master’s degree program at a Flemish higher education institution. The host institution checks eligibility, performs a preselection, and then creates the candidate’s application file in the Mobility-Online tool. The host institution validates and submits the completed application file to the Flemish Higher Education Council. Host institutions like KU Leuven nominate eligible students who expressed interest after their program application deadline.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Master Mind Scholarship is awarded by the Flemish Ministry of Education and Training to outstanding students worldwide for Master's programmes in Flanders and Brussels. The duration is one academic year for a 60 ECTS master's programme or two academic years for a 120 ECTS master's programme. Students cannot combine this scholarship with another scholarship from the Flemish Government.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship is available for the academic years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027.

basic_info.official_name: Danish Government Scholarship (University of Southern Denmark – SDU)
basic_info.provider: Danish Government through the Ministry of Higher Education and Science

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship, covering full tuition fees and providing a monthly stipend for living expenses. Some sources mention full or partial tuition fee waivers.

timeline_info.application_deadline: For February 2026 intake: 1st September 2025 (or October 15, 2025). For September 2026 intake: 1st February 2026.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Limited number of scholarships (very limited for non-EU/EEA citizens)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Must be a non-EU/EEA citizen. Must have an undergraduate degree from a nation other than Switzerland and the EU/EEA. Must be a highly qualified applicant with strong academic achievements and credentials. Must be accepted into a full-time eligible Master’s program at SDU. Applicants eligible for the Danish State Grant cannot be considered. A separate application for the scholarship is not needed; apply for an eligible Master’s program through the SDU portal.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s degree programs, specifically in Engineering (e.g., Mechatronics Engineering). Programs offered on the Sønderborg or Vejle campuses.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Only offered for Master’s studies. Limited to specific Master’s degree programs, particularly in Engineering, and potentially restricted to certain campuses (Sønderborg or Vejle).

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor’s degree (to pursue a Master’s degree)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Possibly not required (mentioned in hashtags like #scholarshipwithoutielts and #studyindenmarkwithoutielts)

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applications that are incomplete or submitted after the deadline will not be eligible. If exempted from paying fees, must upload a scan of residence permit (including legal basis letter) or relevant diploma(s) in the application portal.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Residence permit (if fee-exempt), letter describing legal basis of permit (if fee-exempt), relevant diploma(s). Academic requirements and specific documents for individual programs are listed on program websites.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The SDU Danish Government Scholarship is a prestigious opportunity for non-EU/EEA international students to pursue a Master’s degree at the University of Southern Denmark, funded by the Danish government. It acknowledges the important investment overseas students make and assists them in their educational pursuits.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship available for 2025-2026 and 2026-2027 academic years.

funding_info.funding_details: Provides both full and partial scholarships. Full scholarship covers tuition, accommodation, living expenses, and medical insurance. Partial scholarship details are not specified. Scholarship coverage amount may vary by level. Does not include international travel expenses. Students granted CGS are disqualified from receiving other scholarships (excluding one-off awards).

timeline_info.opening_date: Application Now Open (as of October-November 2025 for Academic Year 2026/2027)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Over 50,000 international students awarded annually

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be citizens of a country other than China. Successful applicants from South Africa are required to sign a contract and return to South Africa upon completion of studies. Applicants cannot hold other scholarships (excluding one-off awards) concurrently with CGS.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: A variety of study fields, including undergraduate, postgraduate (Master's or PhD), non-degree Chinese language studies, Digital Economy, and Finance.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum of 60% for National Senior Certificate (or equivalent) for South African applicants, with specific subject marks reviewed separately for chosen fields.
academic_requirements.required_degree: High school graduate (at least) for general scholar programs; Bachelor's degree or higher for some programs; Master's degree holder for senior scholar programs. Open for undergraduate, Master's, PhD, and non-degree programs.

experience_requirements.min_years: At least three years of work experience for some programs.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience, professional training.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Valid HSK score report for Chinese-taught programs; relevant language proficiency certificates such as IELTS or TOEFL for programs taught in other languages.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two letters of recommendation in Chinese or English from professors or associate professors for graduate programs or senior scholar programs.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Under the age of 45 when applying for general scholar programs.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Successful scholarship applicants from South Africa will be required to sign a contract and return to South Africa upon completion of their studies. Students granted CGS are disqualified for receiving other scholarships (excluding all kinds of one-off awards).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Foreigner Physical Examination Form (must be complete); at least one pre-admission document from a Chinese university.

background_and_logistics.official_website: www.campuschina.org (main application system); Study in China; Campus China; various Chinese embassy/consulate websites (e.g., us.china-embassy.gov.cn, id.china-embassy.gov.cn, gothenburg.china-consulate.gov.cn, ee.china-embassy.gov.cn, bs.china-embassy.gov.cn); national government scholarship portals (e.g., scholarships.gov.gh, internationalscholarships.dhet.gov.za).
background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application Form for Chinese Government Scholarship (in Chinese or English); submitted online application copy; requested application form in English; all other supporting documentation; valid HSK score report; relevant language proficiency certificates (IELTS/TOEFL); pre-admission documents from universities; two recommendation letters (for graduate/senior scholar programs); Foreigner Physical Examination Form; DHET Application Form (for South Africa).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Application processed by Chinese Embassies/Consulates in the applicant's country (e.g., USA, Ireland, South Africa, Ghana, Indonesia, Sweden, Estonia) or through national agencies. Applicants are advised to contact their preferred Chinese universities for pre-admission documents.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A full scholarship offering invaluable study opportunities in Chinese top universities for full-time degree programs. Over 50,000 international students are awarded annually.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for Academic Year 2026/2027 are now open (generally from Oct-Nov 2025). Application deadlines vary by country/embassy, with examples including February 8, 2026 (Gothenburg), February 25, 2026 (Ireland), and September 30, 2025 (DHET form). The general application window is January-March. Funding duration may not cover study plans beyond AY 2026/2027, requiring applicants to seek additional university scholarships for exceeded periods.

basic_info.official_name: Swedish Institute Scholarships for Global Professionals (SISGP)

funding_info.funding_details: A prestigious, fully funded master’s scholarship program designed to nurture future leaders who are dedicated to advancing sustainable development and driving positive change in their home countries. It provides a comprehensive support package.
covered_expenses: Full tuition coverage – paid directly to the Swedish university each semester.
A one-time travel grant of SEK 10,000.
Membership in the SI Network for Future Global Professionals (NFGP).
Lifelong membership of the SI Alumni Network.

timeline_info.opening_date: Mid-November 2025 (for application documents and eligible master programmes publication)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 350-360 recipients for SISGP annually (e.g., 351 in 2025, 357 in 2024). Usually 4-6% of applicants are awarded the scholarship.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be highly motivated individuals dedicated to advancing sustainable development and driving positive change in their home countries. They must be a citizen of one of the eligible countries (cited as 33 or 42 in different sources) and be liable to pay tuition fees in Sweden. Applicants must apply for and be admitted to a master’s programme at a Swedish university that is eligible for the SISGP. SI welcomes applicants regardless of age or religious beliefs and aims at diversity and gender equality among scholarship holders. The scholarship aims to develop future global leaders that will contribute to the United Nations 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: One- or two-year master’s studies in Sweden, delivered in English at top-ranked universities. About 700 English-taught master's programmes are eligible, covering various fields including Gender studies and Design. Eligible master programmes are published on the official SI scholarship page.
field_restrictions.restrictions: There are no quotas for specific countries, fields of study, or Swedish universities. The number of recipients may differ depending on the quality of applications.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree equivalent to a Swedish bachelor's degree.

experience_requirements.min_years: Minimum of 3,000 hours of total work experience.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Demonstrated leadership experience in current or previous employment, or in civil society. Proof of work and leadership experience must be submitted using SI’s specific form (e.g., 2022/2023 form mentioned).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proof of English proficiency is required. IELTS (Academic): Minimum overall score of 6.5, with no section below 5.5. TOEFL iBT: Minimum score of 90. Equivalent tests may also be accepted.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two reference letters are required.
additional_requirements.career_plan: A detailed motivation letter explaining why the applicant is applying for the scholarship and how their studies will contribute to sustainable development in their country or globally.
additional_requirements.age_limits: No age restrictions.
additional_requirements.gender_requirement: SI aims at diversity and gender equality among scholarship holders.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants should submit only one scholarship application in the SI application portal, regardless of how many master’s programmes they’ve applied for at University Admissions, Stockholm School of Economics or Konstfack. Applicants are expected to build long-lasting relations with Sweden and other global professionals.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: CV (maximum 3 pages), Proof of Work and Leadership Experience (using SI's form), Two Reference Letters, Passport/National ID, Motivation Statement/Letter, Admission Proof (proof of application to an eligible master’s program at a Swedish university), Proof of English proficiency (TOEFL, IELTS, or equivalent).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The application process follows five key stages. After university admissions results are announced (e.g., March 26, 2026), SI evaluates applications that are still eligible. The scholarship is highly competitive, with selection based on meeting overall criteria and the quality of applications.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The SI Scholarship for Global Professionals is a prestigious, fully funded master’s scholarship program designed to nurture future leaders dedicated to advancing sustainable development and driving positive change. It offers a unique opportunity to develop professionally, academically, and build long-lasting relations with Sweden and other global professionals. Scholarship holders are included in the SI Network for Global Professionals (NFGP) to strengthen skills and capacities and build networks.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Mid-November 2025: SI Scholarship application documents and eligible master programmes are published. Application Deadline: 25 February 2026. University Admissions results announced: 26 March 2026. SI evaluates eligible applications after this date.

basic_info.official_name: National Scholarship Programme of the Slovak Republic (NSP)
basic_info.provider: Ministry of Education, Research, Development and Youth of the Slovak Republic

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded, covering living costs (up to €1,470 monthly) and travel allowances.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details:
Supports mobility of international students, PhD students, university teachers, researchers and artists for study, research, teaching, and artistic stays at Slovak universities and research organisations. Also supports mobility of Slovak university students, PhD students, and postdocs for stays outside Slovakia. Eligible nationality: All Nationalities. Applicants should be international students who haven’t studied in Slovakia before, but must be admitted or invited to a local university.

Ineligible:
*   International students and PhD students accepted for full degree higher education (bachelor, master, doctoral studies) in Slovakia, or those already studying in Slovakia (full degree higher education) who would like to fund their studies in Slovakia by the NSP.
*   University teachers, researchers, and artists without a PhD degree (or its equivalent) and at the same time with more than 4 years of work experience as a university teacher/researcher/artist (PhD studies are considered as work experience) on the indicated application deadline.
*   International applicants who within the period of 36 months prior to the application deadline have spent in the territory of the Slovak Republic 15 or more months (in total).
*   International applicants who are accepted for a scholarship stay in Slovakia in the framework of other scholarship programmes funded from public resources (e.g. International Visegrad Fund, Erasmus+, CEEPUS, bilateral agreements, etc.).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Broad, for study, research, teaching, and artistic stays.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Business Administration

academic_requirements.min_gpa: minimum GPA of 70%
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's (second cycle, or completed at least 2.5 years of university studies), PhD, Postdoctoral/Professional (for university teachers, researchers, artists)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: university teachers, researchers, artists, postdocs

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English level confirmation

additional_requirements.reference_letters: teacher recommendations
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must be admitted or invited to a local university; required attachments in Slovak or English language only.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: curriculum vitae, motivation letter, detailed study programme, application form, confirmation letter, teacher recommendations, English level confirmation, list of subjects, list of publications/artistic activities, detailed teaching and/or research/artistic programme
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The National Scholarship Programme of the Slovak Republic (NSP) was established in 2005 by the Government of the Slovak Republic to support the mobility of students, PhD students, university teachers, researchers and artists.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Supports stays during the summer semester of the academic year 2026/2027. The next call for applications is scheduled for 30 April 2026, targeting scholarship stays for the academic year 2026/2027.

funding_info.funding_details: This is a fully funded scholarship covering tuition, living expenses, and accommodation. It also includes a monthly stipend and health insurance. Monthly allowance varies: 65 Euros for Bachelors, 75 Euros for Masters, or EUA 85 (general).

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 500 scholarships (general); 40 fully funded awards (ARICE specific)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to foreign citizens from non-EU countries (with some exceptions for EU candidates). Applicants must demonstrate strong academic performance and good results in education.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All fields available at participating Romanian universities, including Engineering, Humanities, Arts, Sciences.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Medicine, Dental Medicine, and Pharmacy are excluded.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum average score of 7 (on the Romanian grading scale) or its equivalent ('Good' score) for the last graduated school.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree: Graduates of high school studies or pre-university studies with a baccalaureate degree or equivalent, or candidates applying for further university studies. Master's degree: Hold a relevant Bachelor's degree with at least Merit. PhD degree: Hold relevant Bachelor's and Master's degrees with at least a Merit for both degrees. All applicants must have a full Grade 12 certificate/results.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: For Bachelor's and Master's studies, programs are only available in Romanian; a mandatory preparatory year in Romanian is granted for those not speaking the language. For PhD studies, programs may be in Romanian, English, or another language set by the university. If studying in a non-Romanian language (only for PhD), applicants must prove proficiency with language certificates (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS, DELF, CEFR). No IELTS/language certificate is required if taking the preparatory year for Romanian language.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Letter of recommendation addressed to the 'Romanian Ministry of Foreign Affairs'.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Undergraduate/Master's: ≤35 years; PhD: ≤45 years. (Note: One source specifies minimum age 18 and maximum of 26 years by 01 July 2025 for undergraduate applicants).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Undergraduate applicants must have Points 1, 2 or 3 in each subject including English, Mathematics subjects relevant to the intended field of study. Having Pure Sciences/Design Technology if applying for Computing or Engineering programmes.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online application form, required documents with authorized translations (Romanian, English, French, Spanish). Specific documents include: Educational certificates (SSC, HSC, Bachelor’s, Master’s, PhD if applicable), certificate proving final year of studies/graduation exam, academic transcripts, Passport, Birth Certificate (English), CV, motivation letter, letters of recommendation, medical certificate.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applications are submitted online through the official Study in Romania scholarship platform. The Romanian Ministry of Foreign Affairs reviews applications and selects candidates. Selection stages may include document reviews, interviews, or entrance exams.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The annual scholarship program aims to promote education and cultural exchange, facilitate long-term development and deepening of bilateral relations with foreign countries, and promote Romanian higher education institutions worldwide.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications must be submitted online between 29 January 2025 and 12 March 2025 for the 2025-2026 academic year.

basic_info.official_name: Heydar Aliyev International Education Grant Program
basic_info.provider: Government of the Republic of Azerbaijan, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Ministry of Science and Education of the Republic of Azerbaijan, Azerbaijan International Development Agency

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship

timeline_info.application_deadline: Nomination by home country: May 15, 2025; Online application (after nomination) through SIACAS: June 1 to June 15, 2025; General application deadline (some sources): May 20, 2025; Uganda specific local application: April 30, 2025
timeline_info.opening_date: Applications open for 2025-2026 academic year; Call for Applications: March 26, 2025
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 100 educational grants annually

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International students from eligible countries, including members of the Non-Aligned Movement (NAM) and the Organization of Islamic Cooperation (OIC); Must not be an Azerbaijani citizen or ex-citizen; Must be officially nominated by home country government authorities

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Preparatory courses, Undergraduate, Master’s, PhD, General Medicine/Residency programs; Fields include engineering, public health, international relations, and other high-demand fields; 435 eligible study programs available
field_restrictions.restrictions: Undergraduate students are advised not to apply for medical-related degree programs in Azerbaijan universities if not recognized by their home country's medical council (e.g., Sri Lanka Medical Council)

academic_requirements.min_gpa: GPA ≥ 70% (academic marks of previous degree(s))
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate, Master’s, PhD, General Medicine/Residency programs

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Language proficiency certificate required (English, Russian, or Turkish, or language of previous education); Minimum IELTS 5 (TOEFL 40) for undergraduate programs; Minimum IELTS 5.5 (TOEFL 50) for postgraduate programs (Master’s/PhD)

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Students from Small Island Developing States
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Completed nomination form (submitted through home country's Ministry of Foreign Affairs or Education); Foreign qualifications should be equated by relevant national authorities (e.g., UNEB/NCHE for Uganda); Candidates must select Higher Educational Institutes recognized by their home country's UGC (e.g., Sri Lanka)

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application letter with recent passport photograph, age, sex, course, home district, telephone contact, email address, photocopies of academic certificates and transcripts (Uganda specific); Certificates/Transcript/Degrees
background_and_logistics.selection_process: First stage: Official nomination by home country government authorities; Second stage: Nominated candidates complete online application through Study in Azerbaijan Centralized Admission Service (SIACAS) website (portal.edu.az); Only nominated applications are evaluated
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Prestigious fully funded scholarship for international students to pursue higher education in Azerbaijan; Fosters academic exchange and strengthens international cooperation; Dedicated to National Leader Heydar Aliyev; Supports studies at leading universities in Azerbaijan
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Primarily for the 2025-2026 academic year, with some mentions of 2026-2027 (likely future cycle) and past 2024-2025 and 2020-2021 cycles

funding_info.funding_details: The Australian Government Research Training Program (RTP) Scholarship provides financial support for high-quality higher degree by research candidates. It supports both domestic and international students undertaking Research Doctorate and Research Masters degrees at Australian universities. RTP scholarships are available for a minimum of 3 years and up to a maximum of 4 years at the discretion of the Higher Education Provider (HEP) for students undertaking a research doctorate at a full-time student load, and for a minimum of 6 years up to a maximum of 8 years for research doctorate students studying at a part-time student load. The scholarship duration is typically three years and six months full-time for a doctoral degree or two years for a Research Masters degree. A living allowance of AUD $33,511 per annum (full-time) is paid as a fortnightly stipend (ACU specific). It is one of the most prominent and competitive funding options for a fully funded PhD (also master’s by research).
covered_expenses: relocation costs (up to A$2,000 at UniSC)

timeline_info.application_deadline: Federation University: 31 Oct 2025 11:59 PM (AEDT); CDU International: 30 September 2025; CDU Domestic: 31 October 2025.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: A limited number of scholarships are available.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be high-quality higher degree by research candidates, including both current and prospective Higher Degree by Research candidates. It supports domestic and international students undertaking Research Doctorate and Research Masters degrees. Candidates must be enrolled in or have a current offer for admission to a HDR program at an eligible Australian Higher Education Provider (HEP). Outstanding domestic and international candidates are supported. Doctoral students must wish to continue their education through a PhD program. Applicants must not be receiving an equivalent award or scholarship from the Commonwealth Government designed to offset fees. Students of exceptional research potential are awarded. Some universities require nomination by an enrolling school or institute. HEPs have discretion to apply selection criteria, including to prioritise specific cohorts of students, such as those undertaking a HDR for the first time. Students must be enrolled in an accredited Research Higher Degree.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All study areas (UQ); research aligns with the university's broad areas of expertise (ACU).
field_restrictions.restrictions: Federation University is currently unable to offer Research Training Program stipend scholarships to international applicants, however, there are other stipend scholarship opportunities available to international applicants.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: High GPA is generally required, with some universities using a Grade Point Average (GPA) (e.g., maximum 7 points at Newcastle) based on the applicant's most recent academic achievement. Selection panels consider academic results for prior study and research potential.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Research Doctorate, Research Masters degrees, PhD program, Professional Doctorate of Occupational Therapy, Doctor of Philosophy, Master of Philosophy, or a research-focused professional doctorate.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Prior research experience, like projects or internships, is a plus.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English Proficiency: IELTS 6.5 overall (no band below 6.0), TOEFL iBT 79, or equivalent scores. Must meet the specific university's English language requirements.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two letters of recommendation.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Candidates are required to comply with the Scholarship Conditions of Award and all applicable University policies, including those relating to satisfactory academic progress. Applicants must clearly demonstrate their willingness and capacity to establish effective supervisory support. Domestic students at UQ can select whether they would like to be considered for a living stipend scholarship in addition to a tuition fee scholarship.

background_and_logistics.official_website: The Australian Government provides general information on the RTP (education.gov.au). Specific application and policy details are found on individual university websites, such as: usc.edu.au, monash.edu, sydney.edu.au, federation.edu.au, anu.edu.au (PDF), bond.edu.au, acu.edu.au, policies.mq.edu.au, unimelb.edu.au, uts.edu.au, scu.edu.au (PDF), uq.edu.au, une.edu.au, cdu.edu.au.
background_and_logistics.application_documents: Academic transcripts, English test scores, two letters of recommendation, and a valid Bond University Letter of Offer for a PhD program or a Professional Doctorate of Occupational Therapy (for Bond).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The RTP scholarship is awarded through competitive application processes. Eligible applicants are automatically considered for all available graduate research scholarships at some universities (e.g., Monash). Universities are responsible for the application, selection, and offer process, often based on a merit-based selection process by a scholarships committee (e.g., Bond). Selection panels consider academic results for prior study and research potential. Universities have discretion to apply selection criteria and prioritise specific cohorts. The applicant may be considered for an out-of-round scholarship by the Pro Vice-Chancellor, Graduate Research, in accordance with university-specific scholarship rating criteria (e.g., Macquarie).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Australian Government Research Training Program (RTP) Scholarship provides financial support for high-quality higher degree by research candidates, funding eligible Higher Education Providers (HEPs) to support domestic and overseas students undertaking research doctorate and research masters degrees. RTP scholarships are a collective term for RTP tuition fee offset scholarships, RTP allowances, and RTP stipends. These are awarded to students of exceptional research potential and are not automatically granted. Universities administer these scholarships under the Commonwealth Scholarships Guidelines (Research) 2017 and are required to maintain publicly available policies. Some universities (e.g., Federation University) may not offer stipend scholarships to international applicants but have other opportunities. Relocation costs (e.g., A$2,000 at UniSC) may be included. Domestic students may receive a Fee Offset as part of their course offer, with stipend offers made separately. UNE administered stipend scholarships are normally offered subject to enrolment as a full-time, on campus student.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: RTP scholarships are available for a minimum of 3 years and up to a maximum of 4 years for full-time doctoral students, and 6 to 8 years for part-time doctoral students, at the discretion of the HEP. For a doctoral degree, the scholarship duration is typically three years and six months full-time, and two years for a Research Masters degree.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship program, providing financial assistance.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Around 200

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International students from developing countries or countries with bilateral relations with the Indonesian Government, seeking to pursue higher education in Indonesia. Must maintain a minimum GPA of 2.75 every semester for scholarship continuation.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Bachelor’s, Master’s, or Doctoral degrees in fields such as engineering, economics, health sciences, social studies, humanities, science, and education. Available across more than 900 to 1,475 study programs at 31 to 34 host universities.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Each study program has different requirements.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.0 for Master's applicants (Bachelor's degree); Strong academic background for Doctorate applicants (Master's degree).
academic_requirements.required_degree: High school degree for Bachelor's applicants; Bachelor's degree for Master's applicants; Master's degree for Doctorate applicants.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: TOEFL ITP of 477, TOEFL IBT of 53, IELTS of 5.5, TOEIC of 510 or equivalent (certificate must be obtained within the last 2 years).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendation letter from the Indonesian Embassy or Consulate General (only from Indonesian Representative in applicant’s country of origin); One recommendation letter from an employer or direct supervisor (if applicable, in English or Bahasa); One Academic Recommendation Letter from previous schools (in English or Bahasa); Recommendation letter from a potential research supervisor (for doctoral applicants only).
additional_requirements.age_limits: Maximum age of 40 years old.

application_documents: Recommendation letter from Indonesian Embassy or Consulate General
Recommendation letter from employer or direct supervisor (if applicable)
Academic Recommendation Letter from previous schools
Recommendation letter from potential research supervisor (for doctoral applicants only)
Passport
English proficiency test report
Academic Certificates (scanned degree certificate)
Academic Transcripts
Statement of purpose
Formal Photo
Curriculum Vitae
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Selection results announced online via the KNB Scholarship Website and officially through the Indonesian Embassy publication network.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A prestigious scholarship program and financial assistance offered by the Indonesian Government to prospective international students from developing countries, part of Indonesia’s global cooperation efforts. Offers an experience of studying in prestigious universities in Indonesia while living in one of the world’s most diverse and vibrant societies.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application period: February 17 – March 7, 2025. Immigration documents to be sent to university by July 11, 2025.

basic_info.official_name: Beca Colombia Scholarship Programme for Foreigners (Colombia Government Scholarship)
basic_info.provider: ICETEX (Colombian Institute of Educational Credit and Technical Studies Abroad)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship program. Offers comprehensive financial and academic support. Monthly stipend equivalent to three Colombian legal monthly minimum wages (approximately 3,480,000 COP or 828 USD in 2024).
covered_expenses: One-time grant for issuance of a foreign identification card

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to foreign citizens of any nationality (excluding dual Colombian nationality). Must not be residing in Colombia, nor have resided in Colombian territory for the last 6 months prior to applying, or have started studies in Colombia at the time of application. Must not have been a beneficiary of this program in previous calls. Must have a professional or bachelor’s degree.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Life sciences, natural resource sciences, production and innovation sciences, social sciences, and art and culture.
field_restrictions.restrictions: If selected, the change of academic program or university is not allowed.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 4.0 out of 5.0 on the Colombian scale
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s, Doctoral, Specialization Degree, or Perfectioning of Spanish. Applicants must hold a professional or bachelor’s degree.

experience_requirements.min_years: 1 year
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Professional experience in their field of study.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Spanish language proficiency test (DELE or SIELE) with a minimum B2 level, or another supporting certificate. The scholarship allows time and resources for students to strengthen their Spanish language skills prior to beginning their academic program.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recent academic letter of reference from a university professor where the applicant finished his/her bachelor degree (letter should be dated).
additional_requirements.age_limits: Between 25 and 50 years old.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Open to applicants from non-Spanish-speaking countries.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: No application fee required. Scholarship recipients must return to their country of origin or residence for two (2) years after the scholarship ends.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Verified copies of Educational Transcripts (University certificate-transcript in English/Spanish certifying average grade point), Recent academic letter of reference, Certificate of Spanish language proficiency (DELE or SIELE B2 level or equivalent).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Candidates are evaluated based on meeting requirements, achieving required scores, and obtaining a vacancy in the academic program offered (limited quota for some programs).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Part of Colombia’s Reciprocity Programme, designed to promote academic, cultural, and technological exchange. Maximum duration: Perfectioning of Spanish (Up to 6 months), Specialization (Up to 18 months / 3 academic semesters), Master’s (Up to 24 months / 4 academic semesters), Doctorate (Up to 48 months / 8 academic Semesters).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarships are awarded annually. For academic programs longer than 12 months, renewal must be requested from ICETEX each year.

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship is fully funded or covers tuition fees fully or partially. It needs to be applied for every year. Benefits may include a monthly living allowance.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Varies by university, generally Jan – April 2026 for the 2026 intake. Beijing Institute of Technology (BIT) mentions May 1st, 2026.
timeline_info.opening_date: Varies by university, generally January 2026. Beijing Institute of Technology (BIT) had an opening period from October 15, 2024 for the 2025 intake.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be non-Chinese citizens and in good health. They should not be receiving other tuition scholarship funds. Applicants must meet the pertinent admission requirements for international students of the Higher Education Institution (HEI) in Beijing. For some universities (e.g., Peking University, Beijing Foreign Studies University), applicants may need to be already admitted as an undergraduate or graduate student, or apply as self-funded students first and pass a preliminary review for full-time self-funded graduate programs. Citizens of all countries are welcome. Scholarship students must participate in and pass an annual review to obtain the scholarship for the following academic year.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Bachelor, Master's, Doctoral Degrees, Chinese language training, relevant advanced studies, specialized training programs.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.00 or an average score of at least 80/100 (or 70% and GPA ≥ 3.0/5.0 for some institutions). For current students applying, the average score of the previous academic year must be no less than 80/100.
academic_requirements.required_degree: For Master's programs, a Bachelor's degree is required. The previous degree should preferably be from a prestigious university or research institution.

experience_requirements.min_years: 3 years or more of work experience (specifically for International Master of Business Administration (IMBA) at UIBE).
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience (specifically for IMBA at UIBE).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: For English-taught majors: IELTS 6.0, TOEFL 75 or above, or equivalent proof of language proficiency. Applicants from countries whose official language is English are exempt from English proficiency proof for English-taught majors. For Chinese-taught postgraduate programs: HSK-5 level or above. Students applying for English-taught programs do not need to submit Chinese proficiency test scores at the time of application.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two recommendation letters from associate professors or above experts (for postgraduate studies).
additional_requirements.age_limits: Under 30 for Master's candidates.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Scholarship duration for Bachelor, Master's, and Doctoral degrees should be under 4 years. For Chinese language training, advanced studies, or specialized training, the duration should be under one year.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application Form for Beijing Municipal Government Scholarship (can be collected from institutions in Beijing or downloaded from the school’s website). University-specific application forms (e.g., 'Application Form for Foreign Students to BFSU'). Two recommendation letters (for postgraduate studies).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Higher Education Institutions (HEIs) assess applications. The International Students’ Office (e.g., at PKU) is authorized for acceptance, review, and approval. HEIs send Scholarship Admission Notice, Admission Notice, and Visa Application Form for Study in China (JW201) to candidates three months before study begins.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Beijing Government Scholarship (BGS) was established by the Beijing Municipal Government to encourage and support outstanding international students for further education in Beijing. It is offered for the 2026-2027 academic year.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The scholarship is for the 2026-2027 academic year.

basic_info.provider: Thailand International Cooperation Agency (TICA), Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Thailand

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarships covering 100% tuition, monthly living allowances, research funding, stipends, living expenses, and accommodation allowance (7,000–9,000 Baht/month depending on location).

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Over 70 postgraduate scholarships; each eligible country/territory can nominate up to five (5) candidates per course

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Candidates must be international students from developing countries, working in the government sector or in an area related to the course provided. Candidates must be nominated by the National Focal Point for International Development Cooperation (e.g., Ministry of Foreign Affairs) or by relevant central government agencies for which they currently work. The scholarship is allocated for specific member states/eligible countries/territories.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Development topics categorized under six themes: Sufficiency Economy Philosophy (SEP), Public Health, Agriculture and Food Security, Climate Change and Environmental Issues, Bio-Circular-Green Economy (BCG) Model, and other topics related to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Specific programs mentioned include Master of Science in Food Technology, Biomedical Sciences, Nursing Science, and Pharmaceutical Sciences and Technology.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 2.75 (undergraduate)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's degree

experience_requirements.min_years: 3 years
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience with the nominating agency, in the government sector, or in an area related to the course provided.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Relevant qualification requirements; relevant current work; academic standards.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Hard copy of the application form and other related documents; guidelines of the TIPP; list of eligible countries and territories.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Candidates must be nominated by their National Focal Point or relevant central government agencies, who then forward documents to the Royal Thai Embassy/Permanent Mission/Consulate-General. The application is complete when TICA receives the hard copy of documents through the Royal Thai Embassy/Mission/Consulate-General.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: TIPP was introduced in 2000 as a framework for providing postgraduate scholarships to individuals from developing countries. It aims to share Thailand’s best practices and experience, focusing on development topics, building global partnerships, and empowering students with advanced skills and knowledge.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The program has been offered annually, with mentions for years including 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2025, 2026, 2027, and 2028. Specific programs for 2024-2026 are also mentioned.

basic_info.provider: National Institute for International Education (NIIED) of the Republic of Korea

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded (for Graduate and Undergraduate programs), with a value of 1,133,330 KRW (likely monthly stipend).

timeline_info.application_deadline: October 17, 2025 (Thu) 15:00 (for 2026 GKS-U, Embassy Track, specific deadlines may vary by embassy/track); 30th September 2025 (Embassy Track) also mentioned.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 280 seats (for GKS-U 2026: Embassy Track: 150, University Track: 130)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students from over 150 countries. Applicant must be a citizen of the inviting country, and both the applicant and their parents (or legal guardians) must hold foreign nationality.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All available fields of study offered by designated universities (64 or 38 designated universities mentioned for Embassy Track).
field_restrictions.restrictions: Fields of study are not limited to the GKS program.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Equivalent to or higher than 80% in their previous degree program (for Undergraduate).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate, Associate Degree, Master or Graduate (for GKS-G), Bachelor’s or Associate Degree.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience, Research experience (mentioned by applicants as something they possess, not explicitly stated as a universal requirement).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: TOPIK for Korean proficiency; TOEFL, IELTS for English proficiency; Duolingo, General English (mentioned as 'if required').

additional_requirements.reference_letters: ONE letter of Recommendation (original, sealed in an envelope, must be submitted).
additional_requirements.career_plan: Motivations for applying, Study Plan (must clearly express why you want to study in Korea and how it aligns with career goals, may include aims to gain work experience in Korean marketing).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: GKS Applicant Agreement; Letter of Invitation (Issued by the research program university, possibly for research-specific programs).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Official graduation certificate (or diploma), final academic transcript, Personal Statement, Study Plan, ONE letter of Recommendation, GKS Applicant Agreement, Application guidelines, Application FORM – PDF, Application form – DOCS. Personal statement should include motivation for applying, educational background, significant experiences, extracurricular activities.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applications must be submitted online via the Study in Korea website. NIIED only accepts applications from embassies or universities through official documents, not from individual applicants. First round of selection institutions: Korean Embassy in your country (Embassy Track) or GKS-designated universities (University Track). Process: Apply online and submit documents → 1st documentary screening → 2nd interview screening → Final selection of recipients → Preliminary training → Start overseas study. Embassy Track applicants choose up to THREE different universities (General/Overseas Korean program) or TWO different universities (R-GKS program), and MUST apply to at least one Type B university.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Designed to attract bright international students to study in Korea, promote international exchange in the education sector, and foster mutual friendship between Korea and participating countries.

basic_info.provider: ARES (Academy of Research and Higher Education)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarships for international students and professionals from developing countries to pursue advanced academic studies and training in Belgium. Financial support is provided by ARES.
covered_expenses: Travel (Economy class on an IATA airline, maximum one return trip per academic year)
Monthly allowance for the duration of the course (Subsistence allowance)
Fixed price of €200 (Additional fees related to international travel)

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Over 200

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students and young professionals from 31 partner countries (citizens of 31 eligible countries). Candidates must be committed to making a positive difference in their communities or sectors. Aimed at fostering sustainable development in developing countries.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Multiple fields with a strong focus on development-related topics, including but not limited to: Agriculture and Environmental Sciences. Programs include a specialized bachelor's degree, ten specialized master's programs, and six continuing education programs.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 2.50 or above
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelors Degree, Masters Degree Program or Training Courses (including specialized bachelor's, specialized master's, and continuing education programs)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Young professionals

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Passive knowledge of English (reading) is required. Good proficiency in written and spoken French is required. Proficiency in the language of instruction is required.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: 2 letters of reference
additional_requirements.age_limits: No strict age restriction, but applicants are...
additional_requirements.other_requirements: A curriculum vitae and one letter of motivation are required. Applications must be completed in full and accompanied by mandatory attachments.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: A curriculum vitae, 2 letters of reference, one letter of motivation, and mandatory attachments.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: No follow-up will be given to applications that are not completed in full and are not accompanied by the mandatory attachments.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The ARES International Training Scholarships 2026-2027 offer fully funded opportunities for students and professionals from developing countries to pursue advanced academic studies and training in Belgium, aimed at fostering sustainable development.

funding_info.funding_details: Full financial support covering all study-related expenses in Belgium, including a monthly grant of €1,400.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 8-12 scholarships per Master's programme, across 20 programmes. Specific numbers vary by program (e.g., 8 for some Bachelors, 10 for many Masters, 12 for others).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to students from 29-30 selected countries in Africa, Asia, and Latin America. Candidates may apply for only one ICP Connect scholarship per year and must not already hold a VLIR-UOS scholarship. Preference given to candidates employed in higher education, government, or civil society. Age limits: Bachelor and initial master candidates must be 19-35 years old by January 1 of the intake year. Advanced master candidates must be 45 years or younger by January 1 of the intake year.
