field_restrictions.eligible_fields: 20 programmes, including Professional Bachelors (e.g., Bachelor of Hotel Management, Bachelor of Applied Computer Science), Initial Masters (e.g., International Master of Science in Agro- & Environmental Nematology, International Master of Science in Rural Development (IMRD), Master of Aquaculture (IMAQUA), Master of Epidemiology, Master of Science in Food Technology, Master of Science in Marine and Lacustrine Science and Management, Master of Statistics and Data Science, Master in Sustainable Development, Master of Transportation Sciences - Road Safety, Master of Water Resources Engineering (WRE), Master of Science in Nutrition and Food Systems, Master of Science in Sustainable Land Management, Master of Science in Tropical Biodiversity and Ecosystems), and Advanced Masters (e.g., Master of Human Settlements, Master of Development Evaluation). Five master's programs at KU Leuven are taught in English.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Candidates may apply for only one ICP Connect scholarship per year.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Varies by program: Bachelor, Initial Master, Advanced Master.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Preference will be given to candidates employed in higher education, government, or civil society.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Most Master's programs require proof of English language proficiency (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS), but requirements depend on the host university/program. Some programs may not require it.

additional_requirements.career_plan: Support changemakers aiming to drive social change in their home country or region after completing their studies.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Bachelor and initial master candidates: 19-35 years old by January 1 of the intake year. Advanced master candidates: 45 years or younger by January 1 of the intake year.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Only complete submissions will be taken into consideration. Applicants may not already hold a VLIR-UOS scholarship. Open to applicants from 30 scholarship countries.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: A photograph, IELTS or TOEFL score (English Proficiency Certificate), and other requested documents. Only complete submissions will be taken into consideration.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The ICP Connect Scholarships are fully-funded VLIR-UOS scholarships for outstanding students from selected countries in Africa, Asia, and Latin America, aiming to support changemakers driving social change in their home country or region, addressing global needs for experts in relevant fields.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are open for the 2026/2027 academic year, with programs starting in September 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship for international students.
covered_expenses: Monthly stipend of up to 9000 TL (Turkish Lira)
Living allowance (stipend) of NZ$531 per week

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 1,100 scholarships are awarded each year (more than 1,100 scholarships overall)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: For international students from eligible countries (112 developing nations, including Pacific Countries like Fiji (postgraduate only), Kiribati, Nauru, New Caledonia, Niue). Scholars must agree to return directly to their home country for a minimum period of two years after completing the scholarship to use the knowledge gained to contribute towards the social and/or economic development of their home country. Scholars and their dependants cannot remain in New Zealand for more than 14 days following the scholarship completion date. Some specific programs, like the ASEAN program, require applicants to be mid-level professionals or practitioners with at least five years' relevant work experience in disaster risk reduction.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Undergraduate and Postgraduate Degrees, vocational training, thematic training, and English language courses. Supports a wide range of fields. Key priority areas include: Climate Change & Resilience, Good Governance, Education, Health.
field_restrictions.restrictions: There are no total restrictions on the subjects that can be studied, however, applications in non-priority areas may be less likely to be successful.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.0 or equivalent; strong academic record required.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate, Postgraduate (Master's level study is preferred), and PhD studies (a maximum of 10% of scholarships awarded each year will be for PhD studies).

experience_requirements.min_years: One year full-time or two years part-time for postgraduate applicants. At least five years' relevant work experience for specific programs (e.g., ASEAN program for mid-level professionals).
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Paid, unpaid, or voluntary relevant work experience.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Applicants must meet the English language requirements of their chosen programme. Accepted tests include IELTS, TOEFL, PTE Academic, or equivalent.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Good academic record; must be an international student.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A key pillar of Aotearoa New Zealand's International Development Co-operation with a 70-year history. Approximately 1,100 scholarships are awarded each year to scholars from 112 developing nations. It supports eligible undergraduate and postgraduate international students with academic study in New Zealand, serving as development scholarships for Africans, Asians, Latin Americans and Pacific Islanders.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship for 2026-2027 intakes (July 2026, February 2027).

basic_info.provider: Association of Global Universities with the support of the Russian Government

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded, tuition-free study

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to all international students from around the world, talented foreign students, talented individuals, foreign citizens, stateless individuals, and compatriots living abroad. Applicants must not hold a doctoral degree.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: 14 broad subject areas including Artificial Intelligence, Business, Engineering, Medicine, Political Science, Russian Language and Culture. Specific examples include Materials Science & Technologies, Metallurgy, Nanotechnologies and Microsystems Technology, Technological Machines & Equipment, Technosphere Safety, Standardization and Metrology, Quality Management, Control in Technical Systems, Physics, Electronics & Nanoelectronics, Power & Electrical Engineering, Chemical Technology, Material processing technology.

academic_requirements.required_degree: bachelor's, master's, doctoral (PhD), and postdoctoral programs

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Professional Experience Certificate from Organization, relevant work experience

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: No IELTS or TOEFL needed; Russian language proficiency can be proven via university courses. IELTS/TOEFL or other certificates may be required, or applicants may be prepared for a language interview by the admitting university.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendation letters
additional_requirements.age_limits: 22 to 35 at the time of registration
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Minimum 4 semesters of Russian experience; must not hold a doctoral degree.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Motivation letter, proof of education (mandatory for Portfolio submission), Experience Letter, Any other certificates, Recommendation letters.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The application process is fully online and takes place in several stages. Applicants must register online by creating an account.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Open Doors Russian Scholarship Project is an international scholarship organized by the Association of Global Universities with the support of the Russian Government. It is aimed at talented foreign students who would like to enroll in master's, doctoral, and postdoctoral programs in Russia for free. More than 24 leading Russian universities are part of the project, offering a wide range of subject areas and access to world-class education and research opportunities.

basic_info.provider: Government of Kazakhstan; Ministry of Education and Science of the Republic of Kazakhstan

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded opportunity covering the full cost of tuition and a monthly allowance. Exclusions include travel costs and accommodation.
covered_expenses: Monthly allowance based on academic programme

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 550 (490 for Bachelor degree programs, 50 for Master degree programs, and 10 for PhD degree programs)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students who are non-citizens of Kazakhstan, including persons of Kazakh nationality who are not citizens of the Republic of Kazakhstan. Must be eligible for full-time studies at higher educational institutions in Kazakhstan.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Broad range of academic disciplines, including STEM, social sciences, humanities, and more. No explicit restriction on the field of study.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.0 out of 4.0 (or equivalent) for Bachelor's degree or specialist diploma
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's, Master's, and PhD degree programs

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS Academic: Minimum 5.5; TOEFL iBT: Minimum 46; TOEFL PBT: Minimum 453. German or French language proficiency certificates (B2 level) are also accepted.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Letter of recommendation in Kazakh, Russian, or English from the educational organization in which the applicant studied, or from the employer.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Under 35 years for Bachelor's applicants, under 40 years for Master's applicants, and under 45 years for PhD applicants.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Proposal of the dissertation research in Kazakh, Russian, or English (PhD applicants only).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed online application form, valid passport, copy of document on previous level of education (with transcript, notarized translation into Kazakh, Russian, or English).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Initial review by the selection committee to ensure eligibility criteria are met.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: https://enic-kazakhstan.edu.kz/en/post/94
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application Deadline: May 31, 2025. Result Announcement: TBD.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship covering tuition fees, monthly stipend for living expenses, accommodation, airfare (round-trip), books, medical allowance, travel, and other related costs. Visa application costs are not covered.

timeline_info.application_deadline: March 25, 2025 (final deadline for submission of applications with all required documents duly certified); April 5, 2025; April 20, 2025 (for Malaysia–Islamic Development Bank Joint Scholarship Programmes)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students from IsDB member countries and Muslim communities in non-member countries. Specific programs cater to Least Developed Member Countries (LDMCs) and Muslim Communities in Non-Member Countries (SPMC). Eligible non-member countries for SPMC 2025-2026 include Australia, Cambodia, Croatia, Ethiopia, Fiji, Ghana, India, Kenya, Liberia, Macedonia, Madagascar, Mauritius, Myanmar, Namibia, Nepal, Netherlands, Republic of Congo, Russian Federation, Rwanda, Singapore, South Africa, Sri Lanka, Tanzania, Thailand, The Philippines, Trinidad-Tobago, Vietnam, and Zambia. Beneficiaries must sign a surety bond committing to return to their home countries upon completion of studies to contribute to community development.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate, Master's (including Master of Science), PhD, Postdoctoral, and Technical Vocational Education & Training (TVET)

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Commitment to studies and to return to home countries upon completion to participate in community development through their respective professions (requires signing a surety bond).

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The IsDB offers various scholarship programs annually, including: Scholarship Program for Muslim Communities in Non-Member Countries (SPMC, launched in 1983), IsDB-ISFD Scholarship Program for IsDB Least Developed Member Countries (LDMCs), Master of Science Scholarship Program (M.Sc.), Merit Scholarship Program for High Technology (MSP) for IsDB Member Countries, and IsDB-ISFD for Technical Vocational Education & Training (TVET). There are also joint programs like the Malaysia–Islamic Development Bank Joint Scholarship Programmes and partnerships like the IsDB-QMUL PhD Scholarships. Scholarship booklets are available as essential resources.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The scholarship is offered for academic years 2024-2025, 2025-2026, and 2026-2027, with calls for applications for 2025-2026 opening in March 2025.

basic_info.official_name: The Aga Khan Foundation’s International Scholarship Programme (AKF ISP)
basic_info.study_country: Any reputable University around the world

funding_info.funding_details: Awards are structured as half grant and half loan (50% grant : 50% loan basis), where 50 percent of the award amount needs to be repaid. A limited number of scholarships are awarded each year. The award covers tuition fees and living expenses, but does not cover international travel, clothing, furniture, or living expenses for family.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Limited number of awards each year/cycle

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Outstanding scholars from selected countries who have no other means of financing their studies. Applicants must be nationals of countries where the Aga Khan Development Network runs its programmes, including Bangladesh, India, Pakistan, Afghanistan, and Tajikistan.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Selected fields of study

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.0 or equivalent
academic_requirements.required_degree: Postgraduate studies (Master's and Doctoral programs). Priority is given to Master's level courses.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Some years of work experience in their field of interest

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Fluency in English

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendation letters
additional_requirements.age_limits: Preference given to students under 30 years of age
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants must have no other means of financing their studies and demonstrate ongoing financial need.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Demonstrate good academic standing (GPA 3.0+ equivalent) and ongoing financial need to retain the award. Must have admission to a postgraduate program.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Official application form, academic transcripts, recommendation letters, statement of purpose, and proof of admission to an approved program.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Competitive application process, conducted once a year in June or July.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Scholarships for Master’s studies are granted for the entire duration of the degree course. For PhD students, scholarships are awarded for the first two years, after which alternative funding is expected.

basic_info.provider: Nuffic, Lembaga Dana Pendidikan (LPDP) for joint program

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship is a a fully funded contribution towards the costs of the course or programme. It covers costs as specified in Annex 1: Fixed reimbursements, including living expenses, tuition, visas, travel, and insurance.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Individual scholarships are offered to mid-career professionals from eligible countries (51, 55, or 30 countries in 2023, depending on the source). Applicants must be motivated, living and working in an OKP country, and proficient in English. Open to female and male professionals.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Wide range of eligible courses, including 400+ master’s programmes or short courses. Focus areas mentioned include food and nutrition security, sexual and reproductive health and rights. Priority areas are linked to specific country focus documents.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Varies, with reported minimums ranging from 3.17/4.0 to 3.5/4.0.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's degree programme or short course

experience_requirements.min_years: Minimum of two years of work experience (some sources indicate at least 3 years).
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Mid-career professionals, work experience

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English test scores are required. Typical minimums: IELTS 6.5 overall (no sub-score below 6.0), TOEFL iBT 90 or above. Abilities in English, French, or Spanish language are accepted for the course/programme.

additional_requirements.gender_requirement: Open to female and male professionals.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: OKP-LPDP is a joint scholarship programme with the Indonesian scholarship provider Lembaga Dana Pendidikan (LPDP). Co-funding is available for group trainings.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must apply for the course and indicate interest in OKP, then submit a scholarship application through the institution. Must be motivated and speak/understand English well.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Orange Knowledge Programme (OKP) promotes capacity building within organisations in eligible countries by providing training and education scholarships. It aims to advance the development of the capacity, knowledge and quality of both individuals as well as organisations. It was a 5-year programme. In 2024, Nuffic carried out a tracer study to assess the mid- to long-term effects of the Orange Knowledge Scholarships. The program acknowledged the Code of Conduct.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Multiple sources indicate the program has ended or is in its final stages. The official Nuffic page uses past tense ('gave'), and one institution explicitly states 'the OKP programme has ended'. However, some sources listed application deadlines for 2023 and even March 2024.

basic_info.provider: Government of the Czech Republic, Ministry of Education, Youth and Sports, Ministry of Foreign Affairs

funding_info.funding_details: For the academic year 2026/2027, the scholarship amounts to CZK 16,000 per month for Master's Degree students and CZK 17,000 per month for PhD Degree students. Funding is also available for a one-year Czech language course. The scholarship is fully funded.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Not specified

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Citizens from developing partner countries. Academic excellence. Applicants cannot apply for a lower degree than their highest obtained (e.g., a Master's graduate cannot apply for a Bachelor's). Some sources mention a requirement of at least two years of professional experience (paid work or volunteering) relevant to the program.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master's and PhD degree programs at Czech Public Universities. Bachelor's programs are available but often only in Czech and in limited fields. Specific eligible fields include agriculture. English-taught programs are only available in selected study programmes, such as Master in Economics and Finance (MEF) at Charles University. Scholarships for studies in the Czech language are granted based on a list of recommended areas of study.
field_restrictions.restrictions: English-taught programs are restricted to selected study programmes. Bachelor's programs are generally only available in Czech and in limited fields. The scholarship will not be granted for other fields of study in English beyond the selected ones. Czech language courses are restricted to certain countries and study fields.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Secondary education for Bachelor's programs. Bachelor's degree for Master's programs. Master's degree for Doctoral programs.

experience_requirements.min_years: 2 years
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Professional experience (paid work or volunteering experience) relevant to the program

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must pass a prescribed test as part of the selection process.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online application form. Submitted documentation categories include: Application Form, documents for Bachelor's/Master's (Czech language), documents for Master's (English language), documents for Doctoral (Czech or English language), documents for current students in CR, Recognition of Foreign Secondary Education, Recognition of Foreign Higher Education.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Includes a prescribed test.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The scholarship is governed by a Resolution of the Government of the Czech Republic No. 870 as of 27th November 2024, as part of a joint foreign development cooperation program. It offers fully funded studies at Czech Public Universities for Master's and PhD degrees, and limited Bachelor's degrees. Studies can be pursued in both English and Czech. Duration is up to 4 years for Bachelor's, 1-3 years for Master's, and 3-4 years for Doctoral programs.

basic_info.provider: Ministry of Education and Higher Education, Qatar University, Doha Institute for Graduate Studies, Education Above All Foundation, Qatar Foundation, Texas A&M in Qatar, Lusail University

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded. Offers up to QAR 12,000/month, QAR 40,000 travel grant, and recognition for academic excellence.
covered_expenses: Approved round-trip airfare from home country to study country and back

timeline_info.application_deadline: Varies by program, with deadlines ranging from October 15, 2025 (for Fulbright 2026) and October 31, 2025 (for Qatar Government Scholarships 2026-2027) to January 15, 2026 (for Doha Institute and general Bachelor/Master programs).
timeline_info.opening_date: September 1, 2025 (for Doha Institute); applications for 2026-2027 Government Scholarship Programs are officially open.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Varies significantly by partner program. Qatar University awards around 20 scholarships annually to international students. The Qatar Scholarship Programme aims for 100 new scholarships, with plans for a total of 500 by academic year 2025-2026. Education Above All commits to awarding 4,000 scholarships throughout the Middle East over a five-year expansion.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international applicants for undergraduate and graduate programs. Specific programs target youth who are long-term residents in Qatar (for Doha-based institutions), non-Qatari students living in Qatar who have studied in Qatar for at least eight years (for UDST via EAA), and graduates of high school, diplomas, bachelor's, or master's degrees. Some programs may have financial criteria for dependent students.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale for most scholarships. Top scholarships at Qatar Foundation universities require 3.5 GPA or higher. The TAMAIUYZ Scholarship requires a cumulative GPA of 3.8 or higher. Texas A&M in Qatar requires at least a 3.0 cumulative GPA.
academic_requirements.required_degree: High school graduates, diploma holders, bachelor's, or master's degree holders. Undergraduate and graduate programs are supported.

experience_requirements.min_years: 2+ years of work experience for a specific Qatar University scholarship. Not strictly required for all, but relevant internships can strengthen a profile.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience, internships

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Many scholarship programs do not require IELTS and accept English proficiency tests or prior English medium education as alternatives. However, some programs (e.g., Qatar University graduate) may require a TOEFL exam (taken within the last two years) or IELTS for international students. Proof of English language proficiency is generally a prerequisite.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two recommendation letters are typically required. A formal professional reference letter is needed for master's level education.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Some programs target disadvantaged youth.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Passport-size photo, Health Evaluation form signed by an authorized Medical Clinic, Official transcripts and academic certificates, Letter showing applicant's abilities.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Official transcripts and academic certificates, Proof of English language proficiency, Two recommendation letters, Passport-size photo, Health Evaluation form, Letter showing applicant's abilities.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Highly competitive, especially for programs like Qatar University which awards around 20 scholarships annually to international students. Honors outstanding students.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Guided by Qatar's 2030 vision and Sustainable Development Goal 4, the Qatar Scholarships program aims to ensure inclusive and equitable access to quality education and foster lifelong learning opportunities for all. It partners locally and globally with leading institutions. Since its inception in 2018, the Qatar Scholarship programme has provided more than 210 scholarships for youth in Qatar. It is part of a five-year expansion by Education Above All (EAA) to award 4,000 scholarships throughout the Middle East. Specific programs include Qatar Government Scholarship Programmes (Ministry of Education and Higher Education), Qatar University Scholarships (for undergraduates), Doha Institute for Graduate Studies Scholarships, Education Above All Foundation's Qatar Scholarship Programme (for long-term residents in Doha-based institutions, and Al Fakhoora programme for UDST), Qatar Foundation Merit Scholarships, and Texas A&M in Qatar scholarships.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2026-2027 academic year are open, with varying deadlines. The academic year 2026-2027 is expected to start in August 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: The Gates Cambridge Scholarship is a prestigious, fully funded postgraduate scholarship. It covers the full cost of studying at Cambridge.
covered_expenses: Full cost of studying at Cambridge
Normal maintenance allowance while on fieldwork as part of your PhD (does not fund other fieldwork costs)

timeline_info.application_deadline: US Citizens: October 15, 2025; Other Applicants: December 2, 2025, or January 7, 2026 (aligned with University's postgraduate funding competition/Course Funding Deadline)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: c.80 full-cost scholarships each year (80–100 students)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Awarded to outstanding applicants from countries outside the UK to pursue a full-time postgraduate degree in any subject available at the University of Cambridge. Applicants must have an outstanding academic record, demonstrated intellectual distinction, strong preparation for the proposed field of graduate study, and be ranked by Cambridge departments as academically outstanding. Scholars must show a commitment to improving the lives of others and have the academic qualifications to meet Cambridge admission requirements. Applicants can be graduating seniors or alumni of any nationality except citizens of the U.K.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Any subject available at the University of Cambridge

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Average GPA of Gates Scholars is 3.92; applicants often possess a cumulative GPA of 3.65 or higher.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Postgraduate degree (Masters or PhD). MPhil programs are typically one year, PhDs three to four years.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English language test scores (if English is not the student's first language); GRE (if required by specific graduate program).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: 2 academic letters of reference
additional_requirements.age_limits: Normally under the age of 30 (maximum age 30 according to some sources); however, other sources state there is no age limit.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Ability to argue for their selected graduate programs in specific terms and why they must pursue that training at the University of Cambridge and, more broadly, in the United Kingdom; a statement (approx. 500 words) explaining why applying for a Gates Cambridge Scholarship and how they meet the four main criteria.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed application to the University of Cambridge (including application form, 2 academic letters of reference, transcripts, and any additional materials required by the specific graduate program); Research proposal or example of your written work; English language test scores (if applicable); GRE (if applicable); Statement (approx. 500 words) explaining why applying for a Gates Cambridge Scholarship and how they meet the four main criteria.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Two-stage selection process. Applicants apply for both a Gates Cambridge Scholarship and admission to their chosen postgraduate course at the University of Cambridge. Academic departments in Cambridge nominate a small number of eligible applicants who meet all four scholarship criteria to a very high level. Nominated candidates are then invited to a short interview to assess how they meet all four Gates Cambridge criteria. Acceptance to the University of Cambridge is a prerequisite for scholarship consideration.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established in 2000 through an endowment from the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, the Gates Cambridge Scholarship program enables 80–100 students from around the world to pursue 1–4 years of graduate study at the University of Cambridge. Its mission is to build a global network of future leaders committed to improving the lives of others by selecting outstanding scholars, providing them with financial and non-financial support, and facilitating community building at and beyond Cambridge. Scholarships may be held for one to three years of study, or for the full duration of MPhil (one year) or PhD (three to four years) programs.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications open in September each year. The deadline for US citizens resident in the USA is typically October 15. For all other eligible applicants, the deadline is typically December 2 or January 7, aligned with the University's postgraduate funding competition deadlines. All required documents, including references, must be submitted by the respective deadlines.

basic_info.official_name: ETH Zurich Excellence Scholarship & Opportunity Programme

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship for international students. Two types of scholarships are offered: the Excellence Scholarship & Opportunity Program (ESOP) and the ETH-D Scholarship. The Excellence Scholarship/ESOP consists of a scholarship covering living and study expenses (CHF 12,000 per semester) as well as a tuition fee waiver. It provides full tuition coverage and a generous living.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 60 scholarships

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to excellent students both from the ETH and from other universities (national and international) wishing to pursue their Master’s degree at ETH Zurich. Supports excellent Master's students (no MAS). Applicants must have a very good result in Bachelor’s degree programme (top 10% of Bachelor’s degree programme = grade A). Applicants must not hold a Master's degree and the study must be their first education at that level. Applicants must meet ETH Zurich's admission requirements.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master's students across all subjects. Specifically mentioned: Mathematics, Physics & Life Sciences (Pure and Applied Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Bioinformatics), Management, Social Sciences & Interdisciplinary.
field_restrictions.restrictions: No MAS (Master of Advanced Studies)

academic_requirements.min_gpa: top 10% of Bachelor’s degree programme = grade A
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor’s degree programme

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: TOEFL iBT score of 100 or an overall band score of 7.0 on the IELTS is required. B2/C1 CEFR level for German-taught programs.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two reference letters must be uploaded during the application process and submitted with the Master application online.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Two reference letters
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applications are evaluated by the admission committee. The final decision for awarding scholarships in the Excellence Scholarship & Opportunity Programme rests with the Rector of ETH Zurich.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Excellence Scholarship & Opportunity Programme (ESOP) supports students with a scholarship, mentorship and a network of the ETH Foundation. It is a prestigious grant awarded to a few ETH Zurich graduate students.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2026 intake open in November 1 till November 30, 2025, and successful candidates start their Master’s programs in Autumn 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully-funded, covering full tuition fee and an annual grant for living costs (at least £15,009). Offers a competitive scholarship package.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Course-dependent, typically December or January. Specific dates mentioned include 2 December 2025, 8 January 2026, 31 January 2026, and 1 January 2026.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: over 200 new, fully-funded scholarships each year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to all nationals applying for a new full-time or part-time Master's or DPhil course at Oxford University in any subject area. Postgraduate Certificate or Diploma courses are not eligible. Applicants must be academically outstanding graduate students.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All degree-bearing graduate courses in any subject area.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Postgraduate Certificate or Diploma courses are not eligible for this scholarship.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.6 out of 4.0, with many scholars achieving 3.7 or higher. A first-class honours degree is also mentioned as an excellent academic record.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree or equivalent prior academic degree.

experience_requirements.min_years: At least 2 years of work experience (mentioned in context of MBA and general advice).
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Relevant work experience, including roles through school, part-time jobs, and internships. Strong leadership is also mentioned.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English Language Requirements: IELTS overall 7.5 (no band below 7.0), TOEFL iBT total 110.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Outstanding academic record. An excellent academic record is essential. Strong leadership.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Deserving candidates are chosen by their departments. Applicants are automatically considered for a Clarendon scholarship by applying for graduate study. Applications are assessed against outstanding academic record. An interview may be required (e.g., for MBA applicants).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Over 200 new, fully-funded scholarships each year. Supports over 400 on-course scholars from around 70 different nations. Offers the opportunity to join an active, internationally diverse, and multidisciplinary community at Oxford. Purpose is to assist academically outstanding graduate students.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Apply to your course by the December or January deadline, whichever is relevant to your course, to be considered for a Clarendon scholarship.

funding_info.funding_details: A fully funded program for emerging leaders in peacebuilding, conflict resolution, and sustainable development. Provides funding for a Rotary Peace Fellow to complete a two-year master's degree program at a Rotary Peace Center. Each year, Rotary awards up to 130 fully funded fellowships (up to 50 for master's degrees and up to 40 for certificate studies). A directed Rotary Peace Fellowship provides $75,000.
covered_expenses: Monthly stipend for room and board
One-way airfare from the airport closest to your home city to the airport

timeline_info.application_deadline: May 31 (to district), July 1 (to The Rotary Foundation), Selection results November
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Up to 130 fellowships annually (up to 50 for master's degrees and up to 40 for certificate studies)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: For Master’s Degree Program: Minimum three years of related full-time work or volunteer experience, bachelor’s degree, proficiency in English (proficiency in a second-language is strongly recommended), required TOEFL or IELTS scores for non-native English speakers, strong commitment to international understanding and peace as demonstrated through professional and academic achievements and personal or community service, excellent leadership skills. General requirement: College or university degree and at least five years experience in peace related activities. Applicants may not attend a center in their home country or country of permanent residence, with the exception of Japanese citizens or residents of Japan who have completed a course of study outside Japan and are interested in attending the Rotary Peace Center at International Christian University.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Peacebuilding, conflict resolution, sustainable development, international understanding and peace, peace related activities.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Applicants may not attend a center in their home country or country of permanent residence, with the exception of Japanese citizens or residents of Japan who have completed a course of study outside Japan and are interested in attending the Rotary Peace Center at International Christian University.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: At least 3.0 (for Duke University)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree / College or university degree

experience_requirements.min_years: Minimum three years of related full-time work or volunteer experience (for Master's Degree Program); at least five years experience in peace related activities (general).
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Related full-time work or volunteer experience, peace related activities

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Required TOEFL or IELTS scores for non-native English speakers (for master’s degree program only); GRE scores (required for consideration to UNC; highly recommended for all Duke-UNC Rotary Peace Center Candidates).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Required recommendations (one academic and one professional for Master’s degree program; two professional, one from a current employer for Professional development certificate program); optional club recommendation.
additional_requirements.age_limits: No age limit / No upper age limit to applying.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants may not attend a center in their home country or country of permanent residence, with the exception of Japanese citizens or residents of Japan who have completed a course of study outside Japan and are interested in attending the Rotary Peace Center at International Christian University.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Strong commitment to international understanding and peace as demonstrated through professional and academic achievements and personal or community service, excellent leadership skills, candidate’s certification (signed and dated), written essay.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Fully completed and signed application, written essay, recommendation forms, undergraduate transcripts (required for master’s degree program only), TOEFL or IELTS scores (required for all non-native English speakers for master’s degree program only), GRE scores (required for consideration to UNC; highly recommended for all Duke-UNC Rotary Peace Center Candidates), district endorsement, candidate’s certification (signed and dated), résumé or curriculum vitae.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Application selection results November.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Rotary Peace Fellowship is a fully funded program for emerging leaders in peacebuilding, conflict resolution, and sustainable development. It increases the capacity of dedicated peacebuilders from communities. More than 1,700 program alumni are working in more than 140 countries. Provides funding for a Rotary Peace Fellow to complete a two-year master's degree program at a Rotary Peace Center. Each year, Rotary awards up to 130 fully funded fellowships for dedicated leaders from around the world to study at one of our peace centers, including up to 50 for master's degrees and up to 40 for certificate studies at premier universities.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application available online February. Application due to district 31 May. Endorsed applications due to The Rotary Foundation 1 July. Application selection results November.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded

timeline_info.application_deadline: 7 January 2026 (or relevant December/January deadline for your course)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Around 35 each year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International students/global students, mainly from developing and emerging economies, or those who would not otherwise be able to support themselves. Must be outstanding university graduates and professionals, high calibre graduates and early career professionals, passionate about social change in their home countries. Must apply for a new full-time graduate course at the University of Oxford. Only those offered a place at Oxford are eligible. Must be a national and resident of (specific countries not listed).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Law, Policy, and other eligible graduate courses (specific list incomplete)
field_restrictions.restrictions: Limited to 1-year master-level courses. Does not support Doctorates (DPhil).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum 2.8/4.0, 3.5/4.0, or 3.7/4.0 (or equivalent) depending on the source
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree (to pursue a master's degree)

experience_requirements.min_years: At least 2 years of full-time work experience (after bachelor's degree)
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS Academic: Minimum 7.0 overall, 6.5 per section. TOEFL iBT: Minimum (score not specified). English proficiency required.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two academic and/or (type not fully specified)
additional_requirements.age_limits: Typically, applicants should be under a certain age, which may vary by program (specific age not provided)
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Completion of at least one academic semester or quarter by the application deadline.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must apply via the University of Oxford website with graduate course application. Must select the Weidenfeld-Hoffmann Scholarships and Leadership Programme in the University of Oxford Scholarships section of the graduate application form.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Official academic transcripts from previous institutions. (Other documents implied but not listed).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Includes an interview. Decisions expected by the end of May 2026.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Cultivates global leaders of tomorrow, providing fully-funded graduate studies at Oxford, combined with a comprehensive programme of leadership development, long-term mentoring, and networking. A global scholarships programme for young leaders passionate about social change in their home countries.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications open (no specific date given). Application deadline is 7 January 2026 (or relevant December/January deadline for your course). Decisions are expected by the end of May 2026.

basic_info.provider: Commonwealth Scholarship Commission (CSC) in the UK; UK government scholarship scheme led by international development objectives; Funded by the Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Department (FCDO)

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship covers full tuition fees, airfare to and from the UK, and living expenses. Beyond financial support, it represents a commitment. Covers tuition fees, monthly living expenses, airfare, and additional allowances.
covered_expenses: airfare to and from the UK

timeline_info.application_deadline: October 14, 2025 (for 2026/2027 academic year, with some sources indicating up to October 21, 2025)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 300 of these scholarships are awarded each year (for Master's). The CSC awards around 700-750 scholarships and fellowships for postgraduate study and professional development to Commonwealth citizens each year across all award types.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Candidates must be from a Commonwealth country and would not otherwise be able to afford to study in the UK. Aimed at students from across the Commonwealth, specifically from eligible low and middle income Commonwealth countries.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All Commonwealth Scholarships are offered under six CSC development themes: Science and technology for development; Strengthening health systems and capacity; Promoting global prosperity (other themes not specified in content). Candidates must apply for an area of study under these themes.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: For Nigerian applicants: 1st Class or 2nd Class Upper Division for Master's in his/her 1st Degree. General guidance suggests a minimum academic record of a 2:2 undergraduate degree.
academic_requirements.required_degree: 1st Degree (undergraduate degree) to apply for a Master's scholarship.

experience_requirements.min_years: Not explicitly mandated by the official eligibility criteria. However, some sources indicate 'at least two years of relevant full-time (or equivalent) work experience' and require details of employment history.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Employment history, explaining how the experience gained supports and is relevant to the programme to be undertaken.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Minimum score on an English language proficiency test such as IELTS or TOEFL may be required. English Language requirement is part of academic conditions of offer.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Personal reference required.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must demonstrate financial need for the scholarship. Candidates must complete an application using the CSC’s online application system, in addition to any other application required to be completed by the nominating agency. The CSC does not accept direct applications. For Nigerian applicants: must have gotten at least two admissions from UK Universities (contradicted by CSC FAQ stating university admission/offer letter is not required at the application stage and is not an eligibility requirement for the CSC). Academic conditions of offer include submission of certificates, transcripts, and passport.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Certificates, transcripts, English Language requirement, passport. PhD candidates must attach a supporting statement from the UK University (mentioned in context of Nigerian Master's advert).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The CSC does not accept direct applications. Candidates apply through nominating agencies (e.g., national nominating agencies, universities, or non-governmental organisations like Canon Collins Trust). Agencies will nominate candidates to the CSC by December of the application year. Provisionally selected candidates are notified, with the award subject to the CSC agreeing terms of admission to the university.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Commonwealth Scholarships are managed by the Commonwealth Scholarship Commission (CSC) in the UK. It is a UK government scholarship scheme led by international development objectives, aimed at students from across the Commonwealth who would not otherwise be able to afford to study in the UK.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded postgraduate award covering all expenses for two or more years of study at the University of Oxford. Provides an annual stipend.
covered_expenses: Annual stipend (to cover accommodation and living expenses)
Travel costs to and from the UK (flights)

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Varies by country; Scholars selected annually from 64 countries around the world. (For context, 32 awards are given to US applicants annually.)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to exceptional young people from all over the world, in all fields of study, who are committed to being of service, impatient with the way things are, and have the courage to act. Candidates with strong connections to two or more Rhodes constituencies, but who do not meet their specific eligibility criteria, may consider Inter-Jurisdictional Consideration rather than the Global Scholarship.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Most full-time postgraduate courses in almost any field offered by Oxford University.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Excludes professional degree programs such as law and medicine. Cannot be used to cover the final year(s) of a postgraduate course already underway at the University of Oxford.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.7, with successful applicants typically having 3.8 or higher (some sources suggest 3.9-4.0 GPA for US applicants).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Applicants must have satisfactorily completed two years of full-time study and received a bachelor’s degree, or will have in the year following the Rhodes Scholarship application. Applications are usually made in the final year of undergraduate or postgraduate studies for post-bachelor graduate degrees at Oxford.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Meet Oxford's English language requirements (e.g., IELTS Academic or TOEFL IBT). English proficiency test results must be submitted by the Global Rhodes Scholarship application deadline of 31 July 2025.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: A total of four referees are required for the Global Scholarship application (minimum three academic). For US Rhodes Scholarship, 5-8 letters of recommendation are typically required.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Candidates should describe their immediate plans upon completion of their Marshall or Rhodes Scholarship and why two years spent undertaking a degree in the UK would enhance these plans (150 words max for Post Scholarship Plan).
additional_requirements.age_limits: Generally, applicants must be aged 18-23 on 1st October of the application year (e.g., born after 1 October 2001 and before 2 October 2007 for 2025 application cycle). There is conflicting information regarding age relaxation; some sources state it's possible if a degree was completed later, while others state age limits are immovable.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Age relaxation may be possible if a degree was completed at a later stage (contradictory information exists). Permanent residents of the US and DACA students are eligible to apply for the US Rhodes. Inter-Jurisdictional Consideration is available for those with strong connections to multiple constituencies but not meeting specific nationality/citizenship criteria.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Institutional endorsement/nomination from the applicant's university is required for the Global Scholarship. Applicants must meet the specific entry requirements of their chosen full-time graduate course at the University of Oxford. Demonstrated character, commitment to others and the common good, potential for leadership, sustained commitment to serving others, leadership and initiative, and extracurricular interests are highly valued.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Official transcript(s) of all college work, certified English copy of high school marks/graduation certificate, English Language proficiency test results (IELTS Academic or TOEFL IBT), Curriculum vitae/resumé or list of principal activities, Personal Statement (including a clear statement of what the applicant wishes to study at Oxford and why), Academic Statement, Post Scholarship Plan (150 words max), Photograph (not visible to selectors until after short-listing), Letter of nomination from university.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Requires institutional endorsement/nomination from the applicant's university. Successful candidates for endorsement work with their university's fellowships office to complete the final application. The full application, including references, may be re-used for the subsequent application to the University of Oxford. Final selection is made by Rhodes House, Oxford.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Rhodes Scholarship is one of the oldest, most celebrated, and prestigious international fellowship awards in the world. It is a life-changing postgraduate opportunity for outstanding young people to study at the University of Oxford, chosen for their scholarly achievements, character, commitment to others and the common good, and potential for leadership.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applicants are recommended to apply for the Rhodes Scholarship in advance of their Oxford application, usually in the final year of undergraduate or postgraduate studies. Campus deadlines for endorsement (e.g., June 15, 2025 for USC, August 1, 2025 for Cornell) precede the global application deadline.

basic_info.provider: Asian Development Bank (ADB), Government of Japan
basic_info.study_country: Asia and the Pacific (25 selected educational institutions), including Japan (15 institutions)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded graduate scholarships, providing comprehensive financial support covering both academic and living expenses.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Highly variable by institution. General periods mentioned include December (e.g., East-West Center: Dec 15; Kyushu University: Dec 19, 2025). Specific institutional deadlines include: University of Tokyo: June 30, 2025 (extended to July 15, 2024 for some); Kyoto University: Aug 19 - Sep 6, 2024. Some sources mention a rolling basis, but this is contradicted by specific dates.
timeline_info.opening_date: Highly variable by institution. East-West Center: August-December 2026 for Fall 2027 Academic year. Ritsumeikan University: September 2026 enrollment guidelines now online.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: About 135-150 graduate scholarships per year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be well-qualified citizens of ADB's developing member countries (ADB borrowing member and Japanese Official Development Assistance scholarship eligible country). Not eligible: Executive directors, alternate directors, management and staff of ADB, consultants, and close relatives of the aforementioned. Staff of ADB–JSP partner institutions are not eligible. Applicants living or working in a country other than his or her home country are not eligible. ADB-JSP does not support applicants who are already enrolled in graduate degree programs. Some programs require applicants to work in their home country for more than 2 years after graduation.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Postgraduate studies in economics, business and management, science and technology, and other development-related fields (including health, education, agriculture, policy analysis, peace studies, good governance).
field_restrictions.restrictions: Only programs at participating academic institutions in the Asian and Pacific Regions are eligible for ADB–JSP funding. Applicants must match the application eligibility requirements of the specific program/institution they apply to.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: No general GPA requirement, but specific programs (e.g., at Nagoya University for Economics) may require a 'good first degree'.
academic_requirements.required_degree: A first degree is required as a prerequisite for pursuing graduate/postgraduate studies.

experience_requirements.min_years: At least 2 years of full-time professional working experience (acquired after a university degree) at the time of application.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Full-time professional working experience

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English proficiency test results are required. Accepted tests and minimum scores vary by institution: IELTS (6.0-6.5), TOEFL iBT (79-90 or 85), TOEFL PBT (550), TOEFL CBT (213), PTE (58), TOEIC (score not specified). Some institutions (e.g., Ritsumeikan) may accept an original, formal certificate of English language ability or a formal letter from the current/alma mater university if test scores cannot be submitted. AIT accepts AIT EET ≥ 6.0.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Three completed ADB-JSP letter of reference forms are required by some institutions (e.g., East-West Center).
additional_requirements.age_limits: Must not exceed 35 years old, with exceptions in certain cases (up to 45 years old) endorsed by the program.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants may be requested by the university to submit additional documentation. Applicants who pass primary screening but are not selected for the ADB-JSP scholarship may not be admitted to the university.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application guidelines and forms (e.g., ADB-JSP Application Form), required documents for the specific graduate program, English proficiency test results (if applicable).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Involves an admission stage starting with filling out an application. Universities determine and accept applicants selected as ADB-JSP scholarship recipients.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established in April 1988 with financing from the Government of Japan. Aims to provide opportunities for citizens of ADB's developing member countries to pursue graduate studies. Since 1988, 3917 scholars from 37 countries have been awarded the scholarship, including 1515 women. The JASAA (JASAA) is an organization of alumni.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The program supports enrollment for academic years, with application cycles typically opening well in advance (e.g., August-December 2026 for Fall 2027 Academic year at East-West Center; September 2026 enrollment at Ritsumeikan).

funding_info.funding_details: A fully funded master's scholarship for international students. Subject to available funding, JJ/WBGSP offers scholarships for 41 programs. About 300 scholarships are awarded annually. The program has awarded over 7,000 scholarships across 160 countries, and 3,503 scholarships in its regular program to applicants from over 150 World Bank member countries.
covered_expenses: duration of the graduate program or two years, whichever is less

timeline_info.opening_date: January 15 to February 29, 2024 (Application Window #1) and March 25 to May 24, 2024 (Application Window #2). The 2025 application window will be published in the fall.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: About 300 scholarships are awarded annually.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to citizens of eligible developing countries with relevant professional experience and a history of supporting their countries’ development efforts who are applying for a Master’s degree program in a development-related topic. Applicants must be a national of an eligible developing country, not hold dual citizenship of a developed country, be under the age of 45 on the application deadline date, and not be a World Bank Group staff member (which includes consultants) or relative of a WBG staff member. Applicants must be accepted unconditionally to enroll in the upcoming academic year in one of the JJ/WBGSP participating master’s programs located outside their country of citizenship and country of residence. Applicants must first apply for admission to one or more of the Partner universities and can only apply for one master’s programme when applying for the JJ/WBGSP scholarship. Applicants must be employed in development-related work in a paid full-time position at the time of submitting the scholarship application.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s degree program in a development-related topic. Examples include: Master of Arts in Global Sustainability Policy and Management, Master in Global Health Policy and Management, Master of Public Policy, Master of Public Health, Master of Public Policy, International Program (Economic Policy, Finance and Development (EPFD stream) or Public Management and International Relations (PMIR stream)), Master’s Program in Economic and Public Policy, MSc in Urban Management and Development, Master in Development Studies, MSc in Water and Sustainable Development (Water, Food and Energy Track; Water and Health Track; Water Resources and Ecosystem Health Track), Infrastructure Management Program (IMP), Master’s Program in Public Policy and Taxation.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Must be a development-related topic.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum 2.0 GPA. Preliminary selection based on Grade Point Average (GPA) may be conducted.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Hold a bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) earned at least 3 years prior to application deadline date.

experience_requirements.min_years: 3 years or more of paid professional experience in a development-related area after earning a bachelor’s degree (or equivalent), acquired within the past six years from the date of the Application Deadline.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Paid professional experience in a development-related area; development-related work in a paid full-time position.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Applicants must meet the language proficiency requirements of the chosen university. TOEFL iBT – 98 is welcomed by one university (U-Tokyo IPADS) as a criterion, though not an official cut-off. If previous degree(s) were not taught in English, a certified English translation of documents is required.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: 2 Professional Recommendation Letters are required.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Under the age of 45 on the application deadline date.
other_requirements: Be admitted unconditionally (except for funding) for the upcoming academic year to at least one of the JJ/WBGSP participating master’s programs located outside of the applicant’s country of citizenship and country of residence.
Must first apply for admission to one or more of the Partner universities.
Applicants can only apply for one master’s programme when applying for the JJ/WBGSP scholarship.
Not hold dual citizenship of a developed country.
Not be a World Bank Group staff member (which includes consultants) or relative of a WBG staff member.
Be employed in development-related work in a paid full-time position at the time of submitting the scholarship application.

application_documents: Application Form
2 Professional Recommendation Letters
Document with Proof of Work Experience
Unconditional Letter of Acceptance from a participating master’s degree program
Certified English translation of documents if previous degree was not taught in English
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The JJ/WBGSP uses a process to review eligible scholarship applications from developing country nationals, aiming to identify candidates with the highest potential to impact the development of their countries after graduate studies. Preliminary selection based on Grade Point Average (GPA) and English proficiency may be conducted. Maintaining a reasonable distribution of awards across gender is also a consideration.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established in 1987, the Joint Japan/World Bank Graduate Scholarship Program (JJ/WBGSP) has supported mid-career professionals from developing countries. It is a fully funded master's scholarship for international students.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications were accepted from January 15 to February 29, 2024 (Application Window #1) and from March 25 to May 24, 2024 (Application Window #2). The 2025 application window for the Joint Japan/World Bank Graduate Scholarship program will be published on the JJ/WBGSP website in the fall.

basic_info.study_country: Multiple (Africa, UK, Canada, France, USA). Specific African countries mentioned include Ethiopia, Rwanda, South Africa, Ghana, Uganda, Kenya, Niger, Mauritius, Burkina Faso, Benin.

funding_info.funding_details: Comprehensive support; fully funded scholarship program. Application fees will be reimbursed if the student is selected.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Varies by institution. Specific deadlines found: University of Edinburgh (Declaration & Eligibility Assessment): 14th November [2025], 5pm; University of Edinburgh (Application Submission): 21st November 2025, 5pm GMT; Arizona State University: 2 November [2025], 23:59 GMT; University of British Columbia (Invitation to apply to MCFSP): October 15th 2025.
timeline_info.opening_date: Varies by institution. Specific dates found: University of Edinburgh: 14th October 2025; University of Cambridge: Applications now open for 2026/2027 academic year.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Varies by institution. Specific numbers found: University of Cambridge: 60 (approximately) for 2023/24; University of Gondar: 160 graduate scholarships for eight years; University of Global Health Equity (UGHE): 500 young African Scholars.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to talented young Africans/citizens from Sub-Saharan Africa with great academic and leadership potential and few educational opportunities. Applicants must be admitted onto a master’s programme at a partner institution. For the University of Edinburgh, applicants for Master's programs should not have previously completed a postgraduate degree and should not be enrolled (or apply to enrol) at a separate university whilst on the scholarship. For Edinburgh's online Postgraduate Diploma, applicants can have an undergraduate or Masters degree from an African university (provided they graduate by 21 November 2025). The program actively supports equality, diversity and inclusion, and encourages applications from young women, refugees and displaced young people, and persons with disabilities. Financial need is a basis for award.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Varies by institution. Examples: Any full-time one-year postgraduate courses at Cambridge (with specific exclusions not detailed); Master of Finance (MFIN) at Cambridge; Health-related disciplines, Biomedical Engineering at University of Toronto; Global Health Delivery (MGHD) and Health Professions Education (MHPE) at UGHE; Master's programmes at Sciences Po.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Cambridge excludes certain courses (not specified). The program is primarily for Master's degrees, though Edinburgh also offers Postgraduate Diploma scholarships.

academic_requirements.required_degree: For Master's programs: Must be admitted onto a Master's/postgraduate program. For Edinburgh's online Postgraduate Diploma: Undergraduate or Master's degree from an African university (graduating by 21 Nov 2025).

experience_requirements.min_years: Minimum of two or three years' substantial work experience.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Professional experience in teaching, supervision.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Most universities require TOEFL/IELTS. Minimum TOEFL score: 90 (iBT). Minimum IELTS overall band score: 7 (on a 9-point scale). Specific program requirements apply.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Encourages applications from refugees and displaced young people, and persons with disabilities.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Leadership potential; commitment to transformative change on the continent; financial need.

background_and_logistics.official_website: Main foundation website: mastercardfdn.org. Partner university websites include: mastercardfoundation.fund.cam.ac.uk, mcfspedinburgh.smapply.io, internationalexperience.utoronto.ca, mastercardfdn.scholars.ubc.ca, uogqueensmcf.com, www.sciencespo.fr, ughe.org, mcfscholarsprogram.berkeley.edu.
background_and_logistics.application_documents: Mastercard Foundation Scholars Program Application Form (UBC specific).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Application process and decision-making are managed individually by each partner. Includes invitation to apply to the MCFSP, submission of application, and interviews (on-campus and online applicants invited to interview, interview outcomes announced). Not all eligible applicants are shortlisted for an interview.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Enables talented young Africans to pursue a master’s degree and grow their leadership potential. Provides comprehensive support for inclusive education, smooth transition into dignified work, and transformative lives. Scholars join a network committed to socio-economic change in Africa. The program has enabled over 45,000 scholarships (including secondary education).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarships are available for academic years such as 2026/27 (Cambridge, Edinburgh) and 2026-2028 (Sciences Po).

basic_info.provider: Southeast Asian Regional Center for Graduate Study and Research in Agriculture (SEARCA)

funding_info.funding_details: The SEARCA Graduate Scholarship Program is supported by the SEDF, Philippine Government, AF, BulSU, DAAD, NU, NTU, SU, Tokyo NODAI, and UPM.
covered_expenses: Stipend for food, lodging, and incidental expenses

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to nationals of SEAMEO member countries (Brunei Darussalam, Cambodia, Indonesia, Lao PDR, Malaysia, Myanmar, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, Timor-Leste, and Vietnam) who are regular employees of academic or research institutions or government agencies.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: agriculture and related sciences, biological sciences, fishery, environmental science, statistics, forestry, food security and nutrition

experience_requirements.accepted_types: regular employees of academic or research institutions or government agencies

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English proficiency

additional_requirements.age_limits: Not more than 35 years of age for Master's Degree applicants and not more than 40 years of age for PhD applicants at the time of application.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Prestigious Graduate Scholarship program designed to empower the next generation of agricultural leaders and professionals in Southeast Asia. Active since Academic Year 1968–1969, it has awarded over 1,991 full MS/PhD and PhD research scholarships to date.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Academic Year 2026-2027

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded. Covers tuition, living stipends (€2460), flight tickets, and health insurance. Also includes pocket money and a monthly allowance of €205.
covered_expenses: Costs for legalisation of study documents

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Limited number available each year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students, specifically individuals from priority and developing countries (listed on the OECD DAC List).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Diploma Course at the Institute of Tourism and Hotel Management (ITH)

academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate, Postgraduate, Diploma Course

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Scholarship Application Letter, Letter Of Intent For Scholarship
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Awarded on a competitive basis
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A golden opportunity for individuals from priority and developing countries to study in Austria. Fully Funded. Direct Apply (no agent). Some scholarships are for a 9-month Diploma Course at the Institute of Tourism and Hotel Management (ITH).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarships are available for academic years 2024, 2025, and 2026-2027. Application deadline for 2025 intake is March 16, 2025. Application deadline for 2026 intake is January 6, 2026, with courses beginning September 7, 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: Master's/First Professional Degree: $20,000; Doctoral Degree: $25,000; Postdoctoral Research: $50,000. The annual award ranges from $20,000 to $50,000. Stipends are payable to fellows.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Varies every year, generally between 50 to 100 awards.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to women, including people who identify as women, in all fields of study at an accredited institution of higher education or, for Postdoctoral fellows, research. Applicants must not be US citizens or permanent residents. Master’s/first professional degree and doctoral applicants must be enrolled in a U.S. accredited institution located in the U.S. during the fellowship year. Applicants can apply for the fellowship for any year of their program but must be conducting a full year of study or research. Women pursuing full-time graduate or postdoctoral study. Applicants must have the intention of applying their expertise, professional skills, and leadership in the context of their home countries. Members of the AAUW board of directors, committees, panels, task forces and staff, including current interns, are not eligible to apply for AAUW’s fellowships and grants.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All fields of study

academic_requirements.min_gpa: For International Postdoctoral Fellowship, a minimum CGPA of 3.5 on a 4.0 scale is required at the time of application. For other degrees, if institutional transcripts do not include a CGPA, applicants must submit an official institutional letter confirming the CGPA and the degree completion date, a CGPA equivalent calculation using a GPA/credential conversion tool (e.g., Scholaro’s GPA Calculator), or a credential evaluation report from services like WES or ECE (General with GPA), both of which should include a detailed list of all grades.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s/first professional degree, Doctoral degree, Postdoctoral research. For Postdoctoral, an academic or professional doctoral degree (earned in the U.S. or abroad) is required.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proof of English proficiency, such as TOEFL or IELTS scores, unless exempted. Required scores: TOEFL iBT: 79; TOEFL Essentials: 8.5; Revised TOEFL Paper-Delivered Test: 60; IELTS: 6.5.

additional_requirements.career_plan: Intention of applying their expertise, professional skills, and leadership in the context of their home countries.
additional_requirements.gender_requirement: Women, including people who identify as women.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: If applicants plan to pursue studies or research outside of the U.S. during the fellowship year, Proof of Graduate Women International Membership is required.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Master’s/first professional degree and doctoral applicants must have applied by the application deadline to an accredited institution of study for the period of the fellowship year and must indicate the institution’s name in the International Fellowships application. Foreign persons conducting their AAUW fellowship year in the U.S. must provide a U.S. Individual Taxpayer Identification Number or U.S. Social Security Number to file taxes. Must be conducting a full year of study or research.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Official institutional letter confirming CGPA and degree completion date, CGPA equivalent calculation using a GPA/credential conversion tool (e.g., Scholaro’s GPA Calculator), or a credential evaluation report from services like WES or ECE (General with GPA). Proof of English proficiency (TOEFL/IELTS scores) unless exempted. Written statement verifying the applicant's.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: AAUW’s International Fellowships promotes education and equity for women by investing in international applicants who will be pursuing postgraduate studies or research in the U.S. It is one of the largest funders of graduate women’s education. Since 1888, AAUW has provided $146 million in fellowships, grants, and awards to more than 14,000 women from 152 countries, with over $135 million awarded to 13,000 scholars in 50+ US states, including Washington, Puerto Rico, and D.C.

funding_info.funding_details: The maximum scholarship is $12,500. Awards are up to $12,500 annually for a maximum of three years. 209 scholarships were awarded during the year, totaling $2,233,548. The scholarship is based upon demonstrated need; however, the award is not intended to cover all academic or personal expenses.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Eligibility Form Deadline: December 15, 2025; Full Application Deadline (Enrolled Students): February 1, 2026 (for 2026-2027 term)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 209 scholarships were awarded during the year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Scholarships are for international women students (citizens of countries other than the U.S. or Canada) pursuing graduate study in the U.S. or Canada. Applicants must be or expect to be full-time graduate students working towards a graduate degree at an accredited college or university in the U.S. or Canada. Applicants must have a high school diploma or equivalent. Doctoral students who have completed coursework and are working only on dissertations are not eligible as first-time applicants. Applicants must have a full year of formal coursework remaining and be enrolled and in residence for the entire school year. Students attending Cottey College are also eligible. Applicants must demonstrate financial need.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Masters or PhD Programme in any field of study offered at accredited Universities; all disciplines.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Scholarships are not given for research, internships, or practical training, if not combined with coursework; travel, or to pay past debts. Doctoral students who have completed coursework and are working only on dissertations are not eligible as first-time applicants.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.0 (minimum cumulative unweighted GPA on a 4.0 scale)
