academic_requirements.required_degree: Graduate degree (Master's or Doctoral programs)

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Three Letters of Recommendation (in sealed, signed envelopes)
additional_requirements.gender_requirement: Restricted to female students; international women students
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Depending on her visa status, an applicant will be required to fill out and sign a document agreeing to leave the United States or Canada and return to her home country within sixty (60) days of finishing her degree program(s) or Alternative Practical Training (OPT).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must submit their application within six to 24 months prior to their stated graduation or course completion date. After awards have been announced, if a recipient receives notification of admission to a school other than the one detailed on her application, she must contact the IPS office for instructions on how to transfer her scholarship to a different school.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Eligibility Forms, Three Letters of Recommendation
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established in 1949, the International Peace Scholarship Fund supports international women students seeking to attend graduate school in the United States or Canada to foster global peace through education. It plays a vital role in empowering women and fostering peace around the world through education.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are accepted from mid-September to mid-December 2025 for the 2026-27 term. Eligibility Forms open September 15, 2025, with a deadline of December 15, 2025. The Full Application Deadline for enrolled students is February 1, 2026.

basic_info.provider: Brazilian government, CAPES (Brazilian Federal Agency for Support and Evaluation of Graduate Education), Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MRE), National Council for Scientific and Technological Development (CNPq)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded
covered_expenses: Monthly payments (R$1500 for master's, R$2200 for doctorate)
Free access to Brazil’s public healthcare system

timeline_info.application_deadline: 30 January 2026 (specific deadline); Tentatively March-May 2026 for general scholarships; December 2026-January 2027 for research contracts/fellowships
timeline_info.opening_date: Applications are now open for the 2026 academic year
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 650 scholarships (100 full doctoral, 350 sandwich doctoral, and implicitly 200 master's scholarships)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be university professors, researchers, professionals, and graduate students in developing countries that have Educational, Cultural, Scientific and Technological Cooperation Agreements with Brazil. Applicants must be citizens of a PEC-PG partner developing country. If a master's degree was completed in Brazil through PEC-PG or with a scholarship from a Brazilian agency (including CAPES or CNPq), applicants must have spent at least 2 years in their home country after completing the course in Brazil.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Any subject offered by Brazilian Higher Learning Institutions (IES); a wide range of disciplines

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s degree, PhD program, full-time doctoral, sandwich PhD, full-time Master program

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proof of Portuguese language proficiency (usually the CELPE-Brás exam); must meet the language requirements for the course they wish to pursue

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: If you completed your master's degree in Brazil through PEC-PG, or with a scholarship from a Brazilian agency (including CAPES or CNPq), you must have spent at least 2 years in your country after completing the course in Brazil.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: First secure admission into a Brazilian postgraduate program

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Approval of the selection by the Pro-Rectorate of the Brazilian HEI. The list of approved applications will be on the CAPES PEC-PG webpage.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The PEC-PG grants Full PhD scholarships in Brazilian Higher Learning Institutions (IES) to professors and researchers, professionals and graduates in developing countries that have Educational, Cultural, Scientific and Technological Cooperation Agreements with Brazil. It aims at increasing the quality of students’ learning to contribute to the development of their native countries.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: List of approved applications will be available from November 12 to 19, 2025, and from April 3 to 10, 2026.

basic_info.provider: Government of Mexico through AMEXCID (Mexican Agency for International Development Cooperation), Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Mexico

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded. Stipend based on the scholarship level: 4 times the monthly UMA value.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students, citizens of more than 180 countries, and all nationals. Also open to non-residents of Mexico.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Undergraduate, Bachelor's, Master, PhD, Postgraduate Research, Medical Specialties, graduate studies (specifically Science and Engineering for the CONACYT-OAS-AMEXCID program).
field_restrictions.restrictions: Applicants currently holding a scholarship from any Mexican government agency are not eligible. Former AMEXCID scholarship recipients applying before a certain period are not eligible.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 85/100 (or 8.5/10) per the Mexican system
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate, Bachelor's, Master, PhD, Postgraduate Research, Medical Specialties, graduate studies

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS not required (Mexico Scholarships Without IELTS for 2025 academic intake).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two recent letters of recommendation (one professional and one academic).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Copy of the acceptance letter from the host university, issued within 60 days, indicating study start and end dates (for non-residents of Mexico). OR Letter of presentation from the receiving University in Mexico no more than 60 calendar days of issue indicating the average of 85 (on a scale of 0 to 100 or 8.5 on a scale of 10) of the applicant, that he/she is a regular student, and the start and end dates of the studies (ONLY FOR PERSONS RESIDING IN MEXICO).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application Form, Copy of the acceptance letter from the host university, Letter of presentation from the receiving University in Mexico, Two recent letters of recommendation, Convocatoria_Beca_de_Excelencia_2025_Ingles.pdf (Call for Applications), 2025 Merit Scholarships Application Guidelines (PDF).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Selected candidates are considered scholarship recipients upon formal submission of documentation to the offices of the Academic Exchange Department and are subject to the commitments of the Call for Applications.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Mexican Government Scholarship Program for International Students (also known as Merit Scholarships) promotes international collaboration and the development of human capital. Scholarships are offered to more than 180 countries through bilateral conventions, multilateral programs, and special agreements. Duration is 3 to 24 months depending on the scholarship component selected.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2025 academic intake are open. The 2025 Scholarship Program is available. Closing dates vary by country; September 12, 2025, is a widely mentioned deadline, while August 15, 2025, is noted for Canadian students and August 25, 2025, for Belize.

basic_info.official_name: ICCR Scholarships (Indian Council for Cultural Relations) 2025-26
basic_info.provider: Indian Council for Cultural Relations (ICCR) / Government of India

funding_info.funding_details: Fully-funded. Expenses on study tour are met by ICCR.
covered_expenses: Basic living expenses (including food and local transport)

timeline_info.number_of_awards: More than 3000 scholarships offered through 21 schemes to foreign students of 180+ countries. Specific schemes include 20 slots for Malawi Nationals (India-Africa Maitri Scholarship) and 100 slots globally for Indian Culture studies (Lata Mangeshkar Dance & Music Scholarship Scheme).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Interested international students from 180+ countries. Specific announcements mention eligibility for Malawi Nationals and Vietnamese students. Applicants must have a passport to study in India.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Undergraduate, Postgraduate, and Ph.D. programs in a wide range of subjects. Also includes Indian Culture studies such as dance, music, theatre, performing arts, sculpture, Indian languages, cuisine, and more.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Medical, Paramedical, Fashion, Law, and 5-year Integrated Courses are excluded.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.0 or higher (on a 4-point scale) OR 60% or equivalent.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Must have completed the required level of education for the course you are applying for.

experience_requirements.min_years: Preferred 1-2 years of work experience in the human and community service industry (not mandatory). Minimum of 5 years of work experience mentioned for Vietnamese students.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Human and community service industry.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: A 500-word essay in English is required to ascertain English Proficiency. Students can also submit TOFEL/IELTS etc. Proficient in English language for listening comprehension is required.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: 1-2 letters of recommendation from academic or professional sources are advised/preferred, though not explicitly stated as mandatory for upload in all contexts.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Age limit for availing scholarship exists. Specific age requirement of 25 to 45 years old mentioned for Vietnamese students.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Students should not be allowed or supposed to do any part-time/full-time job along with their studies. Not previously sponsored (mentioned for Vietnamese students).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online application through ICCR's A2A scholarship portal, 500-word original essay in English (on one of the provided topics), TOFEL/IELTS (optional/supplementary), recommendation letters (advised/preferred).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Admission by an Indian University does not guarantee an ICCR scholarship. Universities must inform by 31.05.2025.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: An extraordinary opportunity for international students to study in India and experience its diverse culture. Offered through 21 schemes, with 6 schemes funded by other sources.

basic_info.provider: Ministry of Commerce, P.R. China; Chinese Government

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded, offering full or partial scholarship. Full scholarship covers tuition fees, accommodation, living expenses, and medical insurance. Partial scholarship covers tuition fees only.

timeline_info.application_deadline: February 8, 2026 (for CGSIS online application); 5pm, 25 February 2026 (for submission to Department of Further and Higher Education, Research Innovation and Science, Ireland); 06-Jun-2025 (for Tsinghua University, specific year/program)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Not specified, but SEVERAL will be granted.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to developing country citizens. Applicants who have studied in China or have been admitted to other Chinese government scholarship programs are not allowed to apply (for MOFCOM Scholarship-CSC Program). Successful scholarship applicants may be required to sign a contract and return to their home country (e.g., South Africa) upon completion of studies. Applicants must be healthy physically.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Inter-disciplinary education for top-level personnel working in government, trade, foreign affairs, agriculture, technology, education, culture, and health. Also offers studies in a variety of study fields, including non-degree Chinese language studies.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA ≥3.25 (4-point scale) or ≥4.0 (5-point scale). A minimum of 60% average is required for undergraduate/non-degree Chinese language studies (excluding Life Orientation).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's programs (1-2 years), Doctoral programs (3 years), Undergraduate (Bachelors) studies, and non-degree Chinese language studies. Applicants for Master's must be bachelor's degree holders. Applicants for PhD must be master's degree holders.

experience_requirements.min_years: At least three years' working experience.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Relevant working experiences.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Applicants for master's, doctoral, general scholar, and senior scholar programs taught in Chinese must submit a valid HSK score report that meets the corresponding Chinese language proficiency requirements. HSK Level 3 or higher is a priority criterion. English fluency is required. Minimum Chinese Level (HSK) is stated as 'None' for some programs, implying English-taught options.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two letters of recommendation in Chinese or English from professors or associate professors, required for graduate programs or senior scholar programs.
additional_requirements.career_plan: A Study Plan or Research Proposal is required. Some sources specify a minimum of 400 words, others at least 1,000 words (written in English, covering academic background). A resume including educational background and working experience after high school is also required.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Minimum age is 18 and maximum age is 45 (born after September 1, 1976).
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Students who have studied in China or have been admitted to other Chinese government scholarship programs are not allowed to apply (Only for applicants of MOFCOM Scholarship-CSC Program). Successful applicants may be required to sign a contract and return to their home country upon completion of studies.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Decent physical conditions / be healthy physically.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed application materials, Application Form for Chinese Government Scholarship (online via CGSIS), valid HSK score report (if applicable), two recommendation letters (for graduate/senior scholar programs), photocopy of highest diploma, photocopy of academic transcripts, Study Plan or Research Proposal (minimum 400-1000 words), resume including educational background and working experience after high school.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Scholarship-receiving authorities (or application processing authorities) will inform the program category and agency number of qualified candidates. Applicants must submit the scholarship application under the requirements of the dispatching authorities (or application processing agency).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The MOFCOM Scholarship is a fully funded Chinese government initiative for developing country citizens to study Master's or PhD programs in China. It offers one-year or two-year master’s programs as well as three-year doctoral programs (2-3 years sponsorship duration for Master's, 3 years for PhD) to offer inter-disciplinary education to top-level personnel working in fields like government, trade, foreign affairs, agriculture, technology, education, culture, and health, aiming to build intellectual capacity and facilitate economic and social development of recipient countries.

funding_info.funding_details: The Marshall Scholarship finances young Americans of high ability to study for a degree in the United Kingdom. It funds 1-2 years of study in any field at one or more British universities.
covered_expenses: university fees to a UK university of your choice
fares to and from the United States
contribution towards the support of a dependent spouse (where applicable)

timeline_info.application_deadline: September 16, 2025 (National Application Deadline for 2025 scholarship, typically late September)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Up to 50 scholarships awarded each year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open only to United States citizens who (at the time they take up their Scholarship) hold a first degree from an accredited four-year college or university in the United States with a minimum GPA of 3.7. Candidates must be young Americans of high ability and will hold a Bachelor’s degree before embarking on the Scholarship, having graduated or will have graduated after April 2023. An exceptional record of leadership and service is also required.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Any subject at graduate level
field_restrictions.restrictions: Professional degrees, such as those in law, business, and medicine are excluded, as are second baccalaureate degrees. Persons already studying for or holding a British degree or degree-equivalent qualification are not eligible to apply for a Marshall Scholarship, nor are those who have studied for or hold a degree or degree-equivalent qualification from a British University or GCSE or A Levels taken at school in the UK.

academic_requirements.required_degree: First undergraduate degree from an accredited four-year college or university in the US (Bachelor’s degree)

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Three letters of recommendation are required, including one primary academic letter. An institutional endorsement letter is also required. Candidates should NOT request letters of recommendation through the Marshall application system itself, as of 2025.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Candidates must not have studied for, or hold a degree or degree-equivalent qualification from a British University or GCSE or A Levels taken at school in the UK.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Exceptional record of leadership and service, leadership potential, ambassadorial potential, and a university interview are required.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online application form, letter of endorsement from undergraduate institution, Academic and Research History, short essays on leadership and ambassador potential, letters of recommendation.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Candidates complete an online application and submit it to their undergraduate institution. If endorsed, the institution adds a letter and submits it to the appropriate regional committee. The process includes a university interview. Selection committees look for authenticity, depth, leadership potential, and ambassadorial potential.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Marshall Scholarship funds graduate study in the UK for 1-2 years. One Year Marshall Scholarships are tenable for one academic year (12 months) and cannot be extended. Two Year Marshall Scholarships are tenable for two academic years (22 months) and may be extended by the Commission, though not beyond the end of a third academic year.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The application typically opens in Summer (e.g., Summer 2025 for the 2026 scholarship) with a national deadline in late September (e.g., September 16, 2025). Scholarships are for a Fall start date (e.g., Fall 2026).

basic_info.study_country: United States, United Kingdom, and other European nations

funding_info.funding_details: Up to $100,000 (or approximately ₹8,679,000). If the course fee exceeds US$100,000, proof of additional funds is required.

timeline_info.application_deadline: March 31, 2025; November 15, 2025 (tentative); generally ends in March or April, or November annually.
timeline_info.opening_date: January or February (for March/April deadlines); August (for November deadlines).
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 480

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to all Indian citizens who have been continuously resident in India for the past six months (or Indian passport holders). Applicants must be born after 1995. It is a need-cum-merit based scholarship for exceptional young Indians. The scholarship is not renewable. Applicants who hold an undergraduate degree from a recognised foreign university, with two years of continuous residence, employment, or study, may have specific conditions.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Full-time Master's, MPhil, and Doctoral programs in various fields including Business/Finance, MBA, Computer Science and Engineering, Social Sciences, Humanities, Law, Fine Arts, Architecture, Mathematics, Sciences, Environment and related subjects.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Specific programs at Imperial (Computer Science and Engineering) are excluded.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: First-class undergraduate degree typically. Minimum academic grade: 65% / CGPA 6.8/10 / GPA 2.6/4 for Social Sciences, Humanities, Law, Fine Arts, Architecture. Minimum academic grade: 70% / CGPA 7.2/10 / GPA 3/4 for Mathematics, Sciences, Environment.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate degree (Bachelor's degree) to pursue Master's, MPhil, or Doctoral programs.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Relevant work experience in the chosen field may be advantageous.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS, GRE, TOEFL (if applicable).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: At least one reference letter.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Born after 1995.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants who hold an undergraduate degree from a recognised foreign university, with two years of continuous residence, employment, or study.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Proof of academic achievements, documents of extracurricular achievements, financial requirements of the institute (written in detail), proof of additional funds (if course fee exceeds $100,000).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Academic transcripts, proof of admission, reference letters, CV, statement of purpose, financial requirements of the institute, photocopy of passport (first and last pages), IELTS/GRE/TOEFL scores (if applicable), proof of academic achievements, documents of extracurricular achievements, proof of additional funds (if course fee exceeds $100,000).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Inlaks Shivdasani Foundation provides scholarships, grants, and awards to outstanding young Indian students for full-time Master's, MPhil, and Doctoral programs abroad (US, UK, European nations). It is a need-cum-merit based scholarship. The foundation has provided over 1300 opportunities since 1976.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Supports academic year 2026-2027. Application period typically begins January/February and ends March/April, or opens in August and closes around November 15.

basic_info.official_name: TU Delft Excellence Scholarships (Justus & Louise van Effen)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded. Consists of full coverage of tuition fees and a monthly allowance for living expenses.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 2-3 scholarships per faculty per year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Excellent international MSc students who have been (conditionally) admitted to a two-year normal MSc program at TU Delft.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All 2-year MSc programmes at TU Delft
field_restrictions.restrictions: Joint Education Programmes are excluded

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 80 percent or higher of the scale maximum
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor degree from an internationally renowned university

additional_requirements.other_requirements: International applicant

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Scholarship Application Form & Required Documents
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Only students who have been granted a scholarship will be informed by TU Delft via email.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Foundation Justus & Louise van Effen was established with the aim of stimulating excellent international MSc students and financially supporting them in their wish to study at TU Delft. Scholarships are financed by the legacy of Justus and Louise van Effen.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Only students who have been granted a scholarship will be informed by TU Delft via email.

basic_info.provider: Eric Bleumink Fund, University of Groningen

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarships, providing financial coverage for all study-related expenses.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 4-5 per year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students from selected developing countries. Must have excellent grades during bachelor/undergraduate studies, excellent English language proficiency, and hold a bachelor's degree. Candidates must receive provisional or unconditional admission for a master's program at the University of Groningen before February.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All Master's Programs taught at the University of Groningen.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Only offered for master's programs.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Most programs require a minimum GPA of 3.0 – 3.5 (on a 4.0 scale), but competitive courses may have higher requirements.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree

experience_requirements.min_years: 2 years or 2800 hours
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Excellent English language proficiency is required, in accordance with the admission criteria for the chosen program.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Ideally supported by recommendation letters.
additional_requirements.age_limits: No age restrictions.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Extensions of the Fellowship are approved only in cases of: serious illness during the student’s study in the Netherlands; the recipient having to return home as a result of the death or serious illness of an immediate relative; the recipient not being able to finish his or her study in time due to circumstances beyond the control of the recipient or the University of Groningen.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Hold citizenship in an eligible developing country.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: The University of Groningen Admission Office, in consultation with the Admission Boards of its faculties, will determine which applicants will be nominated for an Eric Bleumink Fellowship scholarship.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Eric Bleumink Fellowship is a fully funded scholarship for international students from selected developing countries, offered for master's programs at the University of Groningen. Scholarship duration is 1 to 2 years.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: For the 2026-2027 academic year. Applications open 24 September 2025 and close 5 November 2025.

basic_info.official_name: Émile Boutmy Scholarship at Sciences Po

funding_info.funding_details: A fully funded scholarship, it is a tuition grant that covers a portion of the tuition for the two-year Master's degree program, worth €13,100 per year. Awards can be up to €14,720 per year (Tier 1) or €9,500 (Tier 2). Some sources indicate funding up to €19,000/year.

timeline_info.application_deadline: 30 November 2025 (2nd committee) for Master's programmes for the 2026-2027 academic year
timeline_info.opening_date: Now open for the 2026-2027 academic year
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Around 250 non-EU students each year

Emile Boutmy Scholarship (Master – Scien.eligibility_criteria: Open to first-time applicants from outside Europe/European Economic Area (non-EU international students) who wish to pursue a Master's degree. Applicants must match Sciences Po admission criteria and individual course requirements. Students previously denied the Émile Boutmy Scholarship are not eligible to apply again.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Most undergraduate and master’s programs, almost all academic fields and majors at Sciences Po.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Not valid for Ph.D. programs, certain one-year master’s, or specific dual degree programs unless explicitly mentioned for eligible tracks.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 2.30/3.00 or equivalent, or a minimum average of 80% (GPA = 7.5)
academic_requirements.required_degree: A relevant bachelor's or equivalent degree for Master's applicants

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience is favored, especially if there is demonstrable continuity between past study/career and proposed program.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English or French proficiency test score (e.g., TOEFL, JLPT) as required.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two recommendation letters are required (academic reference/recommendation letter).
additional_requirements.career_plan: An essay (1000-1500 words) detailing the career plan, future goals, professional growth, and impact is required.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Master's applicants are usually under 30 years old.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Scholarship is merit and need-based. Applicants should be top-level and their profiles should match admissions criteria.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed online application form, personal statement, CV, academic transcripts and certificates, academic reference/recommendation letter, English or French proficiency test score (as required), proof of income and family financial information, essay (1000-1500 words).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Based on merit and need. Letters of recommendation contribute (15%). Admissions officers consider GPA and other academic achievements.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Named after Sciences Po's founder, Émile Boutmy. It is considered one of the best scholarships offered by Sciences Po.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2026-2027 academic year are now open, with the Master's program deadline set for 30 November 2025.

basic_info.provider: Frank Knox Memorial Fellowship program (Harvard University)

funding_info.funding_details: Knox Fellowships provide full Harvard tuition and mandatory health insurance fees, plus a stipend of at least $32,000 - $33,000 USD per annum, sufficient to cover living expenses for a single student. Funding is guaranteed for up to two years of study at Harvard for students in degree programmes requiring more than one year.

timeline_info.opening_date: Applications for the 2026-27 round are currently open (expected late 2025 opening).
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Up to 5

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Available to students from Australia, Canada, New Zealand, and the United Kingdom. Applicants must apply for and gain admission to a full-time degree program (graduate or professional) at Harvard University, or apply for non-degree status as a Special Student or Visiting Fellow (preference given to degree candidates). Applicants must file a separate admissions application directly with their chosen Harvard Graduate School and meet its requirements and timetable. Fellows must be in residence in the Cambridge/Boston area for the entire academic year(s) during the first two years of their degree program.

field_restrictions.restrictions: Knox Fellowships do not support medical research, post-doctoral research or other research appointments at Harvard University.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.0 grade-point average (overall GPA)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Admission to a graduate or professional degree program at Harvard University

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Evidence of English language ability is required.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Applicants must file a separate admissions application directly with their chosen Harvard Graduate School. Evidence of English language ability is required. Applicants should refer to the fellowship regulations and application guidelines.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established in 1948, the Frank Knox Memorial Fellowship program provides funding for graduate study at Harvard University for students from Australia, Canada, New Zealand, and the United Kingdom. Over 625 fellows have studied at Harvard through this program.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The 2026-27 application round is currently open (expected late 2025 opening). The deadline for the 2025-2026 round was February 10, 2025.

funding_info.funding_details: Total amount of the scholarship call is 2,657,850.00 euros, planned to award 108 scholarships across 53 countries. Monthly endowment of 1,900 euros.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Typically closes in March-April. Specific deadlines mentioned include February 12, 2025 (for 2023 call) and April 11.
timeline_info.opening_date: Call publication in December annually. Applications typically open in early spring (March-April).
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 108 scholarships

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Citizens of Latin American, African, and Asian countries (including the Philippines). Priority for low and middle-income countries. Applicants must not have received a MAEC-AECID scholarship of 6 months or more during the previous three years, nor financial support from Fundación Carolina.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: A wide variety of academic and research fields, including but not limited to: Social Sciences and International Relations.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 7 out of 10
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree required for Master's or Doctorate programs. Specifically mentioned for Master's studies.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Information must be submitted in Spanish.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Duration of Award: 9 months. Renewable every year if the student maintains a minimum GPA of 7 out of 10.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Call publication occurs annually in December. Applications generally open in early spring (March-April) and close by March-April. For the 2026-2027 intake, openings have been noted in October 2025 or January 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: A prestigious, fully funded postgraduate scholarship which provides full funding for up to two years of postgraduate study.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: For exceptional African students, citizens of African countries, with outstanding academic and leadership abilities. Designed for young Africans who aspire towards the kind of leadership Mr Mandela embodied and want to use their talents to serve Africa. Applicants must have already assumed leadership and made an impact on their campus or community. Scholars are typically young leaders from 37 African countries.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Advertising, Communications, Visual Studies
field_restrictions.restrictions: Limited to specific fields mentioned.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Completed an undergraduate degree (usually a Bachelor's) by July 2025, to pursue postgraduate level studies.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Assumed leadership and made an impact on your campus or community.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: To benefit you must be curious about doing the (incomplete).

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A prestigious, life-changing scholarship designed to find, fund, and empower young Africans who aspire towards the kind of leadership Mr Mandela embodied and use their talents to serve Africa.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are now open for the Fully funded 2026 Mandela Rhodes Scholarship Programme, closing 21 April 2025.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship. Financial coverage extends for the entire standard duration of the degree program. Scholars receive full funding, which covers an annual stipend of €11,210 (up to 897 euro monthly for a maximum of 42 months, which is the regular period of study plus one semester).
covered_expenses: Additional support for research or academic activities
Basic Expenses to Study in Germany

timeline_info.opening_date: Approximately 6 weeks before the application deadline
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 1,000 graduates and doctoral students of all subjects and nationalities per year (some sources suggest 1,450 or 1,500, but 1,000 is frequently cited by official foundation sites).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Scholarships are offered to international students, European Union, and German students. For international students, the scholarship is primarily for postgraduate (Master's) and doctoral (PhD) studies. Only German students or international students who have completed their secondary education in Germany (so-called Bildungsinländer) can apply for funding for a Bachelor's degree program. Applicants are required to be studying in Germany already for some specific grants. Support is provided for students at state or state approved German institutions of higher education and universities of applied sciences (FH).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All academic disciplines/subjects
field_restrictions.restrictions: Not supported are second degree courses, study visits outside Germany, and final degree phases.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: No minimum GPA requirement specified, but successful applicants typically have top-tier academic performance, very good school or college/university academic record, and excellent academic records are expected.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s Degree or PhD Degree. An application for a scholarship for an undergraduate degree is not possible for international students, unless they are Bildungsinländer (completed secondary education in Germany).

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work Samples (for Journalism Applicants) with proof of publication or broadcasting. Work experience updated resume is required. Some specific programs (e.g., Global Production Engineering) may require at least two years of proven work experience.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Written proof of German language proficiency is necessary. Minimum requirement: „Deutsche Sprachprüfung für den Hochschulzugang“ Level DSH 2 or „TestDaF“ Level B2 (with certificate).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Required: a personal reference on social commitment and an expert reference from a university lecturer (or schoolteacher for school leavers).
additional_requirements.age_limits: No strict age restriction, but applicants under 30 are preferred for Master's programs. Some specific programs (e.g., for graduate social scientists, young members of non-governmental organisations and the media) are targeted toward individuals up to age 35.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants are expected to be socially and politically engaged, and to have an active interest in the basic values of the foundation: ecology and sustainability, democracy and human rights, self-determination and justice. Convincing reasons for applying to the Heinrich Böll Foundation are required. For some programs, applicants should have completed their Bachelor's degree not more than in the last 6 years.

background_and_logistics.official_website: https://www.boell.de/en/scholarships (main official site), https://th.boell.org/en/scholarships-0 (regional official site), https://www.boell.de/en/application (application page)
background_and_logistics.application_documents: Written application documents, including a personal reference and an expert reference. Proof of German Proficiency (Level B2 or DSH 2). Recommendation Letters. Work Experience Updated Resume. Work Samples (for Journalism Applicants). Specific Info Sheets and Application Forms (A1-1b, A1-2, A2-1b, A2-2) are mentioned as part of the online application portal.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The selection procedure consists of three stages: 1. Submission of written application documents (assessed based on academic record, social/political commitment, and reasons for applying). 2. Interview with a liaison lecturer (a report by the liaison lecturer is added to the application).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Heinrich Böll Foundation grants fully funded scholarships to approximately 1,000 graduates and doctoral students of all subjects and nationalities per year to pursue postgraduate and doctoral studies in Germany. It offers more than just scholarships, providing access to a 'Green network', assistance in connecting with experts in various fields, friends of the foundation, and regional/international offices. Alumni are invited to an annual 'alumni salon'.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship. Monthly stipend of €850 for Master's students and €1,200 for PhD students. Scholarship funding in Germany amounts to at least 800 € per month.
covered_expenses: Travel allowances for international and local travel

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Scholarships are awarded to international students for a master's degree, a doctorate, or a research stay at universities in Germany. The program is primarily aimed at international students and doctoral candidates from non-EU countries. Applicants for MA or doctoral programmes must have already completed a first course of study. Students should plan to study for at least four semesters at a university in Germany. Eligibility is also dependent on the applicant's status and country, as some may be excluded.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: In principle, there are no restrictions with regard to subjects. Fields of study mentioned include law, social sciences, music, and medicine.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Human or dental medicine courses (leading to a state examination) and specialist medical training are excluded.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's degree, PhD, or research stay. Applicants for MA or doctoral programmes must have already completed a first course of study.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Eligibility is dependent on the applicant's status and country; some countries/statuses may be excluded.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Konrad-Adenauer-Stiftung (KAS) Scholarship is a fully funded scholarship for international students to study and research in Germany. The foundation has been awarding scholarships to international students from around the world since 1970.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The official KAS website states an application deadline of 15 January 2026 for general studies and doctoral programmes. Other deadlines mentioned for 2025/2026 cycles include December 20, 2025, July 15, 2025, October 11, 2025, and March 31, 2026. Specific sub-programs like the SAIIA Scholarships 2026 have a deadline of September 26, 2025, and the EHF scholarship for 2027 has an application period from November 1, 2025 to January 15, 2026.

basic_info.official_name: Allan & Nesta Ferguson Charitable Trust Masters Scholarships

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded Scholarships UK

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 3 (for 2025/2026 academic year)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International students, specifically from developing countries and eligible overseas fee-paying students. Applicants must hold an offer for an eligible course at the University of Sheffield for the 2025-26 academic year.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master's in International Development and other affiliated MA courses at the University of Sheffield.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Taught Master's Program

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience, Relevant work experience in international development

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS, TOEFL, PTE, DET

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The University of Sheffield has a strong commitment to international development.

funding_info.funding_details: A full scholarship of €25,000, covering tuition and living expenses for one academic year, with the possibility of extension.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Varies by faculty; typically January or February 2026 for programs starting in September 2026.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: There is no set number of scholarships to be awarded under this programme.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Available to international students from outside the EU/EEA (Non-EU/Europe) pursuing a Master's program at the University of Amsterdam. Applicants must be exceptionally talented, in the top 10% of their class, and demonstrate academic excellence, motivation, and potential contributions to the university community.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master's programs at the University of Amsterdam, including humanities, social sciences, and sciences.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Only students who have been admitted to the Master's program Medical Informatics or the program Medicine of the AMC UVA can be awarded a scholarship (for specific cases).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: top 10% of their class

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: No IELTS Required! (Source: Facebook group)

background_and_logistics.official_website: The online application form for the AES is available on the University of Amsterdam's official website.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Awarded to those who demonstrate academic excellence, motivation, and potential contributions to the university community.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A very competitive program aimed at attracting the world’s best international graduate students to the master’s program at the University of Amsterdam.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship is for one academic year with the possibility of extension.

basic_info.official_name: Open Doors Russian Scholarship Project of the Global Universities Association
basic_info.provider: Association of Global Universities with the support of the Russian Government, under the auspices of the Ministry of Science and Higher Education of the Russian Federation

funding_info.funding_details: Tuition-free, fully funded, full scholarship, study at the expense of the Russian Federation.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Over 6,300 scholarships

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students from any educational background. For Undergraduate track: completion of secondary education. For Master’s track: Bachelor’s degree or final year of undergraduate studies. For PhD track: Master’s degree or final year of graduate studies. For Postdoc track: PhD or DSc degree as of registration start date.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All academic fields and majors. Interdisciplinary subject areas including: Artificial Intelligence, Business, Engineering, Medicine, Political Science, Russian Language and Culture, Business and Management, Biology and Biotechnology, Engineering and Technology, Clinical Medicine and Public Health, Computer and Data Science, Earth and Environmental Sciences, Education and Psychology, Politics and International Studies, Applied Mathematics and Artificial Intelligence, Urbanism and Civil Engineering, Physical Sciences and Technology, Chemistry and Materials Science, Economics and Econometrics, Psychology, Neuroscience & Psychology.
field_restrictions.restrictions: If chosen as a winner by both Rossotrudnichestvo and Open Doors, applicants must choose between the two scholarships.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 2.7 GPA
academic_requirements.required_degree: Secondary education completion (Undergraduate), Bachelor’s or Specialist’s degree (Master's/Graduate), Master’s degree (PhD), PhD or DSc degree (Post-doctoral)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Professional Experience Certificate from Organization, relevant work experience

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Training offered in both English and Russian (no language barrier implied for English programs). Minimum 4 semesters of Russian experience may be required for some programs.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two letters of recommendation
additional_requirements.age_limits: General: 16-39 years old. Specific for degree levels: Bachelor's Degree: 16-23 years old; Master's Degree: 20-33 years old.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: If chosen as a winner by both Rossotrudnichestvo and Open Doors, applicants must choose between the two scholarships.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Motivation letter, proof of education, identity document (notarized translation of passport first page), education document with transcript (notarized), professional experience certificate, any other certificates.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Fully online, takes place in several stages, involves an intellectual competition.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Seventh edition, conducted annually since 2017. More than 24 leading Russian universities participate. Winners gain access to world-class education and research opportunities. Opportunity to choose university from eligible list. Doctoral/PhD program duration: 4 full-time years for engineering, 3 full-time years for others.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application registration opens September 1. Application deadline is November 16, 2025. Winners and runners-up for Bachelor's and Master's tracks announced December 30, 2025. Winners for Doctoral and Post-doctoral tracks announced February 27, 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarships covering tuition fees and contributing to living expenses throughout the study period in Mauritius.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 50 scholarships annually to deserving African students. Specific allocations may apply for certain countries, e.g., up to 15 scholarships for South African students and 15 for Zambian students.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be resident citizens of member states of the African Union. They must have successfully completed end-of-secondary schooling with a minimum of 21 points. Applicants must have already applied for a full-time on-campus programme (Diploma, Degree, MPhil or PhD) at a public Higher Education Institution in Mauritius, or provide proof of payment for the application fee. Self-financing African students already studying in Mauritius are not eligible to apply for the same programme level under this Scholarship Scheme. Applicants must not be in receipt of a scholarship from any other public source in Mauritius.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Full-time on-campus Diploma, Degree, MPhil, or PhD programmes at public Higher Education Institutions in Mauritius. An example field mentioned is Computer Science with Network.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: At least 21 points at end-of-secondary schooling
academic_requirements.required_degree: Diploma, Bachelor's (Degree), Master's (MPhil), PhD

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: All candidates must have proficiency in English. If the language of instruction for the qualifying examination is not English, a valid TOEFL test result is required.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Letter of recommendation from referees, relating to the scholarship application.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Applicants for Masters and PhD should not have reached 40 years by 01 January 2026.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Study plan of about 750 words for Master's degree candidates. Detailed research plan of about 1500 words for PhD candidates. The field of study and institution must correspond with the information contained in the Letter of Offer.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Official Mauritius–Africa Scholarship Application Form (electronic then printed), Guidelines, Letter of recommendation, Study plan (for Master's), Research plan (for PhD), Valid TOEFL test result (if applicable), Letter of Offer from a Mauritian HEI, Proof of payment for university application fee (if applicable).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Government of Mauritius has provided for the award of scholarships to deserving African students since 2013. The scheme is for the 2026 academic year (also referred to as 2025-2026 academic year).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Call for applications for the 2026 academic year opened around November 7, 2025, with a deadline of March 27, 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship covers tuition and expenses and provides a monthly living stipend, funding for books and course materials. Full funding, stipend, and living expenses are provided. The program has committed over USD $1.2 billion to supporting education.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 12 Scholars per cohort at Columbia University

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be rising leaders from the United States and around the world who have demonstrated leadership. The program seeks diverse cohorts representing a cross-section of backgrounds, including those working in government and the private sector. The scholarship aims to support leaders in solving challenges in their communities.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: No restriction on the field of study
field_restrictions.restrictions: Ideally suited for students majoring in disciplines related to the program's goals.

academic_requirements.required_degree: The program is a one-year academic experience designed to complement the final year of core degree requirements within a student's existing school. It is an immersive program for rising leaders, but does not explicitly state a required prior degree for application.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Rising leaders, individuals working in government, the private sector, and those demonstrating leadership in solving community challenges.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proof of English proficiency required. TOEFL Internet-Based Exam: 100; TOEFL Paper-Based Exam: 600; International English Language Testing System Academic: 7.

additional_requirements.career_plan: Applicants are required to answer short essay questions summarizing their mission and goals for the program.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application form, short essay questions.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Obama Foundation Scholars Program is an innovative one-year academic experience for rising leaders. It is an immersive program, designed by Columbia University in consultation with the Obama Foundation, bringing together academic, skills-based, and experiential learning. Scholars acquire connections and skills to apply for the benefit of their communities. The program includes a nine-month residency at Columbia and is designed to complement the final year of core degree requirements for students at partner institutions like Chicago Booth.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: One-year academic experience, typically a nine-month residency.

funding_info.funding_details: The fellowship is worth £120,000 including salary, studentship stipend, fees and research expenses. The fellowship is normally for 30 months (12 months taught Master's course and 18 months research project). If your taught course or training is in the UK, you can use £15,000 a year (outside London) or £17,000 a year for a stipend.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Nationals of low- and middle-income countries. Applicants are expected to study their masters degree and do research in health-related fields. The host organisation for the research project is based in low- or middle-income countries. For a specific Wellcome Trust Masters Scholarship at LSHTM, applicants must hold an offer of admission for 2024-25 entry for the London-based (intensive) MSc Public Health programme at the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine by the studentship deadline of 15 April 2024.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Health-related fields, Public Health, Tropical Medicine.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's degree level

additional_requirements.other_requirements: For the specific Wellcome Trust MSc Scholarship (Public Health) at LSHTM, applicants must select this scholarship on their application to be considered for funding.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Wellcome International Masters Fellowships scheme is officially closed as per the Wellcome Trust's website. Historically, it offered nationals of low- and middle-income countries the opportunity to receive training at Master's degree level, including a 12-month taught Master's course and an 18-month research project. The Wellcome Trust also funds specific Master's scholarships, such as the Wellcome Trust Masters Scholarship in Public Health at the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine, which supports five studentships over 2022-2025.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The main scheme is closed. Past deadlines include 14 April 2020 and 24 August 2022. A specific Wellcome Trust Masters Scholarship at LSHTM had a deadline of 15 April 2024.

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship is a fully funded program, providing financial support to cover living expenses and study costs. This includes a monthly living stipend (650 € per month for the basic scholarship programme, 1000 € per month for the graduate scholarship programme), health insurance support, and coverage for study costs. Universities in Germany usually have no tuition fees. A family allowance is available for eligible scholars.

timeline_info.application_deadline: For Masters degree scholarships for international students: 30 November (Winter semester) and 31 May (Summer semester). A general deadline of 30 November 2025 is also mentioned.
timeline_info.opening_date: Applications are ongoing and open for the 2025/2026 academic year.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: up to 40 scholarships per year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to Germans, foreign students, and refugees, including international students and overseas applicants. Candidates must show commitment to the values of social democracy, demonstrate above-average performance in school/outstanding academic performance, and exhibit social and political activity. Applicants must be applying for or already enrolled in Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD programs at German higher education institutions (polytechnic colleges and public or state-approved universities). Specific conditions apply for first-year students (not Master’s students) and for basic funding (not first-year students or nationals/foreigners after the 1st semester).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All fields of study, including artistic degree courses, Natural Sciences, Engineering & IT, Social Sciences, and Humanities.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Assistance is restricted to the first phase of study leading up to the initial professional qualification examination. (Note: This statement may require clarification as other sources indicate PhD degrees are covered.)

academic_requirements.min_gpa: There is no universal GPA requirement, but qualified recipients are expected to have above-average performance and outstanding academic performance.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD degrees (including first degree courses Bachelor's/diplomas/state examinations, and Master's/postgraduate programmes).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Reports from high school teachers or vocational school teachers (for first-year students) or reports from university professors (for basic funding).
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Target group includes citizens of Africa and Asia.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Voluntary involvement and social/political activity are expected, along with a commitment to the values of social democracy.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Updated CV (outlining education, work experience, and voluntary involvement), Academic Certificates & Transcripts (University entrance).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Recipients gain access to a comprehensive seminar program that develops leadership skills, social engagement, and academic competence.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Duration: Applicant's program duration.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarships that waive tuition, provide living stipends and research support. Financial aid / scholarship or grant. CECA announced 735 postgraduate, doctorate, faculty and institutional studies scholarships for students in Latin America for the 2025-2026 academic year. Fundación Iberdrola España supports ten scholarships for non-Spanish resident graduates from any member state of the Iberoamerican Community of Nations.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Targeted at Latin American students, non-Spanish resident graduates from any member state of the Iberoamerican Community of Nations. Recipients include Master’s students, postgraduate students, continuing education students, and PhD candidates. Doctoral fellowship candidates must hold a master's degree that grants access to a doctorate in their country of issue. Some specific programs are for musicians.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All areas of knowledge. Includes postgraduate, doctorate, faculty, and institutional studies. Specific programs mentioned include Master in ELE and those supporting the training of human rights defenders and promoters, and musicians.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's degree (for doctoral candidates), postgraduate, or graduate degree.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Minimum TOEFL score of 90 or an IELTS score of 6.5 or higher.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Promotes the transversal approach to human rights established in the Spanish Cooperation Master Plan 2024-2027, with a focus on supporting and defending human rights to build a just and equitable future.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Highly competitive due to the limited number of places.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Combines Carolina Foundation scholarships and those of the Spanish Agency for International Cooperation and Development (AECID). It is part of the Spanish Cooperation system. Offers scholarships for Postgraduate, Doctorate, short postdoctoral stays, and Continuing Education.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: For the 2025-2026 academic year.

basic_info.provider: Scottish Government in collaboration with Scottish universities

funding_info.funding_details: Provides financial support towards tuition fees, offering up to £8,000 off tuition fees. Some sources mention £2000 or £4000, but £8000 is most common.

timeline_info.application_deadline: 31 May 2025 (for 2026 intake). Some sources mention May 1.
timeline_info.opening_date: Application becomes available on the website in February.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Up to 50 awards (some sources mention 100 or 200 awards).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to citizens and permanent residents of select countries (e.g., India, China), who are non-UK/EU citizens. Strong academics required. Ineligible if previously studied in Scotland or won the Saltire Scholarship/undertaken an internship as a Saltire Scholar.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Examples include Science (e.g., Earth Sciences, Environment, Energy, Geology).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA 2.5 (some general UK scholarships mention 3.0).
academic_requirements.required_degree: One-year full-time Master's degree (some sources mention undergraduate, Masters or PhD courses).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Minimum IELTS score of 6.0 or 6.5, depending on the university of admission.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Distance learning courses are eligible.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must have an unconditional offer letter to study at a university in Scotland.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A scholarship program by the Scottish Government in collaboration with Scottish universities, for international students.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications typically open in February, with a deadline around May 1 or May 31 (for the following year's intake).

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship (Type A) covering tuition, accommodation, living expenses, and medical insurance. Type B is a semi-scholarship covering tuition (or part of tuition) and comprehensive insurance.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Usually runs from February to April annually, but may vary depending on the university.
timeline_info.opening_date: Application period usually runs from February to April annually.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Non-Chinese citizens, aged 18-25, awarded based on merit. Specific GPA requirements vary by university and scholarship type (e.g., for Type-A at Shanghai Normal University, GPA >= 3.2/4 or equivalent; for Shanghai University graduate programs, GPA >= 2.5/4 on a 4-Point GPA System). For Science or Engineering programs, applicants must be qualified in mathematics and physics in high school.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Nearly all academic fields, including but not limited to Philosophy, Economics, Law, Education, Literature, History, and Multiple Disciplines.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Scholarship winners shall not change their host university, field of study, or duration of study unless they give up the grant.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.2/4 or equivalent (for Type A at Shanghai Normal University); 2.5/4 or above (for Shanghai University graduate programs)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelors, Masters, or Ph.D. (to pursue a bachelor's or higher degree)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: HSK 5:180 (SUFE); HSK 4:180 or above (for Type B at SUES); HSK 4 (SUES). Some sources claim no IELTS required.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two letters of recommendation in Chinese or English by professors or associate professors.
additional_requirements.age_limits: 18-25 years old
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Fill out a personal commitment form. For Science or Engineering programs, applicants must be qualified in mathematics and physics in high school.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online application form, personal commitment form, academic transcripts (highest degree program), proof of language proficiency (HSK), two letters of recommendation.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Awarded based on merit. Annual assessment required for Type B and SUES Scholarship.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Shanghai Government Scholarship Program offers two types of scholarships (Type A and Type B) for non-Chinese students to pursue Bachelors, Masters, and Ph.D. degrees in multiple disciplines at 31 participating universities in Shanghai, China. It is a great opportunity for full scholarship.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The application period usually runs from February to April annually, with the scholarship being offered for academic years like 2026-2027.

basic_info.provider: King Fahd University of Petroleum and Minerals (KFUPM)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded; Full MS and PhD scholarships for distinguished graduate applicants.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Project-Based MS: July 15, 2025; Thesis-Based MS & PhD: July 31, 2025
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Not specified, but KFUPM admits hundreds of international students annually across graduate programs.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to both male and female, local and international students (from Saudi Arabia and abroad). Applicants must be distinguished graduate applicants who demonstrate high potential for conducting original research and fulfill all King Fahd University requirements.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Graduate programs, Masters and PhD studies in Engineering, Sciences, and Business. Scholarships are offered for all PhD programs and for a limited number of MS programs, specifically those that do not have corresponding doctoral programs.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Scholarships are for thesis-based Master of Science & PhD programs. Non-Thesis programs, including MBA, have fees per credit hour and registration fees, implying they are not fully funded by this scholarship.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: A minimum GPA of 3.00 on a scale of 4.00 or equivalent in both B.S. and M.S. degrees. A minimum cumulative GPA of 3.00 out of 4.00 is required from the previous certificate.
academic_requirements.required_degree: An undergraduate degree or 16 years of education (for MS programs). An M.S. degree in engineering or science from an institution whose graduate programs are equivalent to those of KFUPM (for PhD programs). A four-year Bachelor's Degree (for MBA programs).

experience_requirements.min_years: At least one year of full-time work experience for MBA students. Minimum of three years of full-time work experience (waivable for exceptional academic records or graduate/research assistants).
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Full-time work experience; graduate/research assistants (for waiver consideration).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English language proficiency demonstrated by one of the following: TOEFL (520 PBT, 190 CBT, or 70 IBT) or IELTS (minimum score of 6.0). For PhD applicants, minimum scores are 79/120 [iBT] or 6.5 [IELTS Academic]. A STEP test score of 50 or above is also accepted. English language proficiency requirements are waived for KFUPM graduates and graduates from English Speaking Countries (USA, Canada, UK, Australia, New Zealand). GRE is required for all applicants applying to graduate programs in Engineering or Sciences. TOEFL scores must be sent directly to the College of Graduate Studies.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: At least two academic or professional references from individuals familiar with the applicant's academic qualifications.
additional_requirements.age_limits: 18-30 (for Masters Program, as per Facebook group source); specific age requirements should be checked.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Strong Research Background (for thesis-based programs); demonstrate high potential for conducting original research.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Copy of identification (Passport). Applicants must submit salary certificate of their working parent(s) total salary (plus all allowances in details, Employer stamp, Employer Signature, Chamber - from ses.kfupm.edu.sa/scholarships).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Copy of Passport, English language proficiency certificate (TOEFL/IELTS/STEP), GRE scores (for Engineering or Sciences programs), Recommendation Letters (2 academic/professional references), Salary certificate of working parent(s) (details including allowances, employer stamp, signature, chamber - from ses.kfupm.edu.sa/scholarships).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: KFUPM provides full MS and Ph.D. scholarships for distinguished graduate applicants who demonstrate high potential for conducting original research in the fields of Engineering, Sciences, and Business.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Announcement of Results: April 2026 (Note: This timeline may pertain to a different application cycle than the July 2025 deadlines).

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded by the university, covering graduate programs in master's, doctoral, pharmacy, and diploma studies. Includes tuition fees, accommodation, and other financial support for international students.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Candidates must be Qatari nationals or a Qatar University TA/Lecturer. Must have a cumulative GPA of at least 3.0. A letter of acceptance is required. For some graduate programs (e.g., PhD), a Master's Degree or Higher is required.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master's, Doctoral, Pharmacy, and Diploma studies across various academic fields.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's Degree or Higher (for some graduate programs, e.g., PhD)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: TOEFL score of 500/550 or equivalent IELTS score. Standardized test scores (e.g., GRE, GMAT) are necessary.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Letter of acceptance

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Letter of acceptance
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Highly competitive, with over 5,000 applications annually.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Scholarships are available for Master's, Ph.D., PharmD, and Diploma programs.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: For the academic year 2026-2027.

basic_info.official_name: University of Geneva Excellence Master Fellowships

funding_info.funding_details: A grant amounting to CHF 10'000 to CHF 15’000/year (no teaching duties); it is awarded for one year and extended for the regular duration of the chosen Master's program (three or four semesters) provided the applicant is academically successful at the end of his/her first semester of studies.

timeline_info.application_deadline: 28 February 2026 for Masters course starting September 2026
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 10 scholarships

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to outstanding and highly motivated international students who wish to pursue a Master of Science degree in one of the disciplines covered by the Faculty. Students who have already started a Master programme at the Faculty of Science can no longer apply for the Excellence Master Fellowship.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master of Science degree in one of the disciplines covered by the Faculty (e.g., Astronomy, Biology, Neuroscience, Chemistry and Biochemistry). Complete list of the Master programs under http://www.unige.ch/sciences/Masters.
field_restrictions.restrictions: May not be used for EMBAs or Masters of Advanced studies.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Relevant work experience

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: GRE, IELTS, or TOEFL score certificate as proof of English language proficiency (optional: GRE, TOEFL, or other).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two reference letters from professors attesting to your suitability for the Fellowship and academic excellence (preferably sent by them directly to the e-mail address indicated below).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: A scan of your national identity card or passport, a Curriculum Vitae (2 pages maximum), the transcript of exams passed during the bachelor, two reference letters from professors, GRE/IELTS/TOEFL score certificate (as proof of English language proficiency).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Faculty of Science, with the support of external partners, has established an Excellence Fellowship program open to outstanding and highly motivated students.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Fellowship for 2026-2027. Application deadline is 28 February 2026 for Masters courses starting September 2026. The online application form is accessible from January 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: CHF 1,600 per month (annual stipend of CHF 19,200) for the minimum statutory period of the chosen Master's program.
covered_expenses: Full tuition coverage (exemption from fixed fees)
Tuition fee waiver (except CHF 80/semester administrative charge)

timeline_info.application_deadline: 1 November 2025 (for 2026/2027 intake / entry in Autumn 2026 or Spring 2027)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Around 10 scholarships are awarded every year.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Competitive Master's grants for outstanding international students / foreign graduates with strong academics and very high academic results, interested in pursuing a Master's degree from the University of Lausanne.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All Master's programs offered by UNIL (covers a wide range of Master's programs).
field_restrictions.restrictions: Except for a few specific programs (with some exclusions).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Strong academics / very high academic results; no specific GPA or grade list by country provided.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Foreign degree (equivalent to a Bachelor's degree required for Master's admission).

experience_requirements.min_years: 1 or 2 years of work experience at least.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience, previous research experience.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English proficiency certificate (C1 level) or French proficiency certificate (B2 level) required. IELTS/TOEFL or DALF/DELF score report accepted as proof of language proficiency.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Academic references / letters of recommendation.
additional_requirements.career_plan: A motivation letter explaining academic and professional goals.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants do not apply separately for programme admission.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Detailed application, academic records, letters of recommendation, motivation letter, proof of language proficiency (IELTS/TOEFL or DALF/DELF score report).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Competitive selection process for outstanding international students.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Competitive scholarship program designed to support international students who wish to pursue a Master's degree at the University of Lausanne. Available for most Master's programs, with some exclusions.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: For the 2026/2027 academic year, with entry in Autumn 2026 or Spring 2027.

basic_info.provider: African Development Bank (AfDB) in partnership with the Government of Japan

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded master's scholarships

timeline_info.application_deadline: April 2026 intake: September 16, 2025. September 2026 intake: November 12, 2025 or January 9, 2026.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: About 300 scholarships are awarded annually.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Must be a high-achieving African student, a citizen of an African country or a national of an AfDB regional member country. Must demonstrate outstanding academic achievement and potential. Must be 35 years old or younger and in good health. A commitment to return home after studies is required.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Energy Systems & Renewable Energy, Agriculture and Agribusiness, Public, Health, Environmental Sustainability, Engineering, or related fields.
field_restrictions.restrictions: areas aligned with Africa’s Goal

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree or its equivalent for master's level post-graduate studies (two-year programs).

experience_requirements.min_years: 1 year
