experience_requirements.accepted_types: paid employment in their home country or in other African countries

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS, TOEFL iBT, TOEC test for English proficiency

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendation letters from professors or employers
additional_requirements.career_plan: Essay outlining professional experience and impact
additional_requirements.age_limits: 35 years old or younger
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Admission to a designated institution

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Recommendation letters from professors or employers, language proficiency certificates (TOEFL/IELTS for English programs), and an essay.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: AfDB will conduct the selection and the results will be delivered.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Japan Africa Dream Scholarship (JADS) Program is a prestigious, fully funded master’s scholarship initiative by the African Development Bank (AfDB) in partnership with the Government of Japan. It offers high-achieving African students a two-year scholarship opportunity to pursue post-graduate studies at master's level in Japan, designed to enhance Africa’s human capacity.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The program is for 2025-2027, with applications open for two intakes: April 2026 (deadline September 16, 2025) and September 2026 (deadlines November 12, 2025 or January 9, 2026).

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship is fully funded, covering full tuition fees, a monthly living allowance of RM 1,500.00 per month, and health insurance. It also provides enhanced exposure to global academic networks.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Several

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to outstanding international students from eligible countries (including ASEAN countries, Morocco, Commonwealth countries, Palestine, Afghanistan, Qatar, Algeria, Saudi Arabia, Azerbaijan, Senegal, China, South Korea, Egypt, Syria). Applicants must be interested international graduates with outstanding academic and co-curricular backgrounds, possessing excellent academic achievements, leadership qualities, and a strong commitment to contribute to their home country after completing their studies in Malaysia.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Postgraduate studies (Master’s or PhD) in fields such as Science and Engineering, Agriculture and Fisheries, Economics and Islamic Finance, Information and, Education, Arts and Humanities, Social Sciences, Journalism, and Information.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Master's applicants: CGPA 3.0 or 2nd Class Upper. PhD applicants: minimum CGPA of 3.5 or very good result at Master’s degree level in a similar field of intended PhD study.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's or PhD degree

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Applicants can apply without IELTS.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Admission letter from Malaysia University (if applicable).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Admission letter from Malaysia University (if applicable).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: An initiative by the Malaysian Government to attract top talents and outstanding international students from around the world to pursue postgraduate studies in Malaysia, aligning with Malaysia's aspiration to emerge as a global centre of academic excellence by attracting, motivating, and retaining talented human capital from abroad.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: 2025/2026 academic session

funding_info.funding_details: Full Tuition Fee Coverage. Monthly Stipend: Master's students: 40,000 rubles/month; PhD students: 70,000 rubles/month. Over $52 million awarded annually.
covered_expenses: Monthly Stipend to cover living expenses

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open for all outstanding local and international eligible students. All programs are taught in English.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: MSc programs: Data Science, Advanced Computational Science, Applied Computational Mechanics, Materials Science, Advanced Manufacturing Technologies (Simulation based Engineering Sciences track), Internet of Things and Wireless Technologies, Engineering Systems, Mathematical and Theoretical Physics, Photonics and Quantum Materials. PhD programs: Computational and Data Science and Engineering, Mathematics and Mechanics, Engineering Systems, Materials Science and Engineering, AgroBioTechnologies and Engineering, Physics. Relevant STEM fields.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.5 or equivalent (for MSc programs); No minimum GPA requirement for PhD programs.
academic_requirements.required_degree: For MSc programs: A Bachelor's, Specialist, or equivalent degree in a relevant STEM field from a recognized university. For PhD programs: A Master's degree (or equivalent) from a recognized university.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: TOEFL iBT: ≥ 72, TOEFL ITP: ≥ 543, IELTS: ≥ 5.5, Cambridge

additional_requirements.age_limits: No age requirements.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: The Her Royal Highness Princess Maha Chakri Sirindhorn Skoltech Scholarship is awarded annually to three students from Thailand (Bachelor's and Master's graduates from Thailand are eligible to apply).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online application form, required documents including academic, CV (including academic background and professional).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Fully Funded Master's and PhD programs. Program Duration: Master: 2 Years; PhD: 3 Years.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Visit the official application portal, complete the online application form, upload required documents.

funding_info.funding_details: The JFUNU scholarship provides a monthly allowance of 120,000 JPY for living expenses. For MSc programs, this is for a maximum of 24 months, and for PhD programs, for a maximum of 36 months. Tuition fees may be waived or covered. Travel costs to and from Japan are also covered with a fixed amount, and a research allowance is included.
covered_expenses: Travel costs to and from Japan

timeline_info.application_deadline: MSc: 12 February 2025 (23:59 Japan Standard Time); PhD: 19 February 2025
timeline_info.number_of_awards: One scholarship for PhD in Sustainability Science. A very small number of awards are generally available; not specified for MSc.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Available for outstanding applicants from developing countries (included in the latest OECD DAC list) who can demonstrate or establish a financial need. Applicants must not be currently living in Japan under a working visa, and must not be recipients of other scholarships concurrently. Acceptance for enrolment in the UNU-IAS Master of Science in Sustainability programme (or PhD equivalent) is a prerequisite.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: MSc in Sustainability Program, PhD in Sustainability Science

academic_requirements.min_gpa: MSc: 3.5 or above on a 4.0 scale. PhD: 2.8 or above on a 4.0 scale (equivalent to 70% on a 100% scale) for at least one Master's degree.
academic_requirements.required_degree: For MSc programs, a Bachelor's degree is implied. For PhD programs, a Master's degree is required.

experience_requirements.min_years: two years
experience_requirements.accepted_types: full-time work experience

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Applicants must meet the minimum score requirements for English language qualifications required by UNU-IAS. Official score reports can be sent using institution code 6991.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: No separate application is required for PhD applicants.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: 2025 Application Guidelines, Employment Certificate
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Japan Foundation for UNU (JFUNU) Scholarship offers an incredible opportunity for talented students from developing countries to study at UNU-IAS.

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship is described as 'Fully Funded' by some sources, with one source explicitly stating it covers tuition, stipends, and airfare. However, other sources contradict this, stating that tuition fees, boarding, local transportation, and enrollment fees are *not* covered, and only a living allowance (stipend) is provided.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 20 (for 2025-26 cycle)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students, with specific targeting towards nationals from countries such as Zambia, Pakistan, Liberia, and Nigeria, as well as students from African and Arab countries. Applicants must be aged 19 (for undergraduate applicants). Proficiency in Arabic or French is often required.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Medical Studies, Paramedical Science

academic_requirements.required_degree: Available for Undergraduate, Master's, and PhD programs. Master's applicants require a minimum of 16 years of education in relevant fields, and PhD applicants require a minimum of 18 years of education in relevant fields. A bachelor's degree is a minimum requirement for some programs (e.g., 2024/25 cycle).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proficiency in Arabic or French is often required.

additional_requirements.age_limits: Minimum age of 19 for undergraduate applicants.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Moroccan Government Scholarships for the 2025-2026 academic year are offered to international students for higher education in Morocco. Some sources also mention vocational training scholarships.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The scholarship is primarily for the 2025-2026 academic year, with applications closing on July 4, 2025.

basic_info.provider: Catholic Academic Exchange Service (KAAD), the scholarship institution of the Catholic Church in Germany

funding_info.funding_details: Prestigious, fully funded scholarship offering full financial support.

timeline_info.opening_date: Already open via KAAD partner committees.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Varies every year.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be of Catholic denomination (preference given to Catholic applicants, or recommended by Catholic partners), come from a developing or emerging country in Africa, Asia, Eastern Europe, the Middle East, or Latin America, and currently reside there. They must have a university degree, professional experience in their home country, a strong academic record (significantly above average scores), and plan to study or research in Germany. Scholarship recipients are required to return to their home country or another developing country after studies; otherwise, the scholarship costs must be repaid in full.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All disciplines (especially development-relevant programs)

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Both undergraduate and graduate scores have to be significantly above average.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Post-graduate studies including Master's, PhD, and post-doctoral programs. For doctoral degree programs, a Master's degree (M.A.) or its equivalent in a subject related to the proposed research topic is required.

experience_requirements.min_years: At least three years of relevant work experience.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Professional experience in home country, preferably with the applying organization.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Basic German knowledge is required. IELTS or TOEFL may be required for some programs.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: If a scholarship student does not return to their home country or another developing country at the end of their studies, the cost of the scholarship and any additional aid must be repaid in full.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: For doctoral programs: a detailed outline of the intended dissertation research and an acceptance letter from the university are required.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: For doctoral programs: a detailed outline of the intended dissertation research and an acceptance letter from the university.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants await notification regarding the progress of their application. The KAAD Educational Commission (27 members) is involved.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: KAAD offers three types of scholarships: Scholarship Program 1 (for applications from abroad), Scholarship Program 2, and Eastern Europe Program. Specific programs exist for in-country scholars who have done their Master-studies in Ghana, Zimbabwe, Kenya or Ethiopia.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application Start Date: Already open via KAAD partner committees. Deadlines vary: June 30, 2025 (for 2025-26), November 30, 2025, December 31, 2025 (for 2026 intake). Study application deadline: January 15, 2026. Scholarship application (via email invitation): February 2026. Notification of Results: Await KAAD's notification.

basic_info.official_name: Kazakhstan Government Scholarship for International Students
basic_info.provider: Ministry of Science and Higher Education of the Republic of Kazakhstan (Admissions operator: Higher Education Development National Center MSHE RK)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded
covered_expenses: Free university accommodation or a housing allowance
Monthly stipend for living expenses (specifically $100 for bachelor's program)

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 550 Grants Available (Bachelor’s, Master, and Ph.D.)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students, including persons of Kazakh nationality who are not citizens of the Republic of Kazakhstan, for full-time study under Bachelor, Master, and PhD educational programs at universities in Kazakhstan.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Various disciplines, including STEM, social sciences, humanities, and more, covering a broad range of academic disciplines and professional activities.
field_restrictions.restrictions: No restriction on the field of study.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.0 (out of 4.0) or its equivalent
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree diploma and transcript for Master's applicants; Master's degree diploma and transcript for PhD applicants.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: For Master and Doctoral applicants: an international certificate confirming proficiency in a foreign language (e.g., IELTS, TOEFL, DSH, DELF, etc.), with the respective minimum scores as specified.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two recommendation letters from academic/professional referees.
other_requirements: Motivational essay in Kazakh or Russian or English
Invitation letter from a Kazakh university (if available) for Bachelor's Degree Applicants

application_documents: Copy of passport/identity document
International certificate confirming proficiency in a foreign language (e.g., IELTS, TOEFL, DSH, DELF, etc.)
Bachelor's degree diploma and transcript, with a notarized translation into Kazakh, Russian, or English (for Master's applicants)
Master's degree diploma and transcript, with a notarized translation into Kazakh, Russian, or English (for PhD applicants)
Motivational essay in Kazakh or Russian or English
Two letters of recommendation from academic/professional referees
Invitation letter from a Kazakh university (if available, for Bachelor's applicants)
Medical certificate
Previous Educational Certificates
selection_process: Application submission is entirely online through the website of the Higher Education Development National Center.
Initial review to ensure eligibility criteria are met.
If documents meet requirements, a link for online testing is sent.
Shortlisted applicants will be interviewed online by representatives of the Ministry of Science and Higher Education, the Operator, and universities.
scholarship_info: Host institutions: Universities in Kazakhstan. A list of participating universities is available.
Educational programs offered in various languages and areas of professional activity.
Admissions operator is Higher Education Development National Center MSHE RK.
Applications must be completed in Kazakh, Russian, or English.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: For the 2025/2026 academic year, with results announced July 31, 2025.

basic_info.study_country: Various African countries (Kenya, Algeria, Nigeria, Cameroon, Benin)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded opportunities covering tuition, accommodation, living expenses, living stipends, travel, and the costs of research and books. The African Union Commission will offer full scholarships to successful African candidates.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Young, qualified, talented and enterprising applicants from African countries and the African diaspora. Must be a citizen of an African country. Candidates for the Master in Conference Interpreting and Translation programmes are required to have excellent knowledge of at least two of the African Union’s official languages (Arabic, English, French, Spanish and Portuguese) or at least one of the African Union’s official languages (Arabic, English, French, Portuguese, Kiswahili and Spanish).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Masters programmes (e.g., Geosciences - Mineral Exploration/Petroleum, Health Sciences - Reproductive Health, Plant Breeding, Basic Science, Technology and Innovation, Life and Earth Sciences - including Health and Agriculture, Water and Energy Sciences - including Climate Change, Governance, Humanities and Social Sciences, Conference Interpreting and Translation) and Doctoral studies.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Candidates for the Master in Conference Interpreting and Translation programmes are required to have excellent knowledge of at least two of the African Union’s official languages (Arabic, English, French, Spanish and Portuguese) or at least one of the African Union’s official languages (Arabic, English, French, Portuguese, Kiswahili and Spanish).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.0 (or equivalent) in undergraduate studies.
academic_requirements.required_degree: For Master’s: Undergraduate degree from a recognized university, with at least a second-class upper division or its equivalent, in a relevant field. For PhD: A Master’s degree in a relevant field from PAU or any internationally recognized university.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Excellent knowledge of at least two of the African Union’s official languages (Arabic, English, French, Spanish and Portuguese) or at least one of the African Union’s official languages (Arabic, English, French, Portuguese, Kiswahili and Spanish) for Master in Conference Interpreting and Translation programmes.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendation letter from ONE of his/her former University lecturers.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Maximum 28 years old for male and 30 years old for female applicants.
additional_requirements.gender_requirement: Age limits differ by gender (28 for male, 30 for female).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Passport or National I.D. card (personal details page); Certified true copies of relevant certificates, transcripts (from university and high school).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Certified true copies of relevant certificates, transcripts (from university and high school); Passport or National I.D. card (personal details page); Recommendation letter from ONE of his/her former University lecturers.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Pan African University (PAU) is an initiative of the Heads of State and Government of the African Union, inspired by major policy frameworks of the AUC including the Vision of the African Union. It offers scholarships to young, talented and enterprising applicants from African countries and the African diaspora. The University has five Institutes located in the five sub-regions of Africa, hosting various programs.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Call for scholarships applications for Academic Year 2026-2027. Call launched on 15 November with a deadline of 15 December 2025.

funding_info.funding_details: fully funded

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 30 Students

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Asian students from all Asian countries except Turkey; citizens of Asian nations; applicants who show potential and leadership qualities are encouraged to apply.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: STEM fields (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics)

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 2.7 on a 4.0 scale (=2.87 out of 4.3, 3.0 out of 4.5, 82.9 out of 100)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree to apply for Master's and PhD programs

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Students can apply without knowing Korean.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Max. 2 letters
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants who show potential and leadership qualities are encouraged to apply.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Statement of Purpose, Recommendation letter (Max. 2 letters), Certificate of Bachelor's degree or Bachelor's Diploma (Original), Bachelor's degree Transcript (Original)
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The POSCO Asia Fellowship provides scholarships, facilitates academic research, and publishes.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are now being accepted for the 2026 academic year.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarships. Monthly stipends of €1,350 (for Master's) or €1,400 (for Doctoral candidates) plus a mobility allowance of €100 and a further lump sum of €20 (for Doctoral candidates). Additional lump sum payments of €100 are available to cover research costs. An annual grant of €16,800 is offered to cover living and research expenses, including health. Tuition fees for international students are not covered.

timeline_info.application_deadline: 1 October (for grants beginning in the summer semester of the following year, starting 1 April). For 2026 scholarships, the deadline is 1 October, 2025.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 60 scholarships for the 2025/26 academic year.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to domestic and international students of all disciplines. Available for bachelor's (especially for refugees), master's, and doctoral degrees. Applicants must be highly qualified undergraduate or doctoral students from Germany and abroad. Strong commitment to social justice and political engagement in line with the Foundation's values is required. Applicants should deal with the Foundation's topics, such as socialism and democracy. Applicants must have at least one year remaining in their study program.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All disciplines
field_restrictions.restrictions: Applicants should deal with the Foundation's topics, such as socialism and democracy.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's, Master's, or Doctoral degrees

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience or voluntary experience related to their field of study.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: German level B2 required

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Letter of reference written by a university teacher (may be sent directly), providing information about academic performance.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Bachelor's degree available for refugees.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: High academic achievement (above-average grades). A personal statement of 500 words which MUST include reference to the student's social, economic background.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application for scholarships are done online. Requires a letter of reference and a personal statement of 500 words.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Rosa Luxemburg Stiftung Scholarships are fully funded scholarships for international students, available for bachelor's, master's, and doctoral degrees in Germany. The scholarship duration varies depending on research needs, up to a maximum of two years.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application deadline is 1 October for grants beginning in the summer semester (1 April) of the next year.

funding_info.funding_details: fully funded

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 15 scholarships

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: international students (except Thai citizens), excellent international students, Pakistani/AJK nationals (for specific HEC call)

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Sciences: Chemistry, Biology, Biological Sciences, Molecular Biology, Environmental Sciences; Medical Sciences: Medicine, Medical Technology

academic_requirements.min_gpa: at least 3.00
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's degree

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: demonstrated English proficiency, preferably on one of two recognized test of language proficiency (TOEFL, IELTS)

additional_requirements.other_requirements: bright

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: prestigious
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Academic Year 2026-2027

basic_info.provider: Korean Advanced Institute of Science and Technology (KAIST)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship for international students pursuing undergraduate, master's, and Ph.D. degrees. All expenses are covered by the program.
covered_expenses: Monthly Allowance of 350,000 KRW (for Master's Course and living expenses)

timeline_info.application_deadline: October 23, 2025 (general deadline); January 6, 2026 (for Fall 2026 Regular Admission Round); January 8, 2026 (another mention for 2026)
timeline_info.opening_date: Currently open for Spring and Fall semesters 2025 and 2026

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Must be international students. For Master's, applicants must hold or expect to hold a bachelor’s degree before enrollment. For Doctoral, applicants must hold or expect to hold a bachelor’s and master’s degree before enrollment. For Spring 2026 undergraduate, applicants must have completed or will graduate from high school by February 2026. For Fall 2026 undergraduate, applicants must have completed or will graduate from high school by August 2026. To maintain the scholarship, a GPA above 2.0 out of 4.3 (or 2.7 out of 4.3 after freshman year) is required during studies.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All subjects; specifically mentioned: Physics, Mathematical Sciences, Chemistry, Biological Sciences

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.5/4.0 or higher (80%+ on most grading systems) for initial application
academic_requirements.required_degree: High school diploma (for undergraduate), Bachelor's degree (for Master's), Master's degree (for Doctoral)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: TOEFL iBT: 83; IELTS: 6.5; TOEIC: 720; TEPS: 326. English Proficiency Waiver is possible. Both TOEFL iBT and IELTS are generally accepted.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants of Korean origin who completed their entire education outside of Korea must submit a Certificate of the Facts Concerning the Entry & Exit.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Top 10–15% of their graduating class; Strong grades in mathematics, science, and English. Must submit an online application and pay an application fee. Applicants admitted to the university are automatically considered for the scholarship, but should check the KAIST scholarship on the Statement of Financial Resources online admissions application.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Scanned documents (general); Certificate of the Facts Concerning the Entry & Exit (for Korean origin applicants)
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants admitted to the university will be automatically considered for the KAIST scholarship.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: KAIST has over 11,688 students, including 915 international students from 92 countries. Offers scholarships for undergraduate, master's, and Ph.D. degrees.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are open for Spring and Fall semesters 2025 and 2026 intakes.

basic_info.provider: Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the National Agency for Academic Exchange NAWA

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship for second-cycle (Master's) studies or a preparatory course.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Citizens of developing countries (specific list implied but not provided) who wish to take up second-degree (Master's) studies in Poland. Applicants must not have Polish citizenship and must not have applied for Polish citizenship.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All full-time second-cycle study programmes offered by Polish universities supervised by the Minister of Science and Higher Education, regardless of a specific scientific field.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Cannot be a Polish citizen or have applied for Polish citizenship. Cannot study at a private (non-public) university in Poland.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree for admission to second-cycle (Master's) studies.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Language proficiency certificate (IELTS/TOEFL or equivalent) is mentioned. Proof of English proficiency is not mandatory but recommended: TOEFL 40; IELTS 5.5 for other programs.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Letters of recommendation (mentioned, but requirement details incomplete)
additional_requirements.other_requirements: NAWA Scholarship Beneficiaries are required to submit annual reports for the previous academic year.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Language proficiency certificate (IELTS/TOEFL or equivalent), Curriculum Vitae (CV), Motivation letter, Letters of recommendation (if applicable), Grade average from bachelor's degree, Self-presentation.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Substantive assessment based on criteria such as grade average from bachelor's degree (up to 70 points) and motivation & academic goals presented in your self-presentation (up to 30 points).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The objective of the Programme is to promote socio-economic progress of developing countries by raising the level of knowledge and education of their citizens.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Studies begin from the winter semester.

basic_info.official_name: Confucius Institute Scholarship (International Chinese Language Teachers Scholarship)
basic_info.provider: CLEC (Center for Language Education and Cooperation)

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship offers generous benefits, including full tuition, accommodation support, monthly living allowances (excluding four-week study program students), and comprehensive medical insurance.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Varies by year and available funding.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be non-Chinese citizens, friendly to China, and not have benefited from similar scholarships within the last three years.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Chinese language and culture, International Chinese Language Education, Chinese Language and Literature, Teaching Chinese as a Foreign Language, Linguistics, Chinese Language majors.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 2.5 or above
academic_requirements.required_degree: Varies by program: Senior high school diploma, Bachelor's degree, or Master's degree (in Teaching Chinese as a Foreign Language, Linguistics, or International Chinese Language Education).

experience_requirements.min_years: Varies by program: more than 2 years' work experience in Chinese language education, or at least 3 years of full-time work experience in international Chinese language education or related fields.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Chinese language teachers, international Chinese language education or related fields.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: HSK and HSKK test scores are required, with specific minimums varying by program track. Examples include: HSK Level 3 (180-270), HSK Level 4 (210), HSK Level 5 (210), HSK Level 6 (200). HSKK Intermediate Level (60) or Advanced Level (60) may also be required.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two reference letters from professors or associate professors are required for Doctor's Degree in International Chinese Language Education and MTCSOL programs.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Between 16 and 35 on September 1, 2025. Applicants currently working as Chinese language teachers shall not be over 45.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Priority will be given to applicants who provide an HSKK test score or meet other specific criteria.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application Form for International Chinese Language Teacher Scholarship and electronic attachments. A 'List of Application Materials' is mentioned but not detailed.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Implies an interview is part of the process.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The program sponsors foreign students, scholars, and Chinese language teachers to study Chinese. It funds future and current teachers of Chinese, offering multiple program tracks from four-year degrees to short-term training. 180 opportunities are mentioned for Master level programs.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Programs generally commence in September (e.g., September 2025, also September 2020 mentioned for some). Enrollment is typically every year in September. Maximum duration varies by program: 4 academic years, 11 months, or 2 academic years.

basic_info.provider: Government of the Czech Republic; Ministry of Education, Youth and Sports; Ministry of Foreign Affairs; Ministry of Health

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded programs, covers all expenses. Monthly stipend amounts: CZK 16,000 for Master's Degree students, CZK 17,000 for PhD Degree students, CZK 15,000 (approximately EUR 585) for PhD degree. General scholarship amount of 14,000 CZK, including housing and pocket money. The Ministry of Education, Youth and Sports (MEYS) reserves the right to amend scholarship awards.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Not specified (A total of six scholarships are mentioned as available in one source, but generally not specified for the overall program)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Scholarships are offered to foreign nationals from selected developing countries (e.g., Belarus (democratic forces), Bosnia and Herzegovina) within the framework of the Foreign Development Assistance Programme. Applicants must be officially nominated by relevant authorities in eligible countries. Scholarships are for full-time studies in Czech or English at public universities, targeting Bachelor's, Master's, and Doctoral studies (Bachelor's for some countries). Applicants must choose study or research areas relevant to their current or previous academic focus.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Study or research areas relevant to the applicant's current or previous academic focus. Examples include Master Economics and Finance (MEF) and other master's study programmes at VŠE.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD. For PhD applicants, a legalised copy of a foreign diploma or similar document proving due completion of a Follow-up Master’s Study programme is required.

experience_requirements.min_years: Minimum of 3,000 hours of demonstrated work experience. For university teachers, researchers, and artists: relatively limited professional experience (typically 7 years or less). Candidates without a PhD degree (or its equivalent) and with more than 4 years of work experience (but not more than 7 years) may be considered under special circumstances.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience, professional experience, leadership experience, university teachers, researchers, artists (PhD studies are considered as work experience).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Scholarships are available without IELTS.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants from Belarus (democratic forces). Academic staff can apply. Applicants must be officially nominated by relevant authorities in eligible countries.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: A certified Czech translation and legal copy of birth certificate. Medical confirmation (no more than two months old) with certified translation into English or Czech. Affirmation on Return to the Country of Origin upon Completion of Studies. Declaration about the Acceptance of the Terms and Conditions Governing the Granting of Scholarships. Declaration about the Acceptance of the Terms and Conditions Governing the Provision of Health Services. Photocopy of passport (if issued).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application Form for a Scholarship of the Government of the Czech Republic, CV with a focus on studies and employment, Photocopy of passport, Declaration about the Acceptance of the Terms and Conditions Governing the Granting of Scholarships, Declaration about the Acceptance of the Terms and Conditions Governing the Provision of Health Services, Affirmation on Return to the Country of Origin upon Completion of Studies, Legalised copy of birth certificate with a certified translation into the Czech language, Medical confirmation about the applicant’s health (no more than two months old) with a certified translation into English or into Czech, Legalised copy of a foreign diploma or similar document proving due completion of a Follow-up Master’s Study programme with a certified translation into the Czech language (for PhD), Legalised copy of a Diploma Supplement or list of completed subjects and examinations including their scope and grades (marks) achieved with a certified translation into the Czech (for PhD), Admission letter or proof of application to a Czech university, Academic transcripts.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants are officially nominated by relevant authorities in eligible countries.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Government of the Czech Republic offers scholarships within the framework of its Foreign Development Assistance Programme and Foreign Development Cooperation. Governed by a Resolution of the Government of the Czech Republic No. 870 as of 27th November 2024, as part of a joint foreign development cooperation program pursued by the Ministry of Education, Youth and Sports, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, and Ministry of Health. Also governed by Government Resolution No 301 as of 25 April 2012 on the Strategy for Granting Government Scholarships for Students from Developing Countries in 2013 – 2018.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarships are for the Academic Year 2026/2027.

basic_info.provider: State Education Development Agency of Latvia (VIAA)

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship provides a monthly stipend of €500 for Bachelor's and Master's students, and €700 for PhD students. It does not fully cover all study-related expenses, specifically tuition fees, travel expenses to and from Latvia, and insurance costs. Students are expected to cover additional expenses.

timeline_info.application_deadline: 1 April 2025 (for studies). The next call for applications for studies will be 1 April 2026.
timeline_info.opening_date: 1 February (for the annual call, e.g., 1 February 2026 for the 2026 call).
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 94 scholarships awarded annually (e.g., 94 in 2024/2025). For 2025/2026, recipients include 14 from Ukraine, 10 from Azerbaijan, 10 from Germany, 9 from Finland, 9 from Uzbekistan, 7 from Turkey, 5 from Italy. Top institutions include Rīga Stradiņš University (28), Riga Technical University (23), University of Latvia (14), Turiba University (5).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to foreign students, researchers, and teaching staff from countries that have signed bilateral agreements on co-operation in education and science with Latvia, or countries that offer scholarships for Latvian citizens. Citizens from 39 eligible countries can apply. Applicants must be students, academic, or research staff of foreign higher education institutions.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Studies, research, and participation in summer schools in Latvian higher education institutions.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.0 or equivalent
academic_requirements.required_degree: Available for Bachelor's, Master's, and PhD students. A Master's degree in a relevant field is required for PhD programs.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Relevant academic or professional experience is required for research and teaching staff applicants.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must have a good academic record. A strong personal statement or essay is required.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Personal statement or essay.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Latvian State Scholarships are offered by the Latvian government, administered by the State Education Development Agency (VIAA), to foreign students, researchers, and teaching staff. These scholarships support studies, research, and participation in summer schools at Latvian higher education institutions. Eligibility is based on bilateral agreements between Latvia and the applicant's home country, or if the home country offers scholarships to Latvian citizens. The scholarship provides a monthly stipend for living costs but does not cover tuition fees, travel, or insurance.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The annual call for applications typically opens on February 1st and closes on April 1st. For the 2025 academic year, the deadline was April 1, 2025. The next call for the 2026 academic year will be open from February 1 to April 1, 2026.

basic_info.official_name: Royal Thai Government Scholarships (King's, Queen's, GMS)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded. Master's Programs cover tuition, accommodation, and living expenses for 22 months, with a total value of approximately 1.10 million Thai Baht. Ph.D. programs cover tuition, registration fees, accommodation, and a bursary for living expenses for the entire period of 41 months (7 semesters).

timeline_info.application_deadline: 20th July 2025; 20 December 2025 (for January 2026 Intake); early January 2026
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 37 Awards Given Annually

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to qualified candidates with excellent academic qualifications from Thailand and other Asian countries. Doctoral programs are for candidates with excellent undergraduate and graduate achievements from priority countries (Bhutan, Timor-Leste, ASEAN countries, Other Asian countries). Master's programs are for candidates with excellent undergraduate achievements from any Asian country. Applicants must have an outstanding education record in a 4-year undergraduate program from an accredited institution in related fields.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Doctoral programs in any Academic Program offered at the School of Engineering and Technology (SET) and the School of Environment, Resources, and Development (SERD). Master’s Degree in any of the academic programs offered at the School of Engineering and Technology (SET) and the School of Management (SOM).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: For Bachelor’s degree: > 2.75 (or equivalent) from QS 1,000 World University Ranking or QS Top 350 Asian Universities Ranking, or > 3.0 (or equivalent) from other universities. For Master’s degree: > 3.5 (or equivalent).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor’s degree (4-year undergraduate program) for Master's programs; Bachelor’s and Master’s degree for Doctoral programs.

experience_requirements.min_years: Minimum of one-year's relevant work experience for MBA programs. Some sources mention a minimum of 2 years of post-degree work experience relevant to their field (from a 2020 scholarship page).
experience_requirements.accepted_types: relevant work experience; post-degree work experience relevant to their field

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS 6.0 (Overall and Writing bands) or AIT EET 6.0 (or ≥ 6.0).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two recommendation letters
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Research proposal

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Two recommendation letters, Research proposal
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Non-binding scholarships, awarded annually to top-ranked candidates from Asia.

basic_info.study_country: OAS Member State, with the exception of the candidate’s sponsoring country.

funding_info.funding_details: Up to $10,000 USD per academic year, for a maximum of 2 academic years. OAS scholarships do not cover dependent expenses or fully fund all study-related costs. Partner universities may offer additional tuition waivers (e.g., 50% of international student tuition fees, or specific amounts like $11,400 USD per year, or full waivers for a limited number of students).
covered_expenses: Health and life insurance (e.g., USD 820 per year)
Stipend for living expenses (e.g., USD 6,123 per year)

timeline_info.application_deadline: General OAS/DFATD application deadline: March 13, 2025. Specific partnership programs have different deadlines (e.g., OAS-Colorado State University Bachelor's priority: July 15, 2025; OAS-Universidad Europea Maestrías: September 1, 2025; OAS-UWI: June 30, 2025).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be citizens of an OAS Member State. Scholarships are for full-time studies at an accredited university or higher learning institution in an OAS Member State, excluding the candidate's sponsoring country. Studies must begin between January 1 and December 31 of the scholarship year (e.g., 2025). For undergraduate scholarships, applicants must be enrolled and eligible to graduate within the last two academic years of their program, or have an admission letter for the final two years of a bachelor's degree program. No single Member State may host more than 40% of the total scholarship recipients.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Undergraduate (last two years only), Graduate Studies, Graduate Research, Master's, Doctoral, and some Certificate/Diploma programs. Specific programs include Master of Distance Education, Doctor of Education (Ed.D) in Distance Education, Master of Arts in Integrated Studies, Master of Science in Information Systems.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Medical fields, its specialties, and other related fields are generally not eligible (e.g., Allergy and Immunology).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Above the minimum standard required by the university.
academic_requirements.required_degree: For undergraduate, must be in the last two years of a bachelor's degree program. For graduate, must be pursuing Master's, Doctoral, or Graduate Research leading to a degree. Some certificate and diploma programs are also eligible.

experience_requirements.min_years: For specific programs (e.g., OAS-Colorado State University), at least 2 years of work experience is required.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Related fields such as international development, poverty alleviation, sustainability.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must be in good standing (implied).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online scholarship application through the OAS Fellowship Management System. Admission letter from a university or confirmation of credit transfers (especially for undergraduate applicants).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Includes reception of pre-selected lists from National Liaison Offices (ONEs), review of applications, reception of admission letters, meeting of Ad Hoc Scholarship Selection Committee, announcement of awards, and disbursement of funds.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The OAS Academic Scholarships Program awards scholarships to citizens of OAS member states for full-time undergraduate (last two years), graduate studies, or graduate research leading to a degree at an accredited institution in an OAS member state, excluding the applicant's sponsoring country. Studies must commence between January 1 and December 31 of the award year.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Call launched: December 9, 2024. Deadline for ONEs to submit pre-selected candidates: April 11, 2025. Application review & admission letter reception: April 14-30, 2025. Selection Committee meeting: May 5, 2025. Awards announced: May 23, 2025. Scholarship award & fund disbursement: June-October 2025.

basic_info.provider: Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade, co-ordinated by Tempus Public Foundation

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded opportunity, offers full tuition, stipend, and accommodation for international students.

timeline_info.application_deadline: January – February 2026 (for online application and required documents submission)
timeline_info.opening_date: November 14th or 15th (for 2026/2027 academic year, implied November 2025)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Nearly 4,500 scholarships were awarded for the last call (more than 66,000 applications received). In 2019-2020, more than 4100 scholarships were awarded. Number of awards for 2026/2027 is not specified.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to foreign students from nearly 90 countries across Europe, Asia, Africa, and the Americas (check official list). Applicants must ensure the selected programme is eligible under the agreement between Hungary and their home country’s sending partner. Specific scholarship types and study fields are determined by educational cooperation programmes with the specific Sending Partner. Current Stipendium Hungaricum scholarship holders applying for a new programme for 2025/26 academic year have a specific application path. Includes a 'Students at Risk Subprogramme'.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Almost all academic fields and majors are available for undergraduate, master's, one-tier master's, and doctoral programmes. Specific examples include Communication and Media Studies (SH Sport), English and American Studies (SH Sport), Applied Economics (SH Sport), Computer Science (SH Sport), Computer Science Engineering (SH Sport), International Public Service Studies (SH Sport), Hungarian University of Sports Science - Dissertation Scholarship, and music study programmes (including specialisation courses after bachelor's and master's). University of Nyíregyháza offers a wide range of degree programmes.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Applicants are eligible only for scholarship types and study fields determined in the educational cooperation programmes between Hungary and their specific Sending Partner. The scientific fields, level of education, and number of applicants vary by country.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: For continued state-funded support for high academic performance: minimum GPA of 4 (Good) under Hungary’s 5-point grading system (equivalent to 'B' under international grading standards) after the first semester.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Scholarship is available for Bachelor's, Master's, One-Tier Master's, and Doctoral programmes. Bachelor’s or master’s graduates may be granted permission to pursue further studies at the next academic level abroad.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Scholarship holders are entitled and often required to participate in an internship opportunity as a prerequisite of their last semester, just before graduating. This is for during the scholarship, not an application requirement.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Language certificate requirements vary by study programme. Examples include: CEFR B2, Cambridge FCE or above, IELTS 6.0, TOEFL 65, TOEFL iBT 72, TOEIC 785, Duolingo 100 (for BA International Relations); IELTS overall band score 5.0 or higher (valid for 2 years) (for BSc Computer Science Engineering); TOEFL iBT (min. 60 points), IELTS Academic (min. score of 5.0), Cambridge (min. 154) (for BA Performance).

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: The minimum credit requirement does not apply to students of doctoral schools. There is a 'Students at Risk Subprogramme'.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Scholarship holders must comply with the Stipendium Hungaricum Programme Operational Regulations, including academic progress requirements. Applicants and current students are encouraged to review 'Rights and Obligations' and 'Scholarship Agreement' documents regularly.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Applicants must submit a completed online application and required documents through the Tempus Public Foundation portal. Further documents may be required directly by the university if nominated by the home country. An Application Guide is available.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applications are reviewed jointly by the sending partner (in the applicant’s home country) and the Hungarian host institution. Applicants are informed of their results by the ministry of education of their country or by the national scholarship office/agency. Nomination by the home country is a key step.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The scholarship programme was launched by the Hungarian Government in 2013. It includes a State-Funded Support Program for scholarship holders with high academic performance. For the last call, over 66,000 applications were received, and nearly 4,500 scholarships were awarded. In 2019-2020, more than 4100 scholarships were awarded.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2026/2027 academic year open in November (14th or 15th, implied 2025). The online application and required documents submission period is January – February 2026.

basic_info.official_name: Education for Sustainable Energy Development (ESED) Scholarship Program

funding_info.funding_details: US$21,000 per year for up to two years

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 6-10 scholarships are going to be awarded annually

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be citizens of developing countries (listed by DAC/OECD), planning to undertake full-time master's-level or post-doctoral level studies. Students who have already received full funding for their studies are not eligible, but those with partial scholarships may apply. The scholarship is not retroactive.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master's or Post-Doctoral level studies in sustainable energy development, including fields such as electric transportation, zero-carbon energy, advanced electricity technologies, and political science.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's or Post-Doctoral level

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The ESED scholarship program, also known as the GSEP Scholarship, aims to inspire the next generation of innovators. It is not retroactive and covered tuition fees and living expenses for the 2022-2023 year.

funding_info.funding_details: Provides full financial support for social entrepreneurs undertaking an Oxford MBA. It is a merit-based program recognizing the financial strain of an MBA for those committed to social innovation and impact.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Up to 4 scholarships annually (some sources mention 5)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: For social entrepreneurs interested in an Oxford MBA to enhance skills for social change. Candidates should be committed to a career in social innovation and impact, ready to utilize the Oxford MBA and Skoll Centre community to expand social impact. Must articulate how being part of Oxford, Saïd Business School MBA, and Skoll Centre community would advance professional growth and ability to create systemic social or environmental impact. Financial need is also a factor.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: MBA (focused on social/environmental solutions, social innovation, and impact)
field_restrictions.restrictions: Applicants from all academic and professional backgrounds are eligible.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.5 (approximately 90%) or 3.7 out of 4, with most successful candidates achieving higher.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree

experience_requirements.min_years: Minimum of two years of relevant work experience, preferably at least 3 years.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Starting and growing a social venture, or leading a social venture.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English Language Proficiency (IELTS/TOEFL if required by Oxford). GMAT score recommended 650 or above, with an average of 690+ for successful candidates.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two professional/academic references (recommendation letters).
additional_requirements.career_plan: Must articulate how the Oxford MBA and Skoll Centre community would advance professional growth and ability to create systemic social or environmental impact.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: In rare cases, partial scholarships may be awarded.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Completion of Skoll Scholarship essay, supporting statement, online assessment, and a separate Skoll Scholarship application (in addition to the MBA application).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: CV, academic transcripts, recommendation letters (two professional/academic references), English proficiency results (if required), supporting statement, Skoll Scholarship essay.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A prestigious opportunity for social entrepreneurs to pursue an Oxford MBA with full financial support and access to the Skoll community. It aims to enhance and broaden skills for more effective social change. Offered by the Skoll Foundation and awarded by the Skoll Centre.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship for the 2026-2027 academic year (or 2026).

basic_info.provider: Swiss Confederation; Federal Commission for Scholarships for Foreign Students (FCS); State Secretariat for Education, Research and Innovation (SERI)

funding_info.funding_details: CHF 1,920/month for Research, PhD & Art Scholarships. Also mentioned: CHF 600 to CHF 2,000 per semester or reduced tuition fees.
covered_expenses: mandatory Swiss health insurance (for non-EU/EFTA awardees)
practical benefits that make settling in Switzerland easier

timeline_info.number_of_awards: around 350 highly talented foreign students and researchers

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Mainly intended for talented early career researchers (ECRs) from abroad who have already completed their Master's degree or PhD. Also for young researchers from abroad who have completed a master’s degree or PhD, and foreign artists. Eligibility requirements vary from country to country. The scholarships encourage international exchange and research cooperation between Switzerland and over 180 other countries. For Fulbright/Swiss Government Excellence Scholarships, both Fulbright and Swiss Government/Federal Commission for Scholarship (ESKAS) grant rules/eligibility apply.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Full-time research, PhD studies, postdoctoral research, and arts education. Post-graduate researchers in any discipline. Research or study at all Swiss cantonal universities, universities of applied sciences, the two federal institutes of technology, the four research institutes, the Graduate Institute, or public teaching and research institutes. For Fulbright applicants, all disciplines, and for a first master's degree program in the Arts.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.5 or higher (cumulative GPA)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's degree (or equivalent) for research/postdoc scholarships; Bachelor's degree for art scholarships. Generally, a Master's degree or PhD is required for researchers.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English language proficiency (e.g., IELTS or TOEFL scores) is often required. Proficiency in the language of instruction (English, German, French, or Italian) is required. IELTS requirement is waived for applicants whose degrees were completed in the English language. A Foreign Language Evaluation (FLE) form is recommended but not required for Fulbright applicants.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants must work full-time in the field of global health and have at least 10 years of professional experience (this appears to be a specific requirement, possibly not general for all scholarships).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Every applicant must have an academic supervisor in Switzerland. Candidates are responsible for arranging their own affiliations with a host professor. If applying for a research fellowship (not PhD), include a short CV from your current home university supervisor.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: CV highlighting academic achievements, extracurricular activities, and relevant work experience; motivation letter; short CV from current home university supervisor (for research fellowship, not PhD).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Recipients are selected by the Federal Commission for Scholarships for Foreign Students (FCS). Decisions for the 2025–2026 academic year will be announced by the end of May 2026 at the latest.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: International scholarships offered by the Swiss Confederation to support foreign students and researchers, encouraging international exchange and research cooperation between Switzerland and over 180 other countries. The program supports full-time research, PhD studies, postdoctoral research, and arts education. Application is free of charge. Warning against fake Swiss Federal Government Scholarships advertised by e-mail or published on social medias.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the academic year 2026–2027 are open/will soon officially open. The application period is generally from September 15 to November 30.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 21 (in 2023 and 2025 academic years)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: ONLY students who are nationals of Zambia, Zimbabwe or Malawi, who hold permanent residency (implied). Postgraduate applicants (Master's only) with limited opportunities for doctoral extensions. Must hold an Honours degree (First or Upper Second Class) or at least a Merit (equivalent to a good 2.1 from a UK university) in their first degree. Preference is given to applicants with a Distinction or Merit (Upper Second Class) in their undergraduate degree.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Developmental disciplines including Medicine, Biomedical, Computer Science

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Distinction or Merit (Upper Second Class) in their undergraduate degree, or First or Upper Second Class Honours degree, or at least a Merit (equivalent to a good 2.1 from a UK university) in their first degree.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Honours degree (First or Upper Second Class) or equivalent undergraduate degree. Exclusively for Master’s-level study, with limited opportunities for doctoral extensions.

experience_requirements.min_years: at least one year's work experience
experience_requirements.accepted_types: work experience

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Academic Reference required. Scanned and returned by email to scholarships@beittrust.org.uk. All references will remain strictly confidential.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Not all interviewees will be awarded scholarships.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Academic-Reference-2026-27.pdf, ScholarshipMainApplicationForm-17.01.2020.docx, online application process that must be completed in one session.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Selection is highly competitive. Interviews: Week of 20 April 2026. Not all interviewees will be awarded scholarships.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Beit Trust Postgraduate Scholarships 2026/2027 for study in South Africa & United Kingdom (Fully Funded).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Course Start Dates: UK Universities – September 2026

basic_info.official_name: Open Society Foundations Civil Society Leadership Awards

funding_info.funding_details: Fully-funded master's scholarships.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Individuals with academic excellence and a commitment to social change. Students from 17 countries across Africa, Eurasia, South-East Asia and the Middle East, including citizens of Afghanistan, Azerbaijan, Belarus, Cambodia, Democratic Republic of Congo, Egypt. Applicants must demonstrate a clear commitment to their home country or region in supporting open society development.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Excellent academic record
academic_requirements.required_degree: Earned bachelor's degree (as of May 15, 2019 for 2020 cycle); admitted to master's degree program.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Commitment to social change, civil society leadership potential, commitment to home country or region in supporting open society development.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proficiency in the language of instruction (English, French or German) at a level required for admission by host universities.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Demonstrate maturity, intellectual curiosity, flexibility, and civil society leadership potential. Be able to receive and maintain a visa or study permit as required by the host country. Be able to participate in an intensive pre-academic summer school in July or August 2020 and start their Master’s degree program in August or September 2020 (specific to 2020 cycle).

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Open Society will notify candidates and assist with the university application process.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Civil Society Leadership Awards (CSLA) provide fully-funded master's scholarships for those with academic excellence and a commitment to social change. The OSF CSLA is a scholarship for students from 17 countries across Africa, Eurasia, South-East Asia and the Middle East who are admitted to master's degree. The program covers tuition, living expenses, travel, and academic support, enabling students to focus on their studies and community impact.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The Open Society Scholarship Programs welcomed its first Civil Society Leadership Awards (CSLA) scholars. Master's degree programs typically start in August or September.

basic_info.official_name: Invest Your Talent in Italy (IYT) Scholarship

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship. Covers tuition, monthly stipend, and includes internships. Provides 900 EUR per month starting from the 1st of October for 9 months (total 8100 EUR) or 9,000 Euro/year. Full scholarship packages include subsistence allowance, fee-waiver, and dedicated student support services. Students are responsible for round trip flight tickets, health insurance, and dormitory expenses.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: For the academic year 2024-2025: 33 scholarship renewals and 39 new scholarships. (Note: 250 master’s programs across various disciplines are eligible for the program, not the number of awards.)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students who are citizens, effectively living, in one of the following countries: Armenia, Azerbaijan, Brazil, Colombia, Egypt, Ethiopia, Ghana, India, Indonesia, Iran, Kazakhstan, Mexico, Republic of Korea, People’s Republic of China (PRC), Tunisia, Turkey, Vietnam.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master's degree programs in Engineering, Advanced Technologies, Design, Architecture, Economics, Management, Business Management, Information Technologies, Aerospace Engineering, Data Science, Cybersecurity.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Targeted at students enrolling in English-taught Master's degree programmes only.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Average GPA 3.0 out of 4.0 or equivalent
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree (to enroll in Master's programs)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Minimum B2 level English language certification (IELTS or TOEFL) is required.

additional_requirements.age_limits: Applicants must be born after 1 January 1998.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must first complete a pre-application process at their chosen university and meet its admission procedures. A letter of acceptance from the relevant Italian University is required. Compulsory attendance of an Italian language course and a full-time, three-month internship in an Italian company are required during the scholarship. Students are required to buy a health insurance policy to cover any expenses for sickness or injuries for the whole duration of the scholarship and stay in Italy. The high degree of commitment required by the IYT program does not allow participation in other international training courses offered by Universities.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: University Transcript of exams (with CFUs), English language certificate (IELTS or TOEFL), translated documents and original copies, letter of acceptance from the relevant Italian University.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Results Announced: May –
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: This is the 10th edition of the program for A.Y. 2025/2026. The program aims at promoting the internationalization of the Italian university system as a center of excellence by giving foreign students opportunities for a fulfilling educational path and successful future careers. Scholarship duration is 9 months, up to 4 semesters. It can be renewed upon achieving 30 ECTs in the first year, providing proof of regular attendance of Italian language classes, and providing the Italian company’s internship declaration. Renewal application must be submitted via the platform by July 20th, 2026 (for a specific year mentioned) by uploading the University Transcript of exams (with CFUs) and Certificate of Attendance of the Italian Language Course offered by the Universities.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications Open: January 23rd, 2025; Deadline for Submission: February 24, 2025 until 12:00 (Midday, Italian Time); Results Announced: May –

basic_info.provider: ESMT Berlin, Kofi Annan Business School Foundation

funding_info.funding_details: Full Funding, covering full tuition and fees of €43,500 for MBA students, and a monthly stipend for living expenses. The total value of the fellowship is €58,000.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Up to three fellowships are available each year.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: For emerging leaders from developing countries. Candidates should show interest in studying ESMT's core competencies: innovation and technology management and sustainable business. Fellowships are granted on the basis of previous academic education and a motivation.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: One-year full-time MBA education; Master's in Management (MIM) or one year of full time MBA. Focus on ESMT's core competencies: innovation and technology management and sustainable business.
field_restrictions.restrictions: For students from developing countries.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree of any kind

experience_requirements.min_years: Minimum of three years of professional experience
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Professional experience (postgraduate)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Required: GMAT (minimum 640, GMAT code H4D-SJ-86) or GRE score. English proficiency test scores required: TOEFL minimum 95, IELTS minimum 7.0. Exemptions for applicants with a degree completed in English.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: For emerging leaders from developing countries.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Motivation (statement)

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Bachelor's degree, GMAT or GRE score, English proficiency test scores, Motivation (statement)
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Scholarships are applied for as part of your application to the program. Fellowships are granted on the basis of previous academic education and a motivation.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A fellowship grant for an emerging leader from a developing country for a one-year full-time MBA education in Berlin, Germany. The opportunity is for talented individuals.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: MBA program begins in January of each year.

basic_info.provider: Estonian Government, Ministry of Education and Research, Education and Youth Board, Estonian Centre for International Development (ESTDEV)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded (depending on program type), covers tuition fees, monthly allowance, accommodation costs, reimbursement for health. Monthly stipend of €400-€500. Minimum value of one scholarship is 1,500 euros. ESTDEV awarded 399,611 euros to 10 scholarship programmes.
covered_expenses: Accommodation in Tallinn (including internet and utilities)

timeline_info.application_deadline: April 16, 2025 (23:59, Estonian time) for 2025 application period; September 1, 2024 (23:59, Estonian time) for Master degree scholarships 2024; February 16, 2026 for full-time scholarship for all applicants (ESFUSA specific); September 19, 2025 (Turkish Scholarships Program - likely not Estonian Gov)
timeline_info.opening_date: March 17, 2025 for 2025 application period; August 1, 2024 for Master degree scholarships 2024; January 15, 2026 for USA highschool graduates (ESFUSA specific); February 1, 2026 for everyone (ESFUSA specific)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Up to seven scholarships may be awarded each year (EUAS specific); Historically, only 10% of applicants receive the award (general competitiveness)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International students, researchers, or academic staff members. For Summer and Winter School Scholarships: Bachelor's, Master's, and PhD students who have completed at least one year of studies at their home institution. For Degree and Exchange Studies Scholarships: Applicants must be citizens of eligible countries and have been accepted to study at an Estonian higher education institution. For ESFUSA scholarship: students of Estonian ancestry studying full-time in a Bachelor's or Master's degree program at an accredited academic institution in the USA, Estonia, or elsewhere (can apply maximum 6 times: 4 years of Bachelor's + 2 years of Master's).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Fields related to Estonian language and culture (for BA/undergraduate studies); Master's and PhD in any field (for Estonian Governmental Scholarships); Estonia-specific research (Estophilus); Academic researchers in a range of fields.
field_restrictions.restrictions: For Bachelor's (BA) level, scholarships can only be applied for fields related to Estonian language and culture.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Typically 3.0+ (varies by program); SSC - GPA 5.00 (2021) HSC - GPA (specific example, not general requirement)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's, Master's, PhD students, academic researchers, academic staff members. For Summer/Winter School: completed at least one year of studies at home institution.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Research activities

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must have been accepted to study at an Estonian higher education institution (for Degree and Exchange Studies Scholarships).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application form and required documents
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Highly competitive, only 10% of applicants historically receive the award. Embassy organizes interviews (for China Embassy program).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Supports international students, researchers, and academic staff for degree studies, short courses, summer/winter schools, research activities, and exchange studies at Estonian higher education institutions. Coordinated by the Education and Youth Board. Also available directly through universities.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for 2025/26 academic year are open. Master degree scholarships for 2024 opened August 1st 2024 and closed September 1st. Republic of Estonia Bilateral Scholarships 2025 applications opened March 17th 2025 and close April 16th 2025.

basic_info.provider: French Ministry for Europe and Foreign Affairs (managed by Campus France)

funding_info.funding_details: Monthly stipend: €1,181 for Master's (from January 2026), €2,100 for PhD (from January 2026). Note: one source mentioned €1,200 for Master's and €1,800 for PhD.

timeline_info.application_deadline: January 8, 2026 (for Campus France submission; internal university deadlines may vary, e.g., November 9, 2025)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 433 (370 at Master's level and 63 at Doctoral level for the 2025 academic year)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be non-French citizens. Master's applicants must not have already studied in France. Students must be nominated by a French higher education institution and accepted into a program. Exclusively for French higher education institutions. Open to candidates already enrolled in a doctoral program (joint supervision of dissertation or dual degree). Only candidates applying for the first time (at Master's/PhD level) and from one educational institution are eligible. Students already benefiting from a French government scholarship under another program are not eligible. Required level of education: equivalent to a French licence to enter a 1st year of Master’s degree, or corresponding to a French Master 1 to enter a 2nd year of Master’s degree.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Science and techniques: Biology and health, Ecological transition, Mathematics and digital, Science and engineering; Human and social sciences: French history, language and civilization, Law and political sciences, Economics and management.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Conflicting information: at least 15/20, usually 3.5 or higher, minimum 3.0 GPA. The scholarship does not specify a minimum GPA requirement, but a high rank (top 3-5%) can be a decisive factor.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's and PhD programs (Graduate study). Equivalent to a French licence to enter a 1st year of Master’s degree, or corresponding to a French Master 1 to enter a 2nd year of Master’s degree.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English proficiency (IELTS/TOEFL, if applicable) for English-taught programs. French-taught programs require recognised French tests, usually at B2 or above.

additional_requirements.age_limits: Master's applicants: born after March 31st 1998 (or under 27 years old, or up to 29 years old). PhD applicants: born after March 31st 1993 (or under 32 years old).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Scholarship duration: 12 to 36 months, depending on graduate program. For doctoral programs: max 12 months for recipients entering 2nd or 3rd year, max 18 months for recipients entering 1st or 2nd year.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Description of the course and its schedule; Diplomas and ranking (copy of last diploma(s) obtained, with ranking and other documents certifying excellence/performance, certificate of enrolment for current academic year); Reasoned opinion on the scientific quality of the thesis subject drafted by an expert (university professor/research supervisor) of the research domain concerned and not from the University of Rennes, plus expert's CV.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applications are submitted by a French higher education institution on behalf of the student. Institutions may submit a limited number of admitted student applications. It is necessary to have been offered a place at a French institution to be eligible for the scholarship. If offered a place and selected Eiffel Scholarship option, teams notify in December regarding pursuit of the Eiffel Scholarship process.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Eiffel Excellence Scholarship Program was established by the French Ministry for Europe and Foreign Affairs to enable French higher education institutions to attract top foreign students to enroll in their masters and PhD programs.
